As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and a laptop

loans.name: Oliver Del Carmen

texts.es:
Oliver del Carmen  de 39 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), ella tiene una tienda de pañales desde que se separo de su esposa el se tuvo que hacer cargo de sus dos hijos.

Por la falta de oportunidades y la idea de mantener a sus hijos con ella, tuvo invertir sus ahorros en pañales para venderlos a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación tuvo dinero para invertir más, ahora el trabaja con su hija mayor de 18 años en la venta de pañales,  cada paquete de pañal lo vende a $ 9.00. 

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una vitrina y pañales para su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio con otros artículos.
texts.en:
Oliver del Carmen is 39 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area with a deteriorating ecosystem). After she separated from her husband, she opened a store where she sells diapers because she had to take care of her two children.

Since opportunities were lacking and she needed to support her children, Oliver del Carmen invested her savings in diapers and sold them to acquaintances. Through her effort and dedication, she gradually earned more money to invest into her business. She now works with her oldest daughter, who is 18, selling diapers. Each packet of diapers sells for $9.00.

In order to continue her business, Oliver del Carmen will use her loan to buy a display cabinet and more diapers. In the future, she wants to expand her business by offering other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase diapers & a display cabinet

loans.name: Mrs. Chroeun Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeun P. is a village bank president who has been selected by seventeen people who live in Rung village Takeo province. Each member will use portion of their loan for varied ways to increase their businesses in the current year. Mrs. Chroeun P. is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Ret Nou, is a laborer. Now she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Chroeun P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed and rest of the loan she buys two piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two children whom all are studying in local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Chaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Chaka Dembélé  est âgée de 26 ans, marié  et père  de 3 enfants.  il vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Pelengana Nord de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant  pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença très tôt à faire le commerce à côté de son grand frère qui tenait une boutique de ventes d’articles divers. Ayant passé plusieurs années auprès de ce dernier, il commence à évoluer seul en menant plusieurs activités  telles la vente de céréales, de ciments, mais finit par se reconvertir dans le métier de meunier. 
Il mène cette activité depuis 7 ans et jouit d’une grande renommée dans son lieu de travail à Bagadadji. Sa clientèle est due à la qualité du service fourni. 
Dans le dessein de faire face à la demande clientèle, il a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso afin acheter un nouveau moulin (décortiqueur). Il est à son 1er prêt et   s’approvisionnera sur place à Ségou.
Monsieur  Chaka Dembélé fait toujours ses prestations au comptant  à   une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer sa facture d’électricité, son loyer et son personnel. 
Son ambition est de diversifier son activité en menant le commerce de céréales, sinon ouvrir un grand magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
Mr. Chaka Dembélé is 26 years old, married, and the father of three children. He lives with his immediate family in the Pelengana Nord neighborhood in the city of Ségou (in the fourth administrative region of Mali). Not having been able to attend school, he went into business at a very young age with his older brother, who had a store where he sold various products. After spending several years in business with his brother, he began to develop several business activities himself, such as the sale of grain and the sale of cement; he then changed his occupation to grain milling. He has been in business as a miller for 7 years and has a very good reputation in Bagadadji, his place of work. His clientele is due to the quality of service he provides. In order to meet customer demand, he has requested help from Soro Yiriwaso to buy a new mill (huller). This is his first loan, and he will purchase the mill in Ségou. Mr. Chaka Dembélé does all his business in cash, with a client base made up mostly of women. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay his electrical bill, his rent, and his employees. His ambition is to diversify his business by expanding to cereal sales, or to open a large warehouse.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a grain mill

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., 48, is married with two children living at home in the Takeo province. She raises pigs and then sells pigs at the local market, typically making $3 (USD) each day, and her husband is a carpenter. Her husband’s income is $5 each day. Kong S. would like a loan of $1000 to purchase carpenter tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase carpenter tools.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa M. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Marissa is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marissa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, comidas, como empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne, etc.
La mayoría de las integrantes de este comité son madres de familia y  quienes procuran para mantener sus hogares por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. 
 Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 2do. ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una,  además de la responsabilidad en los pagos. 
 Desean que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas por eso se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos oportunidades de progreso. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Emilce quien se dedica a la negocio de venta de productos de uso domésticos, aunque no le deja mucha ganancia le ayuda bastante para la alimentación de la familia. 
Así para ella es muy importante este negocio y quiere comprar mercaderías para cargar nuevamente el negocio, mercaderías como fideos, azúcar, arroz, bebidas, y otros.
texts.en:
The members of this committee have a variety of activities among which the following can be highlighted: clothing sales and food (turnovers, tortillas, croquettes, grilled meats, etc.) sales. Most of the members are mothers who sacrifice daily to provide their homes with needed support. The committee is in its second cycle. They have distinguished themselves with their sense of responsibility toward the group activities and meetings and for the wish each has to progress as well as in their responsibility towards repayments. They wish that their children do not go through the same employment and educational limitations they suffered so they try doubly hard to provide their children with opportunities for progress. One of the members is Emilce who sells home use articles. Although it doesn’t produce very high profits it is a help to provide food for her family. This is an important business for her, therefore, and she wants to buy merchandise to restock it. She wants such things as: noodles, sugar, rice, beverages and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, rice, beverages and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Intelegentes 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Marie es una de los miembro del Grupo Mujeres inteligente 2 y 3, un grupo  donde la mayoria de los miembros son ciudadanos haitianos dedicado a la venta de diversos productos, algunos recien emigraron y otros como Marie quien tiene alrededor de 15 años, viviendo en unos de los bateyes de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya economía depende del sector inmobiliario, de la fabrica mas grande ron del pais y la industria del Turismo, aunque este sector ha sido opacado por las nuevas zonas turisticas emergentes.  Es una madre soltera con 7 hijos de los cuales los 4 mas pequenos aun viven con ella. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido sobrevivir en un pais extranjero, ya que suele haber muchas limitantes y racismo por ser una persona de otro pais, y se ilegal y su actividad favorita es asistir a la iglesia, para alabar al Señor y leer la biblia.

Marie está muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 10 años, el cual inició con un pequeño prestamo que le hizo un amigo y con eso compro mercancias para vender. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de arroz, aceite, azucar y jugos, su negocio es un colmado, una pequeña tienda con ventas de alimentos. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para concluir el proceso para recibir su residencia dominicana. Su sueño es poder regresar a Haiti y visitar su familia y poder ayudarle con sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Marie is a member of the Mujeres Inteligente 2 & 3 group, the majority of whom are Haitian citizens who make a living buying and selling various products.  Some members only emigrated recently while others--Marie, for example--emigrated several years ago.  They live in a neighborhood of Puerto Plata, a city with an economy that depends on real estate, the country's largest rum factory and the tourist trade (which has taken a beating recently as other tourist areas have become more attractive).  Marie is a single mother with 7 children, 4 of whom still live with her.  She tells us that the greatest danger or challenge for her has been to survive in a strange country because of racism and the other barriers that she faces as an illegal immigrant from another country.  Her favorite activity is going to church to praise the Lord and read the Bible.

Marie is excited to get this second loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She met the terms for the first loan and has made great strides in growing her business.  She has operated the business for around 10 years.  She started with a small loan from a friend and bought merchandise to resell.  She plans to use the new loan to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and fruit juices.  The business is called a "colmado", a small store that stocks everyday items.  Marie plans to use her earnings to complete the process of applying for residency in the Dominican Republic.  She hopes to be able to return to Haiti to visit her family and help provide for them.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali H. M. is 38 years old, married and has five children between 18 and 4 years old. He hopes to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located at a busy market area known as Likoni in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions including the white beaches on the Indian Ocean. 

Ali has been selling cereals such as maize, beans, sorghum and peas for the last five years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable but the major challenge is that so many people are doing the same kind of business as his in the area that customers are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cereals to expand his business while meeting his customers' demands. He hopes to be a supplier of cereals in the future. He also hopes to expand his business to be able to sustain his family. He describes himself as humble.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans, sorghum and peas to resell

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up this group loan. They live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Saroeun S., a 39-year-old married woman, as the group's leader. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Saroeun S. is a farmer who owns 10 hectares of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables, but she lacks the money to support it. So, she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Phuong Da, 40 years old, works as broker who is able to earn a small income to support his family and also helps his wife on the farm. The couple has five children: one is a laborer while others are students in the local school and also help on their parents farm.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). Mary owns retail shop. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mary has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Mary include transport, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte) el brinda el servicio en su distrito y en los anexos que lo conforman. La actividad tiene mucha acogida debido a la velocidad y bajo precio que los caracteriza. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

José Luis ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantemiento y reparación de su unidad móvil, ya que el continuo uso otorgado y el mal estado de la mayor parte de caminos del lugar han hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación.
texts.en:
José Luis is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Cayaltí district, an agricultural area with considerable commercial activity located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He provides cargo and passenger transport in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to provide transport). He works in his district and the surrounding areas and the business is very good because of the speed and low price. He uses the money he earns from his work to cover the family financial expenses.

José Luis has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa which he plans to invest in the care and repair of his vehicle because its continuous use and the poor conditions of the majority of the area roads have caused some damages that require immediate repair.

loans.use: Expenses to repair and care for his mototaxi

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora G. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 36 years old, married and has one school-aged child. Leonora operates a family member's business in the food sector, making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for house completion. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Leonora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house completion

loans.name: Faith Kanini

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single lady of 36 years-old and the mother of one child. She lives in Ndundure in Emali town which is a rural town.  Most of the residents are small traders and low income earners.

She operates a general shop where she sells food items such as flour, cooking oil, tea leaves, sugar, etc. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last two years. 

She got to know about Kiva partner KADET through a friend who was already a member.  She has never borrowed from other financial institutions.
With this loan advance, she plans to add more stock of tea leaves, salt, cooking oil and flour in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, salt, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam K., 44, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of 2.5 USD per day. Her husband sells cows, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 30 USD on food and 46 USD on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase more cows for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cows for her husband to improve the business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 29 years old, married and blessed with three children. He runs a barber shop and a retail shop for a living. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to develop his business. Julius hopes to expand his shop for more income. He believes that with more income, he will provide better education for his children. Julius has requested a 15,000 KES loan to add to his stock of cooking fat, sugar, maize flour and sweets.

loans.use: to add to his inventory

loans.name: But's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members, all of whom live in Preaek Run village in Kandal province. Mrs. But B., born in 1958, is the group leader. She was selected to this position by the other members. She is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a laborer. 

Mrs. But B. sells vegetables and fruit at the local market, which is how she is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support and enlarge this business, she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to offer for sale at market.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruit to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Le'ontine

texts.en:
Le'ontine was born in 1966, and now has three children with her husband Mathieu. Although she is uneducated, her children have had the chance of an education.

Le'ontine runs a small hardware store out of her home, which she supplies from the Tokpa market, the largest in Benin. It is now 10 years since she started this store.

With this loan, her fourth from ALIDE, she will purchase new stock to resell at her store. Her aim is to develop her business further in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing new stock for her little store

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 46 years old, married and with four children.  For seven years, he has been selling furniture so as to earn a living.  He has employed two people in his business.   He also rents out houses to earn extra income.  He was previously employed as a teacher.  He hopes to own a real estate business in the future.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Srim

texts.en:
Mrs. Srim was born in 1980 and has two children who are studying in a local public school. She got married to Mr. Lay. She weaves silk cloth for selling. Besides this, she owns a general store in her local village where she can sell groceries to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice; some to sell and some for the family. 

She wants to buy a new plowing machine because in their field, it is time for plowing. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Srim is applying for a loan to buy a new plowing machine to plow the field; she will also rent this machine out to other farmers. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy a new plow machine to plow her field

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna H. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Lorna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a motor transportation service. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz C. de 44 Años  vive en el municipio de San  Jacinto, en el departamento de Bolívar, donde las manualidades  y las confecciones son actividades generadoras de ingresos,  muy usual entre las mujeres habitantes de esta población  y lógicamente Mary Luz no es ajena a ello,  porque   trabaja en su propio taller de confecciones y tiene un un punto comercial de artesanías propias de la región bien acreditado. Su familia está conformada por su esposo y por sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 24 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia y los otros dos son trabajadores independientes pues han elegido desarrollar su autonomía en todo lo les plantea la vida.
Ella se inicia en el negocio de las confecciones  y en la  venta de artesanías hace 23 años, lo cual aprendió de una tía, lo perfeccionó mediante capacitaciones con el Sena y  lo fortaleció con los financiamientos del Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual ha recibido dos créditos; con su credikiva comprará  artesanías y materiales para el taller de confecciones, inversión segura porque la trabaja sobre los pedidos de sus clientes, especialmente en las épocas de mayor turismo en este municipio.  Mary Luz cuenta que sus financiamientos han logrado aumentarle el capital de trabajo y con ellos sus utilidades que le han permitido hacer mejoramiento de su vivienda y comprar los enseres que ha necesitado su familia. Su sueño se concentra en continuar aumentando sus utilidades mediante su trabajo disciplinado para lograr hacerle mejoramiento a su vivienda hasta dejarla totalmente hermosa.
texts.en:
Mary Luz C. is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, in Bolivar province, where handicrafts and dressmaking are income-generating activities that are very common among the town's women. It's not surprising, then, to find that Mary has her own dressmaking workshop.  She also has a store where she sells handicrafts that is well-known in the region.  Her family includes her husband and 3 children aged 12 to 24 years.  One of her children is in school, and the other 2 are working independently; they have chosen to develop their autonomy in the face of all that life presents them.

Mary started her dressmaking and handicraft businesses 23 years ago.  She learned to sew from her uncle, and perfected her techniques through training at SENA.  She strengthened her business through loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, from which she has received 2 loans.  With this loan from Kiva she will buy handicrafts and supplies for her sewing workshop.  This is a safe investment because she works based on orders from her customers, particularly in the seasons when there is the most tourism in her area.  Mary Luz tells us that the loans have increased her working capital and her profits, which has allowed her to improve her home and buy household goods needed by her family.  Her dream is to keep increasing her profits through disciplined work, so that she can make improvements to her home until it is absolutely beautiful.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her dressmaking workshop and handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is 59 years of age and married with five adult-aged children. He earns about PHP 100,000 per cropping as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

He has been growing corn for 40 years. Salvador is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and seeds for his 2.0-hectare fields. He will also use the loan to pay for preparing the land on his farm. He dreams that someday his business will become more profitable to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for preparing the land

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 24 years old and single. For the past four years he has worked in the electrician field. He loves this field and it was his major during his studies at a nearby college. He would like to make it his lifetime career. Ahmad has a good reputation and is an energetic hard worker who is young enough to handle all of the work he gets. He believes he must take advantage of his age and good health to create a good customer base and make a place in the market. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new advanced and updated tools and machines to help improve the quality of his work and ability to take on as many projects as he can get. Ahmad hopes that through improving his business he will be able to save some money and build his own house to support a small family such as everyone dreams about. In the future, he also hopes to expand his business and open an electrical supply shop.

loans.use: to buy new and updated tools and machines

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 30 years of age and married with five children. Ana  owns & operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Ana  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Ana  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ana 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pipes and an electric meter, to install plumbing, and to purchase a license for her business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 59, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alvaro and the mother of three children who all have their own family. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ny sells cassava cake snacks to the local neighborhood. She buys grated cassava in the market in the morning together with other raw products that she needs like margarine, sugar and coconut. She cooks and prepares the snacks and sells them in the afternoon in her local neighborhood. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw products and ingredients that she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Ny hopes to be able to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products that she uses in her business.

loans.name: Tân's Group

texts.en:
Tân is a 46 year-old male living in a town in Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  Tân is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đông - nhóm 04 (4).

Tân is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Tân owns and operates a business providing cargo transport services to local community members.  Tânơ has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Tân joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  He is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the second loan taken by the borrower from SEDA.  Tân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Phương  is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 8.736.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail shop selling soft drinks and confectionery.

2.  Đức  is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 8.288.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall selling chicken and duck eggs.

3.  Hiền is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock including quail.

4.  Thêm  is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business manufacturing and selling food such as pork.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tânơ 0 (0) là 46 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  Tânơ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đông - nhóm 04 (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ vận chuyển hàng hóa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tânơ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tânơ kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Tânơ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tânơ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Phương là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Đức là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm trứng gà, trứng vịt.


3.  Hiền là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc như nuôi chim cút.


4.  Thêm  là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn như T.t lợn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to provide cargo transport services to local community members.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school.  To earn a living, he sells household goods such as utensils, buckets, tablecloths and basins. He has been in the business for six years and has one employee. Joseph testifies that he has managed to buy a pick-up and meet his family’s needs through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils and tablecloths.

loans.use: To buy utensils and tablecloths

loans.name: Evelyn Lucia

texts.es: LUCIA es una joven de 20 años que comienza sus sueños pensando estudiar la carrera de “diseño de moda” al terminar sus estudios secundarios, a ella le nació estudiar la carrera por motivo que su madre es confeccionista de prendas de vestir, pero sus padres y personas mas cercanas a ella le aconsejan y recomiendan estudiar una carrera que vaya acorde a su intelecto por tal motivo ella decidió tomar un test vocacional, cuyo resultado le brindo como primera opción la carrera profesional de administración, entonces con dicho resultado decidió ingresar a la universidad, a la carrera profesional de Administración de Turismo, para lograr eso, tomo clases PRE-universitarias en una academia por un periodo, el DIA del examen logro obtener 6 puntos por debajo del ingreso a la universidad, pero eso fue motivo para impulsar sus ganas de superación buscando así información en otras universidades e institutos  las cuales cuenten con caracteristicas similares a la carrera de administración, además ella cuenta con el apoyo emocional y económico de sus padres, cabe recalcar que la situación económica de sus padres proviene del negocio familiar que se encuentra en crecimiento por tal motivo el apoyo que recibe no es frecuente pero aun así se le da  la oportunidad de estudiar la carrera de administración bancaria, ya que dicha institución brindaba charlas referentes a la carrera la cual la motiva para decir estudiar, estando actualmente cursando el IV ciclo de la carrera, tienen fijado sus metas profesionales, al culminar su carrera formar parte entidades bancarias o administrar el negocio familiar, la cual le permita un desarrollo profesional.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 20 year old young woman who is starting her dreams.  She is thinking of studying for a fashion design career when she finishes high school.  The idea of studying for this career came to her because her mother makes clothing.  However, her parents and people most close to her advise and recommend a career that goes with her intelligence.  That is why she decided to take a vocational test.  The results showed that her first option for a professional career is administration.  Then, with said results she decided to enroll in the University for a professional career in Tourism Administration.  In order to achieve this she took pre-university classes at an academy for a period.

The day of the exam she managed to get six points lower than required for enrollment in the University.  However, this was a motive to drive her desire for self-improvement.  She was looking for information about other universities and institutes that would have similar characteristics as a career in administration.  In addition to that, she has emotional and financial support from her parents.  It should be emphasized that her parents’ financial situation comes from the family business.  The business is growing.  That is why the support she receives is not frequent.  Even so, this gives her the opportunity to study for a career in Banking Administration.

This institution offers talks about the career, and this motivates her to decide to study.  She is currently enrolled in cycle IV of the career.  She has her professional goals fixed.  Upon completing her career studies she will be part of the bank’s entities or she will administer the family business.  This will allow her to develop professionally.

loans.use: to register for cycle IV:  schedule change, registration, study materials, and fees.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widowed woman with two children,  both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and establish a stall at the market to sell clothes. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mireya Gioconda

texts.es:
Mireya Gioconda tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera no tiene  hijos vive con los padres,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Mireya  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano, ademas cria pollos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha . Enfreta desafios la competencia y la experiencia de los agricultores. Su sueño es ayudar a los padres y aumentar la produccion.

En los tiempos libres le gusta conversar con los padres y salir a conversar con las amigas del sector.
texts.en:
Mireya Gioconda is 22 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar.

The V.R.C is called EL PLACER and belongs to the Chillanes canton in the parish of San Jose del Tambo which is located 60 minutes from the office. This group has 24 members who work in agriculture growing bananas, rice, cassava, cocoa, soya and oranges as well as breeding livestock.

Mireya works growing rice, corn, oranges and bananas. In addition, she raises chickens to sell. She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and her sales in the Chillanes market on Sundays at the fair.

She is asking for the loan to buy farming consumables and fertilizers. The loan will help support her in improving her harvest. The challenges she faces are those of competition and the experience of the other farmers. Her dream is to help her parents and increase her production.

In her free time she likes to talk with her parents and chat with friends in the area.

loans.use: to buy farming consumables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel integrante del Banco comunal “Persa Rodoviario” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca. 
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo específicamente ropa para mujer y hombre adolescente. 
En un puesto que tiene ubicado en un persa, con una patente de bazar y paquetería. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 15 años. 
Su horario de trabajo es de 10ºº de la mañana a 7ºº de la tarde, a partir del día lunes hasta el día sábado.
Su mercadería la compra en un sector llamado “Patronato” en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, específicamente ropa.
Sus metas son abrir una boutique para vender ropa más exclusiva. 
Isabel vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijos de 23, 18, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus hijos mayores estudian en la universidad.
Sus sueños son expandir su negocio, para administrar en un futuro su boutique, para costearle los estudios superiores a sus hijos y también darse un gusto que es viajar por todo el país.  Además le gustaría comprar una cabaña cercana a la playa. 
Isabel está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirán invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. 
Comenta además que tiene una muy buena relación con el grupo del Banco comunal. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Persa Rodoviario Communal Bank in the city of Talca.  She works in commerce, specifically selling clothing for teenage women and men in a stand located in a street market, where she has a membership with the bazaar and packaging association.  She has been working in this business for 15 years.  Her work schedule is from 10 in the morning until 7 in the evening, Monday through Saturday.  She buys her merchandise in the Patronato section of the city of Santiago.

With the loan she will buy merchandise for her business, specifically clothing.

Her goals are to open a boutique to sell more exclusive clothing.

Isabel lives with her husband and four children, ages 23, 18, 11, and 9.  Her older children are in college.

Her dreams are to expand her business in order to manage her future boutique, pay for her children's college education, and also give herself one wish, which is to travel throughout the entire country.  She would also like to buy a cottage near the beach.

Isabel is very happy and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza, since they will allow her to invest in her business and generate bigger profits.  She also comments that she has a very good relationship with the communal bank group.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central part of the country.  It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile.  There is a curious allusion to Talca in Chile, the expression "Talca, Paris, and London."  Among the many myths about the matter, some say that it derives from something an English person once said, "Talca looks like London" [Spanish "parece" 'looks like' and "París" 'Paris' sound alike] because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, specifically clothing.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is taking another Kiva loan of 70,000 KES to expand her rental houses. With the loan she wants to purchase iron sheets to establish real estate houses in the future. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To expand her rental houses.

loans.name: Djamilatou

texts.fr:
Mme Djamilatou est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans.4 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du savon kabakourou, du savon fanico (provenant de la Côte d’Ivoire), du garie (farine de manioc), et de l’aloco (banane plantain) et d’autres produits alimentaires tels que: bonbons, biscuits etc. depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à la gare du train à Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de savon kabakourou,02 sac de garie(farine de manioc)et 05 régimes de banane plantain(aloco).

Mme veut agrandir son commerce avec ses économies en s’approvisionnant plus de marchandises. Elle ambitionne s’approvisionner directement en Côte d’Ivoire et revenir vendre en gros et demi-gros. Elle veut aussi contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants en payant leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djamilatou is married and the mother of five children. The eldest is 20, the youngest is 6. Out of them, four attend school. She has eight persons to support.

She's been selling kabakourou soap (made in Côte d'Ivoire), gari (cassava flour), and aloco (plantain) for five years. She gets her supplies at the Ouagadougou train station. Her customers are both women and men.

She wants to buy two sacks of kabakourou soap, two sacks of gari, and five bunches of aloco.

Mrs. Djamilatou would like to expand her business with her savings, by purchasing larger supply quantities. She ambitions to get her supplies directly in Côte d'Ivoire, in order to sell wholesale and semi-wholesale.

She also wants to help her children study by paying their school expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of soaps, two sacks of cassava flour, and five bunches of plantains

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a thirty-two-year old widower with three school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Emmanuel has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past two years. His potential clients are area residents, and his major challenge is the rising cost of fuel. He aspires to own a transportation service shop and have as many motor vehicles as possible.

He plans to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and pay for its repair. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it understands its customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorbike and pay for its repair.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora y le gusta ser productiva. Esta casada con Armando, fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo de 9 años. Juntos habitan en su casa que logró construir con la ayuda de su esposo. La actividad que realiza Doris, consiste en la venta de vestuario para policias, lo confecciona en su pequeño taller, instalado en su propia casa, y cada confección es previamente solicitado con las instituciones y de manera independiente. Se inició en este negocio gracias a que su esposo es policía en actividad, de esta manera incursionó en este rubro y hoy es solicitada por el buen acabado de sus trabajos. Ya tiene más de cinco años realizando esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder estar ocupada, sentirse productiva, y mas adelatne desea ser una pequeña empresaria, y hacer lo que le gusta, que es la costura. Lo que no le gusta es cuando vende a crédito y algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago. Tiene planes de seguir mejorando su negocio, ampliar su taller, poner algún personal que lo apoye. Este sería el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal y desea seguir contando con este apoyo. Seguirá siendo puntal en sus pagos y así tener un buen record crediticio para tener acceso a más prestamos futuros. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más telas e hilos para confeccionar sus vestuarios.
texts.en:
Doris is 40, and is a cheerful, very hard-working woman, who likes to be productive. She is married to Armando, and they have a nine year-old son. They live together in a house she managed to build with her husband's help. 

Doris sells police uniforms. She makes them in her small workshop, that she set up in her own house. Every job is ordered in advance by each institution independently. She got started in this business thanks to the fact that her husband is a policeman. This is how she ventured into this line of business, and today she is sought after because of her good workmanship. 

She has been doing this work for more than five years. What she likes about it, is that she can be busy and feel productive. In the future she wants to be a small entrepreneur, and do what she likes to do, which is sewing. What she doesn't like is when she sells on credit and some of her clients are late in paying.  She plans to continue improving her business, expanding the workshop, and hiring staff to help her.

This will be the third loan with MFP. She feels good about the work of her communal bank, and wishes to continue having this support. She will continue to make her payments on time, and so have a good credit record, in order to have access to future loans. With the amount applied for, she will buy more fabric and thread to make her uniforms.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 28 years old, married with one child who is four years old.  Jean Bosco sells clothes. This is his tenth successful year in business and the hours of this business are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to by buying more clothes to sell.  Jean Bosco will earn more profits.  With the profits, he will build a secure future for his business as well as for his child.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is a 62-year-old farmer from the village of Babaneuri, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He lives alone. His source of income is an agricultural business. In particular, he has two milk cows and three calves. Levan produces cheese and sells it to local retailers.

Also, he has two hectares of land where he grows maize. Levan sells the maize in the local market. His total average monthly income is 800 Laris.

Levan requested a loan for purchasing calves. He will grow the calves and when they start milking, he will be able to produce more cheese. This will increase Levan’s income, which he will use for improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves for expansion of his dairy farm.

loans.name: Kiwambi Mshangano Myangayanga Group

texts.en:
Sabina is a 38 year old married woman with five children, one of whom attends secondary school. She has been growing maize, coffee and beans in her 12 acre plot for over three years. She faces farming problems such as a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Sabina is seeking more working capital to finance her farming activities by buying fertilizers and insecticides. In the next five years she hopes to build a better house and to be able to pay for school fees, after improving her farming operation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 38 years old and single. She describes herself as a determined woman. She has been running a general store for the last three years and sells vegetables such as kale, tomatoes, onions, etc. and charcoal. Her business challenge is the insufficient funds for maintaining her general store. She will use the loan of KES 15,000 to buy charcoal, onions and tomatoes. Ruth hopes to expand her business by increasing the inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is married with two children. Romeo is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Romeo is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of 15000 to purchase fertilizers for her crop.
 
Romeo has been a member of PMPC for almost a year.

loans.use: To purchase fertlizers for her crop

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, es socia del banco comunal “Virgen De La Natividad”. Distrito Coronal Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, casada, un hijo.
Fundadora de este banco comunal, tiene una bodega en su casa bien surtida que en todos estos años ha estado implementando hasta ponerlo de todo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 1 caja de mayonesa, 1 caja de mermelada,1 caja de salsa de tomate, 1 caja de conservas, 1 caja de leche grande, 1 caja de aceite.
Su esposo es el que trabaja para mantener el hogar así que de su negocio sale solo para pagar las cuotas a Manuela Ramos y para seguir implementando cada día más, agradece  a Manuela Ramos por las facilidades que da a las personas para acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the community bank "Virgen de la Natividad" in the District of Coronel Portillo, Department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 54 years old, married, and has one son.
A founding member of this bank, she runs a well-stocked convenience store from her home from which during all these years she has been selling everything under the sun. With her new loan of S/ 3,000.00 nuevos soles she will purchase: one case of mayonnaise, one case of marmalade, one case of ketchup, one case of canned goods, one case of milk jugs, and case box of cooking oil. 
Her husband works to maintain the home, so her income from her business goes directly toward making payments to Manuela Ramos and to keep operating day to day. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing people with the tools needed to obtain a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, marmelade, pasta sauce, and jams

loans.name: Jermelin

texts.en:
Jermelin works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jermelin requested a PHP 5800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in their area.

Jermelin is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
My name is Consuelo O. and I have been selling new clothes such as shirts, blouses, socks, skirts, sweaters, perfumes, lotions, creams, jeans and pants in my store for the last three years. This allows me to buy food and provide education for my sons. My customers are excellent and I have already been able to sell my products in the commercial zone of the capital city. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales, using the profits to renovate my house and provide a better education for my sons.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Consuelo O. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva como ser camisas, blusas, calcetines, chumpas, faldas, sueters, perfumes, lociones, cremas, jeans, pantalones, calsonetas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, actividad que me genera ingresos para los alimentos y educacion de mis hijos, mis clientes son excelentes ya que reparto mi producto en una zona comercial de la capital, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Buy blouses, shirts, shoes, sweaters, jeans, pants, skirts, perfumes

loans.name: Santos Plutarco

texts.en: In my community I am known as Plutarco, and I sell purified water and deliver it to homes. My largest clients are those people that have small supermarkets, markets, and confectioner’s shops. I sell them water every three days, and my earnings are used to support my family.

loans.use: Purchase of bottled purified water.

loans.name: Ruon

texts.en: Mrs Ruon S. is married with 5 children living with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She grows crops and sells fish on the roadside of this village. From this business activity, she typically makes around $2.5/day in revenue, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver who helps to generate the family's savings with the money he daily makes. Additionally, S. hopes to use the loan to purchase a pumping machine in order to supplement  her crop growing and part of money is to dig a well to supply water. Eventually, she not only hopes to save enough money to purchase two or three cows to help in her field, but to provide her children a good quality of education one day.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine and dig a well

loans.name: Faizihon

texts.en: Faizihon D. specializes in selling greens and vegetables. She has a regular trading place at the central market of Isfara town. Her entrepreneurship experience covers several years and has brought welcome income to her family budget. Her husband works, but his income is not regular. Faizihon is 47 years old and she has several children. A year and a half ago, she got a $100 loan from Microinvest and used it to purchase vegetables. Since that time, she has gotten regular loans from Microinvest that have helped in her sales every day. She is now asking for a $200 loan to renew her current capital and purchase more produce.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Noemí

texts.en: Noemi is a lively 22 year old woman.  She is living with her husband, a farmer, and their 4 children.  A year ago she started her business, a small grocery store, which allows her to earn a living and assist her husband in taking care of their children.  She wants to purchase assorted goods in order to diversify and enlarge her inventory.  In fact, until now, she sold basic foodstuff.  For that reason, she is requesting a US$125.00 loan that she’ll repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase more products to increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam B. is a 30-year-old dynamic woman. She lives with her cohabitant and their 3 children in Adjamé, a populated suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. She is a fruits and legumes seller in the Adjamé market, where she has been operating for more than 10 years. Her cohabitant is a taxi driver, and the family has been able to send 2 of their kids to school. Mariam, who benefited from her first loan from AE&I in July 2004, has been an excellent performer and has consistently taken advantage of these loans to improve her business. The volume of her goods has progressively increased. She will use the loan to purchase onions and tomatoes in bulk for gross sale.

loans.use: Mariam Bamba will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 33 years old  and lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Ali is a car mechanic who repairs cars in the neighborhood. Ali is requesting a loan to purchase materials for his business and is determined to sustain and continuously develop the business.

loans.use: To purchase material for auto repairs

loans.name: Naran

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Naran (47) is a widow with one daughter who is married and living with her. Her husband died many years ago. Her daughter and her son in-law are silk weavers. Naran and her family are living on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers frO. PhnO. Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk and also runs a grocery store.  She learned to weave silk frO. her mother and started her silk production in 1983. 

Naran is requesting her fifth loan for the amount $300. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loO..

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Uway

texts.en: Uway, 30, is married to O., who sells parsnip at their house and at the market, earning $10 a day. They have 3 children.  To add to the family's income, Uway goes door-to-door selling sheets on credit, earning $30 a week. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is a fruit and vegetable salesperson in the city of Guadalupe. She started 7 years ago to support her family with expenses. She inherited this business from her father, and now not only sells these products, but also steamed tacos.

She would like a loan of $575 USD that she will repay in 6 months; she counts on your cooperation since she needs to buy merchandise to continue working and see an increase in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe es comerciante de frutas y verduras en ciudad Guadalupe inicio hace 7 años para apoyar a su familia en los gastos familiares este oficio lo heredo de su padre, ahora ella no solo vende estas sino también tacos a vapor.

Ella desea un crédito de US $575 que liquidara en 6 meses, espera contar son su cooperación ya que necesita comprar mercancía para continuar trabajando ya que espera u incremento en sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rath

texts.en: Rath S. is 35 years old and makes her living selling vegetables from her home. She earns US $5 per day in this business. Her husband, Hen Saroeut, is a construction foreman for their local village earning US $3 per day. Together they have three young children. She wants to take out a loan so she can afford to fix her home as it is also her storefront. With any left over money she will purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fix the house

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna’s previous loan of $175 from Kiva has helped her to increase her stock. She is very grateful for the stock increase because she got many new customers because of new varieties of cosmetics. With 7 children, her income contributes a lot to meeting the family's expenses. She paid the school fees for the children in cash. Memuna is requesting another loan to further diversify her business with the purchase of dozens of lotions, perfumes, etc.

loans.use: Increase stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is the proprietor of Major Medical Clinic based in Kipsaina Kitale. He is a trained nurse/midwife, offering comprehensive reproductive health services in his clinic.

Joshua attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from K-MET/KIVA. He requires $1200.00 to enable him to purchase stock of drugs in bulk.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of drugs for his medical clinic.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Husband and wife, Mario (shown in photo) and Eusebia are responsible and hardworking parents, who, since marrying, left their birthplace of Pusi in search of better employment opportunities. Currently they live in the city of Juliaca with their children. These responsible parents started out by selling clothing in the mining camp Rinconada, and after gathering considerable capital, they joined forces with some friends and rented a storefront where they now buy and sell gold. This business is becoming fruitful but they know that with a greater investment they will reap greater benefits. This is why Eusebia became motivated to request this loan in order to increase their capital investment. She is committed to repayment in a punctual and responsible manner, because she considers the person who gives her a helping hand to be deserving of care and respect.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Los esposos Mario (en la foto) y Eusebia son padres responsables y trabajadores, desD. que contrajeron matrimonio abandonaron su pueblo natal, Pusi, en busca D. mejores oportunidades D. trabajo. Actualmente junto a sus hijos viven en la ciudad D. Juliaca. Estos responsables padres se iniciaron vendiendo ropa en el campamento D. la mina Rinconada, luego D. reunir un considerado capital, se unieron en sociedad con algunas amistades y alquilaron un local, ahora se dedican a la compra y venta D. oro. Este negocio está empezando a darles buenos frutos, pero consideran que con mayor inversión podrían obtener mejores beneficios. Fue entonces doña Eusebia quien se anima a solicitar este préstamo para incrementar su capital D. inversión. Ella se compromete a pagar D. manera puntual y responsable, porque considera que a la persona que le tienD. la mano le debe cariño y respeto.

loans.use:
Increase investment capital for their business of buying and selling gold.

Incremento de su capital de inversión para su negocio de compra y venta de oro.

loans.name: Yovana Zenaida

texts.es:
Yovana lives with her partner, is 22 years old and has 1 daughter. Yovana has a general store in her home, located on a main avenue in the San Juan Bautista district. She sells groceries, liquor, drinks, vegetables, fruits, meats, medicines, and has been doing so for 2 years. Yovana is planning to make the store bigger with the loan she will receive. Yovana and her husband also have a car, which her husband drives as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho.

Yovana needs a 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be invested in make the store larger and buying scaffolding, and a display case.

Yovana hopes to buy more cars, improve her business and home, and give her child the best.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Yovana es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija, Yovana tiene una bodega en su casa ubicada en una avenida principal del distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, licores, bebidas, verduras, frutas, carnes, medicamentos, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Yovana tiene proyectado ampliar su tienda con el préstamo que recibirá. Además Yovana junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual su esposo realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yovana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la ampliación de su tienda y en la compra de andamios, mostrador.

Los sueños de Yovana son comprar mas carros, mejorar su negocio, mejorar su vivienda y brindarle lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: Yovana needs a 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be invested in making her store larrger and to purchase scaffolding and a display case.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina G. is 46 years old and a mother with four kids. Three of them are in school now and the eldest has completed university. She has been selling grocery products for five years on a table in her neighborhood to support her family. 
Faustina says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use this loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Faustina believes the loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children who are in school now. She is a member of the group called 'Nyame ye odo'. Members in the group agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Earlier this year and with the aid of MicroInvest, Zuhro N. secured a business development loan, the proceeds of which she used to shore up her business as she was in need of capital. She proudly states that she has over 12 years of experience in the livestock industry.

On account of the proceeds from the prior loan, she was able to improve her existing livestock business and to start another business whereby she grows rice and wheat. Currently, she is seeking another business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 3,600 STJ ($1,075) over 4 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To expand and improve her livestock business by purchasing another pedigree bull

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch S. E. was born in 1973 and she now lives in Tonle Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a problE. because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To deal with this problE., Mrs. Ouch S. E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Long Sokong, is a soldier who can make a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Ouch S. E. has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a single parent and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high.

Comfort sells ladies clothing, artificial hair peices and other female items at Tetermu near Elmina. She has been in this business since 2006. Comfort uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.

She is requesting this loan so she can buy more women's clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest in her business. This will allow her to increase her income and provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Binh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lại Thị Bình năm nay 31 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 2008 và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ việc làm chiếu và tiền công đi làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị khá ổn định với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 6.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Phần còn lại chị sử dụng mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Binh Thi L. is 31 years old. She joined the Fund in 2008 and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Currently, besides he income from raising livestock, the family also has an income stream from making straw mats and her husband's salary from working as labor-for-hire, so the family's finances are quite stable at 2,000,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 6,000,000, part of which will be used to invest in buying more pigs to raise. The remaining amount will be used to buy more raw materials for weaving straw mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, raw materials for straw mats

loans.name: Nou's Group

texts.en:
Nou T., a 56 year old widow is the leader of a small five member group loan. Since 1998, she has been selling Khmer cakes at the Phsa Kraom Market. The cake is made by boiling flour and banana. Ms. T. is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make more cakes. She has five children of whom three are single and two are married.  Three of her children are working as waiters in a restaurant and earn $260 per month. 

All the borrowers live in Sala Komreuk Commune, Siem Reap Province. Seng T., age 47, is requesting a loan to purchase more coconut oil to sell. Pov C., age 32, is requesting a loan to buy ingredient to make more cakes. Sem S., 54 years old, is asking for a loan to expand her wine distilling business. Suo V. needs a loan to begin a new investment as a grocery seller.

loans.use: To buy more cake ingredients

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis es una joven muy entusiasta y alegre, a sus 23 años, ya tiene un negocio junto a su madre, vive con ella en una casa alquilada y trabaja duro para mejorar su actual situación económica. Son ya 3 años, los que Gladis viene trabajando duramente junto a su madre, vende ropa todos los fines de semana en el mercado dominical, le gusta mucho vender, sobre todo a sus clientes conocidos y es que es muy alegre y divertida y la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad. Desea que su negocio prospere y que se vuelva más grande, lo que le causa mayor dificultas es conseguir la ropa, puesto que ella adquiere solo lo mejor y es que ya tiene una reputación ganada, la cual le ayuda a vender mucho más. Gladis está en su primer préstamo con MFP, es una de las socias más jóvenes de su banco comunal y por eso recibe todo el apoyo de las demás socias, para que le vaya bien en su negocio. Con este dinero planea comprar más mercadería, la cual le costará aproximadamente, 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladis is young, enthusiastic, and happy. At 23 years old she already has a business, which she runs with her mother. She lives with her mother in a rented house and works very hard to improve her economic situation. It has been three years since Gladis began working hard with her mother. They sell clothes every weekend at the Sunday market. She really likes selling clothes, especially to her regular clients. She is very happy and fun and the clothes that she sells are good quality. She would like her business to prosper and grow. The most difficult obstacle is purchasing the clothes. She prides herself on buying only the best clothes to sell, which has earned her a good reputation and helped to increase her sales. This is Gladis' first loan with MFP. She is one of the youngest members of her community bank and has the support of the other members, all of whom would like to see her succeed. With the money from the loan she will purchase more merchandise, which will cost approximately 500 nuevos soles ($175 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Gerardo Eloy

texts.es: El Señor Gerardo M. es un señor emprendedor que no quiere que su familia se alarme con esta crisis, si no que el tiempo transcurre y no hay quien lo pare. El puso una tienda de Abarrotes la cual ha ido muy bien ya tiene siete meses en el negocio y quiere un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía, comenta que entre mas surtido y variedad aumenta mas sus ventas y su capital. El tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de le  y están en etapa escolar lo cual piensa que con mas ingresos extras les podrá dar mejor educación;  también el trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Gerardo M. is a enterprising man who does not want his family to worry over the financial crisis, but rather that time goes on and there is no stopping him.
