49-year-old Justina is a humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, Domingo, and their three beloved children who inspire her to get ahead in life and keep them safe and sound.

The green fields of her village of Palmapampa, located in the tropical rainforest of Ayacucho, have been a pleasant place for Justina as she has worked and lived there together with her family.  Her parents taught her how to farm when she was very young and she now has her own land.  It is her husband who supports her the most in her work.  Justina provides her cacao and banana plants with a lot of care and attention.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her crops.  She has been in this business for 20 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her harvests to the warehouse centers located in the different towns in her region.  

Justina is requesting this loan so that she can sow more cacao plants as this is one of the plants which provides fruit in the least amount of time.  This will be Justina's third loan and she is very happy to know that she will have your support.  With her 1,500 soles, Justina will buy cacao seeds and thereby increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds

loans.name: Otgonbileg

texts.en:
Otgonbileg is 52 years old and lives with her husband, two children and her granddaughter. Her husband is an accountant, her children are college students and her granddaughter stays at home. 

She started her grocery business in 1996 by planting potatoes. Now, she harvests 2,500 kgs. of potatoes each year and she owns a retailing counter in a local market. 

However, her own harvest isn't enough for running a retail business so she buys additional stocks each year. She is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy other kinds of vegetables for her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To buy other kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Nassir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and a father to one child. 

Nassir has been a shop-owner since 2010, selling household items. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to renovate his shop’s walls and floors, to make shelves and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to renovate his shop’s walls and floors, to make shelves and to add more inventories.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia sigue teniendo su negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche, manzana con leche, desayuno de maca,tortas,chocolate y sándwich de queso,ella vende en las mañanas en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 a.m,tambien se dedica al negocio de tejidos,ella realiza tejidos de lana como pantalones y chompas tanto para niños y adultos,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de venta de desayunos y venta de tejidos . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer desayunos y comprar lana para tejer los pantalones y chompas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member is 39 years old, living with a partner, and has 3 children. The member continues her business of selling breakfasts such as quinoa with milk, apples with milk, maca breakfasts, tortas, chocolate, and cheese sandwiches. She sells on foot from 5:00AM until 10:00AM in the mornings. She also has a textile business, weaving wool for pants and sweaters for children and adults. Through this business her children have prospered. The member wants to expand and improve her breakfast business and textile sales. She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies to make breakfast and to buy wool to knit the pants and sweaters. The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make breakfasts to sell, and buy wool to knit pants and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Mary is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells products like sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and buy books for her young brothers. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to become a musician. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for resale.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine used her first loan to buy more goats, which she reared and sold. 

She has applied for a second loan of KES 10,000, with which she will buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit. 

She hopes to succeed in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Sharon Fe

texts.en:
Sharon Fe is a married woman with one child. She is 40 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Sharon Fe owns and operates a business venture, planting & harvesting decorative plants for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. 

Sharon Fe requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.  In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Tawananyasha Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe.  25 year old Progress is from Machipisa, Harare.  She is married with three children and two attending school.  Progress runs a retail business selling clothes.  The business has been in operation for two years.  She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition.  Progress has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy clothes and shoes for resale.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family.  In the future, Progress plans to own a big shop selling a wide range of clothes and footwear.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Josiane Yollande's Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupe de deux personnes, Josiane vit avec son mari et a deux enfants. Elle est commerçante et a pour activité la vente de divers, mêches, cosmétiques et recharges au domicile de sa mère. Soucieuse de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts, renforcer son fonds de commerce et à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josiane is responsible for this two-person group. She lives with her husband and has two children. She's a merchant who sells various items, such as hair extensions, cosmetics, and refills, at her mother's home.

Eager to meet customer demand, she sought and obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to maximize her interests, bolster her working capital, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy 50 pieces of hair extension and 20 cosmetic products

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is single and has no children.  Ekua sells onions at Mpredwow, which she has done for 2 years. She uses her income to pay the utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more onions to sell. With the new profits from her business, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more onions to sell.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: A villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Phat is a married mother blessed with three schoolchildren and ages 44 years old. She secures the need in her household via rice farming. She has involved in current business for ages and it has returned her about 42,000 KHR per day. This is not the original loan for Pat with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has uplifted her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost

loans.name: Tun's Group

texts.en:
Tun, aged 57, is a married mother of a dependent son and she lives in Battambang province where she makes a living through growing rice, working as security guard and working for others for a fee. She earns about USD12 per day and can save about USD6 each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge to rice growing business.   
This is the first time for her with VisionFund. As the group leader of two members, she is going to apply for a new loan to buy rice seeds and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes that this loan will enable her to get abundant rice yields to make a better living and to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant to get more yields to make a better living.

loans.name: Cheorn

texts.en:
M. Cheorn is a 53 year old single mother and grandmother. Her two sons, one daughter-in-law and two granddaughters all live in her home. M. Cheorn runs a small food stand selling rice, sugar palm, and papaya. She earns about $16.75 a day from her sales. 

M. Cheorn is requesting a loan of $750 to expand her business. She would like to purchase $500 worth of additional rice, $125 worth of additional sugar palm, and $125 worth of additional papaya. This is M. Cheorn\'s third loan with CREDIT, and she did not have trouble repaying on her previous loans. She is happy about the possibility of expanding her business so that she can better provide for her growing family.

loans.use: Purchase more rice, sugar palm, and papaya.

loans.name: Amisi

texts.en:
Amisi B. is a very active member of Life in Africa. He joined in 2004 as a member. Since then, he has been so dedicated and hard-working. He has been quick to participate in community initiatives and has learned how to make hand crafts such as banana fibered balls, bracelets out of organic materials, and many other things. Among the things he likes is serving God. He is somebody who is helpful to the community, often translating at meetings into the Luganda language for other members who don't understand English.

Since the loan scheme began in Life in Africa, he has never rushed but has been very active at the loan review meetings to learn how to make a good loan plan. His plan is to purchase one public pay phone.

Once his loan request is accepted and funded, he will locate his business at Ntinda stage, where there are a large number of public pay phone users. To compete with his counter-parts, he is not going to charge as much. He has learned that all the public pay phone attendants charge 300 Uganda shillings (UGX) for mtn to mtn network per 56 seconds and across other networks for 400 -500 per 56 sec. Amisi plans to charge 200 UGX and 300 UGX for these services instead. He has a brother willing to operate the phone and expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 UGX after paying his brother.

He is seeking a loan amount of two hundred and fifty thousand shillings, and he will repay the loan in 12 months. (1 USD = 1,722 UGX) Below is his budget:

Purchase of one public pay phone @ ...... 200,000 UGX

Ground rent for four months @ 10,000 UGX per month.....40,000 UGX

Stool for putting the phones................10,000 UGX

Total 250,000 UGX

loans.use: Purchase of pay phone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sell clothing

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mr. Chun C. is 40 years old and calls Phnom Penh, Cambodia his home. He is a motor-taxi driver and his wife takes care of their three children.

Mr. Chun C. would like to purchase a motorcycle to continue his business. Currently, his motorcycle is wearing down and may not last much longer to allow him to continue to work as a motor-taxi driver. With a loan of $700, he hopes to be able to purchase a new motorcycle.

In the future, they aspire to their own grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed J. is forty-five years old and has a wife and four children.  He buys sheep, fattens them, and then sells them at a higher price after three months.  With his previous loans he managed to increase the number of sheep by four.  He says his plan is to increase the number of sheep for a better profit and to purchase cows for the family one at a time. He is requesting $175 to purchase three lambs and one calf.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock for fattening

loans.name: Faaafe

texts.en: Faaafe is 49 years of age and has 4 children. She is started the borrowing centre in February in the village of Samusu. Her first loan of 750.00 Tala ($300.00 US) was used to buy chemicals for her three acre taro plantation quite far from her house. She used to go to the market twice a week where she earned 200.00-300.00 Tala ($80-120 US). She is applying for another 1250.00 Tala ($500.00 US) loan to extend her taro plantation and to help out with her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a 41 year old father of 3 who lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Kamal owns a pharmacy which is the main source of income for his family. He needs a loan to buy more merchandise for the store. This will be  Kamal's 7th loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary E. is 32 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City and sells electrical materials. She is seeking the loan of $875 to enable her to buy more electrical materials. She learned the business from her husband and started her operation in 1997.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials for sale

loans.name: Encum

texts.en: Encum is 43, married, and a mother of five children. She has a food stall in front of her house where she sells snacks, flavoured ices, fried snacks, and other food items. She earns $3.00 a day. Her husband has no fixed job so she must work hard to support the entire family. She will use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Khotam

texts.en:
Khotam is 43 years old and is married with four children. He is a jack of all trades in the sphere of construction and repair. Khotam works as a foreman on a team that provides minor and major repairs of houses and apartments. At the same time, he is a very good carpenter. Khotam dreams of providing a higher education for all of his four sons. Moreover in Tajikistan there is a tradition that a father has to build a house for each of his sons. Knowing all this, Khotam is working really hard to make the business successful and generate a stable income for his large family.

Khotam now plans to purchase construction equipment. This loan is his first. Khotam promises to work harder to be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the construction equipment.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
The beautiful color display in Juliet O.’s shop makes her shop stand out from other shops in the locality. Her wares range from clothes, to handbags and jewelry. Juliet is a single woman and she is 29 years of age. Her aim is to improve her business, which will, in turn, increase her profit. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria and has been in business since 1999.

Juliet needs a loan of $875 to buy more shoes, clothes and bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags and shoes

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en:
Paulina R. is a dedicated and vivacious woman who lives with her 4 children (ages: 16, 14, 12, 3) in San Pedro de Macoris. Currently, Paulina sells shoes and slippers by walking around her community all throughout the day. She will use this loan to continue making small improvements to her business by purchasing better quality items and developing a consistent client base. Her goal for the future is to open a proper store in her neighborhood so that she doesn’t have to walk from place to place every day. She told us that it is very hard on her knees and back to carry around her merchandise for 10 hours every day. Paulina wants to use any extra profit from her business to help her children with school and necessities.

On behalf of Esperanza, thank your for your generous support and we look forward in joining with you to watch these women succeed! God Bless.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Lobanok South 2006-2 Group

texts.en:
Lina M., the group leader, currently runs a hotel and has requested this loan in order to expand her business. Lina is 31 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 2 and 8. Her husband is a security guard and her children go to school. Each week, Lina makes approximately 240 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Lina is joined in her small group by Elizabeth Foni, Asunta W., M. L., and L. W.. Elizabeth Foni sells beer at a bar and wants to expand her business. Asunta W. currently sells bread at the market and would use this loan to build a bakery. M. L. has a business selling vegetables and hopes to open up a shop. L. W. sells alcohol but would use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To expand a hotel

loans.name: Muta

texts.en:
Muta P., 35, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to friends, relatives,and the local community; also in harvest season they supply the public market 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

SPBD loans are Muta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.The loan will also support her children's school fees and her church contribution. Her husband is self employed and works to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, weedkiller sprayer machine, shovel, bushknife, and wire for fence

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr:
Mbène S. is a married woman raising 4 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Mosquée for 6 and a half years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling beads, costume jewelry, and small “pagnes” (lengths of African print cloth). She wants to bolster her business to improve the living conditions and health of her family. The loan she is requesting will be reimbursed in one single payment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mbène S. est une femme mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des perles, des bijoux et de petits pagnes. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Buying and re-selling beads, costume jewelry, and small "pagnes"

Acheter et revendre des perles, bijoux et petits pagnes

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana D. is divorced and has two kids. She lives with her family in Dunkwa, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 43 years old. She runs a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, and dressing bags for the past seven years.

Diana is constrained by insufficient funds to run her business. She needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her have resources to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, and slippers

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en:
Launiu M., 34, is married with four children. She has five years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people four days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Launiu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

She will use the loan to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment used for her vegetable business

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena R. has been selling juices and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $85 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can further increase her inventory.

Zuwena is 38 years old, married, and has four children, aged 4, 8, 14, and 15.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and juices to sell

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon A.–Adjei is 26 years old and not yet married. He is in the business of photography. 

He has a small studio where he works and also travels to places to capture videos and pictures of clients who ask for his services. He uses materials such as cameras, film, glass to frame pictures, etc.

Gideon says he has been in this business for only one year. However, he has made a lot of economic gains through this venture. He says he wants a loan to help him expand and decorate his studio, and also buy the materials he uses to work. 

Gideon belongs to the “Victory Group” which is made up of only five members. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand his photography business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people in Svay Chek village in Kampong Chhnang province form this village bank and Mrs. Sokha K. is the bank president. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then resell later at a better price. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She thus decided to ask for a loan to add to her capital and buy more rice for her current business.

Her husband, Mr. Sok Thouch, is a bicycle repairer. Mrs. Sokha K. is 42 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loan and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock and resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 52 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Fatima has been working as a sewer since 1988. Fatima is good at sewing and her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans to increase her business.  She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua purchase thread and repair her car.  This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase thread and repair her car.

loans.name: Honronya (La Dignité) Group

texts.fr:
Parmi les quatre femmes du groupe Honronya  trois  sont mariées et une est veuve, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier lafiala de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues à  travers des liens   de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité à savoir l’activité de fabrication et vente du savon. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité et jouissent d’une réputation sans égale.
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Honronya a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des barils  de déchets d’huile et de  la soude caustique. Le savon ainsi fabriqué   est vendu en gros et en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de Koutiala et dans les foires des villages environnants.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 200 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier et d’ouvrir d’un atelier moderne de fabrication de savons.
texts.en:
Among the four women of the group Honronya, three are married and one is a widow. They average 26 years of age and two children and live in large traditional extended families in the Lafiala district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through community ties and through work in almost the same business, namely making and selling soap. The women are in high demand in this field of work and enjoy an unparalleled reputation.

In order to satisfy their ever-increasing number of customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

They plan to use this loan for buying barrels of waste oil and caustic soda. The soap thus made is then sold wholesale and retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Koutiala marketplace and at the fairs of surrounding villages.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 200,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The funds will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in businesses. Their ambition is to diversify and to open a modern workshop for making soap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy waste oil and caustic soda

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing K., a 26-year-old farmer in Pursat Province, is married to Neoun, 22, who earns a living raising piglets behind the house. A responsible father and neighbor, Saing harvests his crop twice a year and sells to customers in bulk at a good price.

He would like to end his reliance on his neighbor's oxen to plow his field, and so is requesting a loan of $250 to buy oxen and to renovate his house. The loan will help the family achieve a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy oxen and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 49 years old and married with six children. She sells eggs. Rita needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She is happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva, She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Orl

texts.en:
Mr. Orl A., 33, makes a living by buying and selling motorbikes. He normally purchases the motorbikes to paint them and resell them to gain income. Beside this, he is also a local construction foreman. He is married to Sroy, 34, a good housewife who cares for the children and cooks tasty meals for the family. The couple has two young children who are enrolled in the primary school.

To enlarge the business and to earn additional income, A. is applying for a loan to add to his existing capital. He will use the money to buy more motorcycles to resell to gain income and to buy a cow from a farmer to raise and sell its offspring.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycles to resell and a cow

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Mrs. Teresa P. is 32 years of age, married, and is a bona fide resident of Dipolog City. She is blessed with 3 children, all of whom are still studying. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years and already has had several loans that have financed her farming activities. She is busy with her banana plantation, corn, root crops, and vegetables. These crops are all in their yard, cultivated and managed both by Theresa and her husband. Now she has requested another loan from the Paglaum MPC intended for repair of their house to have comfortable shelter for the family. The loan shall be paid out from the yield income of their farm.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and labor to repair home.

loans.name: Elizardo Perez Group

texts.es:
Doce personas conforman la asociación “Elizardo Pérez”, trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer  hace tres años en el centro focal Alto Lima ubicado  en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.
Varias son las actividades que realiza este grupo algunas se dedican a la costura; otras realizan tejidos en maquina; venden pantalones  deportivos; chompas tejidas a mano; chamarras,  también otras se dedican a la carpintería.
La asociación Luz y Vida afirma que necesitan generar mayores ingresos, ya que lo que obtienen no les alcanza para mantener económicamente a sus familias, para esto necesitan de créditos para comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Twelve people make up the "Elizardo P." group. They have been working alongside the Pro-Mujer family for three years at the focal point Alto Lima located in the July 16 area of the city of El Alto. This group engages in several activities such as sewing, weaving by machine, selling sports pants, hand-woven sweaters, jackets and others are engaged in carpentry. The group Luz y Vida affirms that it needs to generate more income, because what the members earn is not enough to support their families economically. This is why they need this loan to purchase merchandise in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in larger quantities.

loans.name: Dalerjon

texts.en:
O. Dalerjon is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. For more than 10 years, Dalerjon have been working at baking “lepeshka”- the national bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other breads so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast he purchases at the local market. Now, due to high demand, Dalerjon wants to increase the amount of bread he produces so that he requests a loan of 800 US Dollars. The loan will be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Dalerjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is 44 years old. She is married and has four children—a son and three daughters. One is in the university and the others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the Western Region and a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Ama is a hard working woman. Her husband works with a timber firm. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, and so forth in a store on the street. Ama has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa, as the business owner, knows that the success of her clothing business will in large part depend on the selection of her merchandise. She is also aware that it is best to keep an open mind and to be receptive to customer suggestions. Her maternity clothing store may initially focus on casual wear, but she may find that she has a lot of working women clamoring for suits tailored for pregnant women. Raisa has been in this business for many years, and she has succeeded in attracting customers who trust her. 

She requested a loan to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Ninolaza es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Nicolaza es  casada tiene 55 años, tiene tres hijos que son mayores y trabajan. 
Nicolaza es de puno en su tierra se dedicaba a cuidar ganado, cuando llego a Lima a los 30 años se caso desde entonces se puso a vender tubérculos y verduras  en un puesto que alquilo el mercado de Pamplona Baja, con la ayuda de su hija., 
Desde que Nicolaza está en Finca su capital ha crecido y tiene muchas ideas de negocio..
Incolaza necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para comprar diferentes variedades de papa por saco, limos por saco, cajones de tomate y paquetes de verduras.
El sueño de Nicolaza es poner otros puestos de verduras en otros mercados.
texts.en:
Nicolaza is a member of the Always Together (Siempre Juntas) Community Bank. She is 55 years old, is married, and has three children, who are adults and are working. Nicolaza is from Puno, where she raised livestock. She came to Lima when she was 30 years old, when she got married. Since then she has sold tubers and vegetables in a stand that she rents in the Pamplona Baja Market, with the help of her daughter. Since Nicolaza has been with Finca, her capital has grown and she has many ideas for her business. Nicolaza needs a loan for 3000 soles to buy different varieties of sacks of potatoes, sacks of limes, boxes of tomatoes and packets of vegetables. Nicolaza’s dream is to have other vegetable stands in other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different varieties of potatoes

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 43-year-old single mother of five children aged between 9 and 27 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she lives with six people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Norah resides and works in an urban area selling handicrafts like table cloths and knitted sweaters in Mukwano Arcade, one of Kampala’s streets. She uses public transport to and from home and work. Norah sells to an average of ten people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

Norah has been in her business for the last ten years and has been with MCDT for seven years. She is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more thread and rolls of cloth. Norah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to owning a permanent home.

loans.use: To buy more thread and rolls of cloth

loans.name: So Khou

texts.en: Mrs. So Khou N. lives in Phnum Lorn Tes village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder who also collects the duck eggs to sell. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 160 more ducks for breeding, to earn income. Her husband, Mr. Prum Lean, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Mrs. So Khou N. is 49 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children is employed in a Casino Club while another is an electrician. The other children are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy 160 more ducks for breeding to earn income.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana G. is divorced. She raises her teenage daughter herself. Tetyana runs a small enterprise selling men’s footwear in the central marketplace of Belaya Tserkov. Tetyana started her small business 12 years ago. Presently, she has about 21,000 UAH invested in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 UAH a month.

Tetyana is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional seasonal merchandise and increase her working capital as a result. Tetyana is hoping to see her business flourish in the future, bringing her stable income so that she can pay her daughter’s college fee.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Nemi

texts.en:
Nemi F. is 58 years old and already a widower. His wife died after giving birth to their daughter named Czarina Ellen who is still studying.  They are living in the village of Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is a vocational graduate of Driving Mechanics. After this, He is doing everything in order to support the education of his daughter. 

Farming is his major source of income.  He cultivates their farm twice a year by planting rice and corn. But since it is only seasonal. he then ventured to another business to have an alternative source of income.  Through his tricycle operation business, he was able to provide their basic needs and send his daughter to school. During harvest season, he can to earn an income of PHP15,000.00 and PHP2,500.00 a month from his tricycle. He utilized his income by acquiring their daily basic needs, finance the tuition fees and allowances of his daughter. 

To further maintain his two businesses, he is now asking to avail a loan of PHP7,000 that he can use for the maintenance of his tricycle and also to purchase their farming needs.  He believes that someday, his daughter will finished her studies and their status of living will improve also through the financial assistance of the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: For the  maintenance of his tricycle transport business and farming needs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Ruby is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Severo
loans.use: Additional capital for his hog raising business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Lina has been working as a seamstress since 2004. She repairs all type of clothes. Lina is special in her work because she does it well and knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine for work. Lina has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Lina decided on doing her business because of her experience; she has been sewing since a young age. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by opening a sewing factory.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for work

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es: La señora Teresita G. es casada con el señor Juan Enrique Moreno Quiroz y son padres de familia de 2 niñas, son propietarios de 2 diferentes negocios uno de abarrotes establecido desde hace 9 años de nombre “Abarrotes Paola “ y otro de la venta de barbacoa los días viernes, sábados y domingos. Negocios muy bien establecidos ya que son personas muy dedicadas y trabajadoras. Están tramitando este crédito para la instalación correcta del cableado en el área del negocio de abarrotes y acabados interiores de su vivienda, para asi ofrecer un mejor ambiente y una mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita G. is married to Sr. Juan Enrique Moreno Quiroz and both are the parents of their two daughters. They own and operate two different businesses. One is a grocery store they started nine years ago called “Abarrotes Paola”. The other business involves selling barbecue on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. These businesses are well-established because they are dedicated and hardworking people.

Teresita is requesting this loan to install proper wiring in her grocery store and to finish the interior of her house, which will provide a better and more comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install electrical wiring in her store & finish the interior of her house

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas A. is a 60-year-old farmer, and believes that he is the richest man in the world because he has 10 children. Abbas has two milk cows and makes a living selling dairy products to local customers and traders. He has more than 20 years of experience in this line of work, and his milk products are in very high demand in his village. Abbas cannot keep up with this demand, and has decided to apply for a loan for  1,600 AZN to buy two additional cows and fodder. Abbas is very grateful to everyone at Kiva who is helping him improve his life thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy two cows and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en: Jennie A. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Jennie is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jennie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jennie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Jennie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jennie from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Angela Yazmin

texts.es:
Ángela T. de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Ángela empezó con una maquina de coser pequeña haciendo remendaduras a pantalones, camisetas, vestidos etc. Poco a poco reunió dinero para comprar otra maquina profesional y seguir con el taller de costurera.

Ahora Ángela trabaja en su taller de costurera desde las 08h00 hasta las 18h00. Tiene la ayuda de su mama en la costura. Ella trabaja con empresas que venden ropa las confecciona y las entrega. Una de las dificultades que tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hilos, agujas, ampliar su puesto de trabajo. En el futuro quiere ampliar la capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Ángela T., 37, lives in an urban zone of the suburb of Guayaquil. She has a cement house with all the basic services, and she is single with no children. Ángela started with a small sewing machine mending pants, shirts, suits, etc. Little by little she gathered enough money to buy a professional machine for a seamstress shop. Now Ángela works in her shop from 8 am to 6 pm. Her mother helps with the sewing. She works with businesses that sell the clothing she creates and delivers. One of the problems she has is the rain. With this loan she wants to buy thread, needles, and to enlarge her workspace. In the future she hopes to increase her production capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, needles

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvsuren lives with her four children and husband in Tuv Aimag around Ulaanbaatar. She and her family run a meat stand they started in 2008. In just those years, their business has done very well. She has many returning customers. The business has increased 10 times in those years and they were even able to get a car and build a building inside their fence. 

Lhagvasuren is 50 years old and her children are all in school. The girls are 24 and 19, and the boys are 22 and 15. One of her children is in college and will graduate this year. They pay for school tuition with the money from the business and she has three more children. 

She wants a loan so that she can by meat in bulk as that will help her increase her business. Lhagvsuren hopes one day that her business will grow enough that they will be able to build their own store. She is humble, pleasant to be around and also a diligent, hard worker.

loans.use: To purchase meat in bulk to help her increase her business

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 3,4,5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group “Mata D. Palma en Desarrollo 3,4,5” (Palm Tree in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small butcher shop by purchasing the necessary meat.

Carmen will use the profits from this business to invest in her children by purchasing the necessary food and school supplies. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús C. D. G. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 16 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Teresa posee una venta D. tortillas, la cual está ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en este lugar día con día Teresa se dedica a elaborar las tortillas, las cuales están hechas únicamente D. maíz, y las comercializa al mediodía en las tardes. Este negocio es muy rentable, ya que se venD. todos los días, y por ser una amable, posee muchos clientes que a diario llegan  a su negocio. Así mismo Teresa posee un molino, el cual no solo lo utiliza para moler su maíz, sino también  lo alquila a otras personas que habitan en los alrededores D. su casa. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, así mismo comprar algunos repuestos para el molino, con el fin D. mejorar la calidad D. su servicio. Ella es una persona la cual se esfuerza en gran manera por obtener más ganancias, ya que cuenta con el enorme deseo D. poder brindarle una vida mejor a su familia y brindarle ese apoyo tan necesario a su esposo.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús C. D. G. is 35 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and two children (ages 12 and 16) who are in school. Teresa prepares and sells corn tortillas day after day from her home. Her sales begin at 12pm. Her business is very profitable because she sells every day. Due to her friendliness, she has many customers who come by her business on a daily basis. Teresa also owns a grain mill. Not only does she use it to grind her corn, but she also rents it out to other people who live in the area surrounding her home.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of corn. At the same time, she will purchase a few spare parts for her grain mill so that she can improve the quality of her service. She is a person who greatly strives to earn more income, which will proviD. a better life for her family and enable her to contribute needed support to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & spare parts for her grain mill

loans.name: Norma Erendira

texts.es: La señora Norma Erendira A. se dedica a la venta de herramientas usadas en una pulga conocida de la ciudad. Con este negocio ya tiene un año de ofrecer este tipo de mercancía, pero ella en este momento necesita el apoyo para poder comprar más producto para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad. Aparte de recibir ingresos de su negocio ella y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora para darles una mejora calidad a sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Norma Erendira A. sells used tools in a flea market that is well known in the city. She has been in this business of selling this type of merchandise for one year. But, she now needs help to be able to buy more products in order to offer her customers greater variety. Besides the income from her business, she and her husband work in a factory in order to give their four children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Santa Marta, se conformó en fecha 21 de agosto del 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la Sra. Eulalia J.,  quien contactó con la asesora que también tenía un grupo en la misma zona, se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Es un excelente grupo gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado y continuan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Encarnacion M., quien es la presidenta del grupo, especificamente invertira el credito para la compra de Golosinas.
Encarnacion es vendedora ambulante, con mucho esfuerzo dia a dia recorre los colegios,las plazas,  las canchas deportivas para ofrecer sus golosinas y asi ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
The Santa Marta Women's Committee was formed as of August 21, 2008, thanks to the current Finance Director Ms. Eulalia J.. Ms. J. contacted a consultant who had another group in the area, the Women Entrepreneurs Program Committee. Once advised about this other program, she managed to gather 15 women who are working jointly, comfortably and with solidarity in their 5th cycle of the program. It's a great group thanks to the solid work already done and continued work with the program to this day. They perform fundraising activities and help each other to reach the common goals of the group and Fundacion Paraguaya. Encarnacion M., who is president of the group will invest the loan to buy sweets to sell. Encarnacion is a street vendor, who works hard everyday on a route to schools, squares, sports fields to offer and sell her candies to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of food (meat, vegetables, flour, spices, eggs, etc), purchase of clothes, buy lingerie, buy ingredients for making cakes, buying fruit and vegetables, buying drinks, buying articles for making clothes, buying ingredients to make mass purchases of food for pigs, buy sweets, buy dry goods, etc.

loans.name: Jose Rosel

texts.es:
José Rosel es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Santa Clara, una zona agrícola del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde muy joven en la agricultura, empezó apoyando a sus padres en las labores de cultivo y poco a poco fue aprendiendo del oficio, luego empezó a trabajar como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo vecinos y con los ahorros que guardaba de estas actividades pudo adquirir un campo de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, gracias a estas actividades el ha podido solventar sus gastos y sacar adelante a su familia.

Adicionalmente también cría vacas y vende la leche que ellas producen a sus vecinos. Jose Rosel ha instalado en su terreno cultivo de maíz y desea brindarle mantenimiento con fertilizantes de modo que pueda desarrollarse de manera correcta y así pueda obtener una mejor producción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José Rosel es una persona honrada y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para sacar adelante a su familia. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas por lo que es considerado como un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
José Rosel is a 36-year-old father who lives together with his wife and three children in Santa Clara, an agricultural zone in the Pitipo district located in Ferreñafe province, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked from a very young age in agriculture. He began by supporting his parents in their own farming activities, and little by little learned the trade. Later he started working as an agricultural day laborer in his neighbors fields, and with his savings from this work he bought his own fields in which he plants all kinds of crops. Thanks to this, he has been able to pay off his debts and provide a good life for his family. He also raises cows and sells their milk to his neighbors. Jose Rosel has planted corn on his land, and would like to use the most up-to-date fertilizers to grow his crops more efficiently, to get a better harvest. This is why he has found it necessary to ask for a loan of $2000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Jose Rosel es an honorable and hard-working person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to continue providing a good life for his family. He has previously worked with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with his loan payments, and is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the costs of growing his corn (fertilizer, etc.)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florencio de 55 años y sus 2 queridas hijas, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Yolanda junto a su esposo en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de papas y alverja, siendo estos productos de mejor calidad y que pueden ofrecer para el consumo diario. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectar sus cultivos. Con el tiempo desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su grupo comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y alverja, para sembrar en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a loving and happy 45 year-old mother. She is a homeowner and lives with her 55 year-old husband, Florencio, and her 2 beloved daughters whom she wishes to provide for a brighter future. Yolanda and her husband work hard in their vegetable garden to keep their crops well maintained, and therefore the products are bought quickly on the days they are sold. Their main source of income is the sale of potatoes and peas. These are the highest quality crops they can offer for daily consumption. Yolanda feels her work is paying off when she harvests her land, as such, this is her favorite part of the job. She has been doing this work for 30 years and considers the most difficult task is to be preventing her crops from being damage by pests. Eventually, she plans to buy more land to expand her crops. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She always pays on time and has never had any issues with her lending group, where she is in charge of adding the share of joy that keeps the other members happy. Yolanda is requesting 1,000 PEN to buy potato and pea seeds to plant this season.

Translated from Spanish by Liliana Matos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato and pea seeds

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Odsuren L. is 65 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger — a traditional housing tent. Her husband is retired and their son works in the local court decision implementing agency. Odsuren operates a food retailing business out of a small shop. She started her business in 1993 with working capital of 80,000 MNT and since then, it has increased 10 times. Over the years she has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to enlarge the business and purchase a bigger store than the current one." Odsuren is an open-minded, easy-going and hard-working woman. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza S. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family with a pig fattening business. She lives in Brgy. Atop-atop, Bantayan, Cebu City with her husband and their eight children, who are currently going to school. Analiza has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Analiza is borrowing 29,000 PHP for additional working capital. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Analiza hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Aniceth

texts.en:
Aniceth is 28 years old and still single.  Aniceth, as a young entrepreneur, started a business selling a variety of school items in 2005.  The hours of his business are from 7 am to 9 pm every day except Saturday.  

Aniceth, after realizing that he is not able to satisfy the demands of his customers, would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a and hopes that this loan will allow him to increase the size of his business through purchasing more school items for sale.  With the use of this loan to  purchase these items for sale, Aniceth will hopefully earn more profit and this profit will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business and creating more sources of income so that more people from his community can get jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items used in schools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements: strengthen walls and replace roof.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in Govi-Altai province, western of Mongolia. She and her family have been living in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent since 1995. Both her children attend a local middle school and her husband manages a taxi service in their town. Altantsetseg began her business in 1995. From 1988 through 1992, Altantsetseg attended a construction college majoring as a decorator and from 1993 to 1995, she worked as a shoe repairwoman in a local public service center. Since 2000, Altantsetseg has been working as a shoe repairwoman in the cold season and when the summer comes, she makes construction decorations in her town. In 2008, Altantsetseg received a 1,000,000 MNT loan from Xacbank in order to increase her business working capital. With her business revenues, she purchased two small cars. She attributes her business success to both her decorating and shoe repairing skills. Altantsetseg is a hard-working and optimistic woman who says, "Our family is saving money to build a house in the coming year where we will be living more comfortably". She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue for her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue

loans.name: Fleria Mutenyo

texts.en:
Fleria Mutenyo M., 49, is married to Geoffrey Moses, a business man. They have three children aged 31, 23 and 18 years old. Fleria’s primary business is a retail shop; she also runs a clothing store. She has been in these businesses for five years and is able to make 8,200 KES a month. She hopes to become a wholesale trader of general items in Bungoma town.

Fleria joined KADET after she attended a World Vision leaders’ meeting and learned more about what KADET offers. She has applied for her first loan which she will use to add more stock to her retail shop like sugar, flour, salt, sweets and others items. She also would like to buy more ready-made clothes for resale. Fleria anticipates increasing profits which she will use to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop and ready-made clothes for resale

loans.name: Flosset

texts.en:
Flosset is a 51-year-old widow with six children .She lives in an extended family in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 11 months and her biggest challenge is periodic electricity disconnection in the area.  Despite the challenge she wishes to diversify her business and serve male customers hence the need for a loan to buy a standby generator for the salon. 

Flosset intends to use the loan funds to purchase cosmetics and the generator for her salon business.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and  a generator for her salon business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, se encuentra ubicado en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte publico en un auto. El brinda servicio de colectivo cubriendo las rutas que unen a su distrito con las localidades que quedan cerca como Pacasmayo por ejemplo. El le dedica todo el dia a esta actividad y depende de ella para llevar el sustento a su familia. Su esposa posee una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda y con lo que ellos ganan sacan adelante a su hogar.

Marco desea brindar mantenimiento completo a su vehículo asi como realizar algunas reparaciones que le ayuden a funcionar de un mejor modo, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Marco es una persona responsable y que diariamente brinda su mejor esfuerzo para sacar adelante a los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio, 37, is a father living with his wife and children in San Pedro de Loc, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, over two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

He provides public transportation services in a car.  He provides collective service along routes that join his district with nearby locations like Pacasmayo, for example.  He spends all day in this activity and depends on it to provide support for his family.  His wife has a small grocery store in their home and their joint income allows them to support their household.

Marco wants to provide complete service maintenance to his vehicle as well as do some repairs that will make it run better but since he lacks sufficient capital to do so he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Marco is a responsible person who daily puts in his best effort to provide for his loved ones.  He has had past loans with Edpyme Alternativa and he has repaid them all in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For major vehicle service and repair.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Tity- Pain Group

texts.en: Pictured here are members of the “Tity Pain” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are businesswomen who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, seeking a loan of 1,000,000 leones each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Sarah M.. Sarah was born in Kabala town. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a police officer and her children are attending primary school. Sarah has been selling drinks, top-up cards for all four mobile networks, and gara lapper (locally dyed cloths) for many years now. She will invest her share of the loan into her business by buying drinks, top-up cards and gara cloths to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy drinks, top-up cards and gara cloth

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn H. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Evelyn is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. Her husband is the driver for local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for maintenance of motorcycle.

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en: Munhtuya B. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Dragon of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband operates a transportation business using his own car to support the family. Munhtuya operates a consumer-goods business at a local market in the city. She started her retail trading business in 2009 and has found success within a short period. Her monthly business profits have reached 350,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and her earnings have enabled her to buy electronic appliances for her family as well as contribute money to purchase a car for her husband. Munhtuya works hard to grow her business and hopes to expand in the near future. She has used her business earnings to solve her family's problem, therefore her working capital has decreased. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to increase her product amount in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 5, Brgy. Bal-os, Basay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  hog raising, selling of palm toddy (wine), and livestock businesses. Her husband Beato, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 14 and 34 years old.

Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,900, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her livestock so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of business and home repairs. Thelma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of raising hogs, and making palm wine.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe  D. is 58 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  General store and Eatery ("carinderia") businesses. She lives in Rizal Extension, Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her general store and eatery ("carinderia") businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Ma. Fe is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Ma. Fe aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sarah Wandia

texts.en: Sarah Wandia G. is a 37-year-old woman, married to John Kamondo. They are blessed with two beautiful children. They live in the Roadblock area in Eldoret Town. Sarah buys used clothes in bulk and sells them retail. She has been in this business for 11 years and makes a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. With this loan she wants to add to her stock by buying more bails of clothes for resale, and hopes with the income to open another business. Sarah's hope for the future is to build her own shop where she can open a wholesale business and also to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Rosalinda is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like detergent & canned goods. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
