loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like detergent & canned goods

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda, es una señora D. 65 años D. edad, se dedica a la ganadería y crianza D. cerdos, vive con su esposo y una hija llamada Silvia. Residen en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, su negocio lo tiene desD. hace mucho tiempo, cuidando del ganado y D. los cerdos los cuales comercializa en el tiangue D. Corinto.
Ella por el momento necesita un préstamo para comprar un caballo para usarlo como transporte, su intención es desplazarse D. un lugar  a otro sin la necesidad D. ocupar vehículo. Los sueños D. doña Hermenegilda es mejorar el negocio, aumentar su número D. cerdos en la granja y establecer una situación económica más estable.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is a 65-year-old woman. She raises cattle and pigs. She lives with her husband and their daughter, named Silvia. They live in the Corinto department in Morazon. She has been doing this business for a long time. She takes care of the cattle and the pigs that she sells in the market in Corinto
At this moment, she needs a loan in order to buy a horse to use as transportation. Her goal is to use the horse to get from one place to another without using a vehicle. She dreams of improving her business buy increasing the number of pigs on her ranch. Thus she will establish a more stable economic situation.

loans.use: She will buy a horse.

loans.name: No's Group

texts.en:
The six people who make up this group loan live in Preaek Ta Pov village in Kandal province. Mrs. No S., born in 1970, is the group leader. She was selected for this position by the other members. 
 
Mrs. No S. earns her living by selling fish at the market. Though she gains a small income from these endeavors, she does not earn enough money to adequately support her family. In order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan in order to buy more fish to sell and to enlarge her business activities. 
 
Her husband earns a small living as a motorcycle taxi driver. The couple has seven children: six are students and the youngest is still a baby.

loans.use: To buy more fish to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén, de 53 años de edad, convive con la Sra. Viviana hace mas de 27 años, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ellos ya son profesionales.  Viven en la zona los lotes (en alquiler). El señor Rubén se dedica al transporte hace más de 10 años el es dueño de una línea de micros  nos cuenta que él fue el fundador de la línea. El dinero que se le entrego al señor Rubén es para  el mantenimiento de su microbús (Reparación de motor), uno de los deseos del Sr. Rubén es tener su casita y así poder brindar mejor comodidad a su esposa, Agradeció por la colaboración que le está haciendo EMPRENDER  ya que depositaron confianza en él.
texts.en: Rubén, 53, has lived with Viviana for over 27 years; they have two children who are already professionals.  They live in the Los Lotes zone (they rent).  Rubén has been in transportation for over 10 years.  He owns a minibus line which he tells us he founded.  The money that was given to Rubén is for minibus maintenance (engine repair).  One of Rubén’s wishes is to have a house of his own to provide his wife with more comfort.  He appreciated EMPRENDER’s collaboration with him by trusting him.

loans.use: For minibus maintenance (engine repair).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man and the father of four children. He is from Lebanon. He is the main income provider for his family. He has six years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2007. He cultivates all type of vegetables and fruits according to the season. He uses plastic tents to better monitor his products quality. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. In the future, he plans to further expand his business and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.en:
Abdusamat lives in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan. He is engaged in trading tablecloths and towels. His mother helps him with his business. He is a very active and attractive person, which attracts customers. Abdusamat has been in this business for 2 years. He purchases his goods from the Dushanbe, Korvon market. He has many regular customers, because he has a large assortment of goods.

Abdusamat would like to get a loan of $1,350 USD to purchase new quality Turkish products, which will attract more new customers and expand his business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy quality tablecloths and towels for expansion of his business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Adelaida is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Luis Leonardo

texts.es: Luis tiene 71 años de edad y es casado. Vive con su esposa y un hijo en casa familiar que se ubica en el distrito de José Leonardo O., el distrito más grande de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Se dedica a la venta de carne de res en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento comercial. Tiene varios años de experiencia y buen manejo en esta actividad. Luis solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más carne para vender y también para ayudar solventar algunos gastos personales. Esta inversión lo ayudará a tener mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Luis es muy trabajador y responsable.  Ha manejado otros préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y los canceló con toda puntualidad.
texts.en:
Luis, age 71, is married and lives with his wife and son in the family home located in the district of José Leonardo O..  It is the largest district in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  He sells beef at the Moshoqueque Market, a large market with a lot of commercial activity.  He has many years of experience in managing this type of business.

Luis is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative which he plans to use to buy more meat and to help cover personal expenses.  This investment will help him generate more income and give his family a better lifestyle.  Luis is a hard worker and very responsible.  He has had other loans through Edpyme Alternativa and has always paid them back on time.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell at the local market

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has operated his food stall in Naivasha town for the last 2 years. He is 63 years old and married to Eunice Muthoni. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to open a clothes shop which will be run by his wife. 

In the future, Francis hopes to grow his shop into a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  Sylvia has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to take care of herself.  Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is a widow and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy steel bars, plain sheets and other materials for her sidecar.

Rosalia has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rosalia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy steel bars, plain sheets and other materials for her sidecar

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah, a married mother of five grown children, has been practicing mixed farming for the last 12 years in her hometown in western Kenya. Employing four farmhands, her farm produces maize and beans which are all sold locally. She is also a teacher at a local school.

Juliah has requested a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kes to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to expand her farming activities and improve her family's livelihood.

Juliah's biggest challenges have been diseases and inadequate amounts of animal feeds, both of which affect her production. She plans to acquire two more dairy cows and purchase land upon which to build rental houses in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with 3 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, spices, eggs, etc. for her sari-sari store. Evelyn has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from house rentals.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Gularus

texts.ru: Гуларус проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 29 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. Она три года проработала по профессии. Сейчас у нее имеется магазин, где она продает хозяйственные товары. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения тарелок, бокалов, чайников и пиялок (чайной чашки).
texts.en: Gularus lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 29 years old, married and has three children.  She and her husband are involved in retail sales.  She has a higher education as a teacher.  Gularus spent three years working in that profession.  Today, she has a store, where she sells household goods.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of plates, glasses, teapots and piyalkas (tea cups).

loans.use: to purchase plates, glasses, teapots and piyalkas (tea cups)

loans.name: Tsotso Alexine

texts.fr:
Alexine est âgée de 35ans. Elle est une femme mariée à un informaticien. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.
Alexine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend des produits génériques et pour cela s’approvisionne à Lomé au grand marché.
Alexine a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques.
texts.en: Alexine is 35 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is in computers. Alexine has been a merchant since 2006. She sells generic products, which she buys at the great market in Lomé. Alexine came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy generic products.

loans.use: to buy generic products.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celinda; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y zanahorias y también la socia trabaja como docente en el nivel primario desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo y el negocio de agricultura la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de agricultura y también quiere mejorar en su trabajo como docente. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR PASION”.The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, Cusco.

The member, Mrs Celinda, is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children. She owns a piece of farmland where she grows corn, potatoes and carrots. She also works as a primary school teacher from 7:00am until 6:00pm. She divides her time between her daily activites and her farming business; in this way she is giving her children a good start in life. Mrs Celinda wants to expand her farming business and also wants to improve as a teacher. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

The member is happy for the loan and is committed to paying the installments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Javier; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos, el socio tiene un kiosco en el mercado de Urubamba, el socio vende zapatos de mujeres, varones y niños, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This bank member is a member of the communal bank "José Carlos Mariategui," which is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

He is Sr. Javier. He is 40 years old and is married, with two children. He alternates his daily activities with his shoe business. He has a kiosk in the market of Urubamba. He sells shoes for women, men, and children. He works from 7 am to 7 pm. Through this business, he is raising his children. He wants to enlarge his shoe business. He is applying for the loan to buy shoes wholesale.

This bank member is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es: La señora Daría vive en la casa de su tío junto con su mama y su hija  a quien ella mantiene y le hace estudiar, su actividad es la venta de comida, tiene su puesto de comida  en la feria de 16 de julio sale a vender los días jueves y domingo donde le va muy bien ya que la Sra. Daria es muy conocida por sus deliciosas comidas, pero como son dos días nomas los que vende, el resto de los demás días lava ropa ajena por lo cual le pagan  la señora es muy sacrificada y el deseo mas grande que tienen  es ver a su hija profesional y convertirse en una persona de bien, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Daria es muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Daria lives in her uncle’s house with her mother and her daughter, who she takes care of and who studies. 

Her business is selling food. She has her stall in the 16 of July Fair [La Paz Day Fair] on Thursdays and Sundays where she is doing very well. Daria is well known for her delicious food, but because there are no more than two days for sales, the other days she washes clothes for others for which they pay her. 

She is self-sacrificing and her biggest desire is to see her daughter become a professional and a good person. The money she gets from the loan will be used to buy supplies for making her food. Daria is hardworking and thanks the foundation for their support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; el tiene 20 años de edad y es conviviente; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de minería, el trabaja en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere seguir mejorando, el socio quiere implementar su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles para su casa.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Amanecer Anteña". The bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.
The member is Jose Luis. He is 20 years old and lives with his partner. He mixes his household responsibilities with working as a miner. He works in the city of Puerto Maldonado. He wants to keep improving his situation by means of this job and wants to set-up his home. He is requesting a loan to buy furniture for his house. 
He is happy to have the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Lehnerr

texts.es: Lehnerr, de 28 años, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana,  donde tiene su propia casa. Apenas tiene secundaria completa, pero eso no lo impidió a que siguiera con sus sueños que tanto había anhelado desde su adolescencia. Es así que tiene su propia carpintería en donde elabora todo tipo de muebles, de acuerdo al gusto y preferencia de los clientes. Hoy en día se siente satisfecho por las ganancias que recibe y esto es gracias al buen acabado de los muebles que realiza. Normalmente trabaja con sus operarios, de esa manera puedan minimizar tiempo y costo en la elaboración de cada mueble. Usualmente su negocio de ebanistería se encuentra ubicado en su propio inmueble de lo cual se siente contento con lo que viene ejerciendo, posteriormente sus ganancias adquiridas lo invertirá en ampliar el espacio de su carpintería, con el propósito de adquirir nuevas maquinarias. Este será su sexto crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que contará una vez más su apoyo. El dinero solicitado, le servirá como fondo de capital para comprar variedad de maderas.
texts.en:
Lehnerr is 28 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives in the town of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful Ayachucan jungle, where he has his own house.  He barely finished high school, but that has not stopped him from following his dreams that he has had since he was an adolescent.  He has his own carpentry shop where he makes all types of furniture according to the taste and preference of his customers.  He feels satisfied by the income he receives thanks to the good workmanship of the furniture he makes.  

He normally works with his workers to minimize the time and cost of making each piece of furniture.  His woodworking business is located in his own building, and he feels happy with what he has accomplished.  In the past, he used his earnings to increase the space for his carpentry business so that he could acquire new machines.  

This will be his sixth loan, and he is very happy to know that he can once again count on your support.  With the loan requested, he will purchase a variety of woods.

loans.use: to purchase wood of various qualities.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Более 20 лет Олимджон занимается купля продажей скота. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он начал свой бизнес с одного коровы, а постепенно расширил данный бизнес. Сегодняшней день у него 2 голов коровы, 3 голов овца и 1 лошадь. Каждый день он встает рано утро и начинает свое работу. Его жена помогает ему в свободное время. Олимджон хочет купить 2 голов коровы и ремонтировать коровнику для улучшения условие своих скот. Для осуществления своих планов он просить помощь от вас.
texts.en: Olimjon has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 20 years.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He started his business with one cow and gradually expanded this business.  Today, he has two heads of cattle, three heads of sheep and one horse.  He gets up early in the morning every day and starts his work.  His wife helps his during her spare time.  Olimjon wants to buy two heads of cattle and make repairs to a cowshed in order to improve conditions for his livestock.  He is asking for help from you in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cattle and repair a cowshed

loans.name: Misaidi

texts.en:
Misaidi is a divorced woman with for children who are all enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for children.

Misaidi has operated as a food vendor for the past four years; her potential clients are her relatives and friends. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there is low demand during the rainy season. She aspires to own a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase beans, wheat flour, cooking oil and set up a place to sell her products. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get working capital for her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans, wheat flour, cooking oil and set up a place to sell her products.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la señora Vicenta quien se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dándoles una visión D. que a través del comité están alcanzando el progreso a cada una. Encantadas aceptaron continuar dentro del comité, y D. esa forma seguir creciendo. El comité cuenta con 16 miembros, donD. todas tienen la esperanza D. seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso D. cada una D. ellas y la D. su comunidad.
Una D. ellas es la señora Vicenta, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, a la cual acuden todos sus vecinos. Nos cuenta que comienza a trabajar a muy tempranas horas del día y acaba ya entrada la noche, su trabajo es muy sacrificado y agotador, pero pese a ello disfruta lo que hace.
Ella quiere poder seguir creciendo y por ello solicita el crédito para la compra D. arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados, carnes y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientela.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Vicenta who suggested the idea of creating well being among the members, giving them a vision that through the group each one of them are achieving progress. The group is maD. up of 16 members, and all of them have the hope to continue fighting to get ahead, each one of them looking to progress in their community.

One of them is Vicenta. She has a well supplied store which all the neighbors frequent. She tells us that she begins to work in the early morning hours of the day and finishes late at night. She makes many self sacrifices for her business and it is tiring, but in spite of that she enjoys what she does.

She wants to be able to continue growing and she is asking for a loan in order to buy rice, noodles, sugar, bread, meats and other items, with which she will be able to supply and meet the requests of her clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, bread, meat, and other items

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 32 years old and married.  She owns a clothing shop, which she has owned since February 2011. Fatima started her new business after she  working in a clothing factory, in order to improve her living conditions with a business of her own.  In addition to clothes, Fatima sells cosmetics, accessories, and shoes, which she believes attracts customers' attention to other items.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy new autumn and winter shoes and clothes collection, as well as cosmetics and accessories with special designs.  These new items will help attract new customers and increase her sales and income.

Fatima is a woman with good reputation, a hard worker who seeks perfection. She hopes to expand her business in the future through moving to a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new autumn and winter collection.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Patience has been working hard to manage her market stand, which sells fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Patience has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes and other fruits, and will help Patience to generate greater profits and pay her family's bills. Patience hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Patience is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Patience's future prospects by helping her.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and other fruits

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Félicienne  est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Joachim. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Félicienne et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Félicienne  mène comme activité depuis neuf ans environs, la vente de produits divers (igname, oignons, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Félicienne vend de l’huile à moteur. Félicienne s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Félicienne sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Félicienne ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Félicienne is 40 years old and married to a man named Joachim. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom go to school. In addition to their own children, they also have two other children in their care. 

Félicienne and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. In order to support herself and provide for her family, she has been selling various products (yams, onions, cassava flour, etc.) from her home for approximately nine years. As a secondary activity, she also sells motor oil. 
She buys her stock in Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her sales and revenue, Félicienne is seeking a sixth loan from ALIDé. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy yams, onions and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Ianeti, West Georgia. She is 31 years old and lives with her family:  Vakhtang and her mother-in-law. Vakhtang works as a truck driver and earns 200 Laris per month. Natalia is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, the family has a small dairy farm with two milk cows. She produces and sells on average 30kg of cheese per month. The family has two pigs and sells on average 12 piglets at the local market. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, the family has a greenhouse where greens and tomatoes are grown. The family sells harvested products at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Natalia requested a loan for the construction of a new greenhouse. With two greenhouses, she will be able to double the amount of grown and sold greens and tomatoes. This will increase the income of the family.  The income will be used for purchasing additional household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of KES 5,000. She will use the funds to purchase stock for her shop, such as tea leaves, sugar, and maize flour. With the anticipated profits she will educate her child and provide food.

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, sugar, and maize flour for her retail shop.

loans.name: Chinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chinh was born in 1955. She has two children who are adults. Her husband retired with a pension of 3,000,000 VND. She retired too with a pension of 3,000,000 VNĐ. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2012. In this first loan, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens for a better living standard.

Mr Xuyen is 42 years old. He has a child. He is a motorbike repairer. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy motorbike repair tools to support his job.

Mrs Le is 59 years old. She has one child. She is retired. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell vegetables in the market.

loans.use: to raise chickens to  better her living standard

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi produces kenkey for sale (kenkey is an African dish made out of maize). Esi has been in this business for some time now.  Esi lives together with her three children at Akonma near Cape Coast  She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Esi will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Chheng's Group Leader

texts.en:
Chheng was selected to be the group leader for a loan requested from Maxima. In the group, there are three members and they live in a village in Keansvay district in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

1-Chheng (pictured) is 59 years old and a widow. She lives in Keansvay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has five daughters. Two of them are  married, one is a garment factory worker and the other is still studying. 

Chheng has been raising pigs at her home with 10 years of experience, while her daughter is a garment worker with three years of experience. Chheng is applying for a loan of $350 to buy pigs and feed to increase her business.

2- Sophal (shown in the photo) is 45 years old. She lives at Keansvay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has two sons and one daughter. One is married, one is on an organization's staff and the last one is still young.

Sophal has been selling fruits with 10 years of experience, while her husband is a drawer with five years of experience. She is applying for a loan of $350 to buy more fruits to sell everyday. 

3-Yim (shown in the photo) is 40 years old. She lives at Keansvay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has three daughters and one son. Two of them work for a private company and two are still young.

Yim has been selling fruit at the market with ten years of experiences, while her daughter has been on the staff of a private company for one year. She is applying for a loan of  $350 to buy more fruits to sell everyday.

Photo: Chheng is shown in the middle .

loans.use: To purchase fruits for sale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Es un señor trabajador, casado con 5 hijos en edad escolar. Pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Desde hace más de dos décadas habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para cambiar la madera. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: madera, clavos y zinc. Él sueña con brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.

loans.use: para cambiar la madera de su casa de tambo

loans.name: Pendy Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Pendy Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Pendy Ann is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina D. lives in Dodowa, Dangme West District of Ghana and sells jewelry such as necklaces, earrings, bangles, bracelets, etc. In past years Philomina received funds from KSF as working capital. Due to the many women and the general population who patronize her shop, it is her wish to expand her business to meet their demands. She however, needs a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a widow and has four married children. When she became a widow, Lorenza saw the necessity of earning an income in some way and this is why she began to sell cosmetics. This is her only source of income because her children do not help her with her expenses. Lorenza has has several orders that she hasn’t been able to fill, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $375, which she will use to fill the orders. She believes she can return the loan over a period of 5 to 10 months.

Lorenza knows there are people who help those in need. You can help her, she needs your generosity and support. She thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lorenza es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos que están casados, después de enviudar, doña Lorenza se vio en la necesidad de obtener ingresos de alguna manera y así comenzó a vender cosméticos, para ella este es su único sustento porque sus hijos no le ayudan con sus gastos. Doña Lorenza tiene varios pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizará con este fin, ella confía en devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses.

Doña Lorenza sabe que hay personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ayudarle, ahora necesita de tu generosidad y apoyo, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 32. Her husband, Nhan, is 31. They have a daughter who is 6 years old. Loan makes sedge mats at home. Then she sells them  wholesaL. to a few sedge mat companies. Her husband sells lottery tickets daily. Their income is $12 per person/month. They want to get a loan of $75 to purchase materials for making sedge mats. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making sedge mats.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov runs a business selling children’s clothing at a large market in Kherson, Ukraine. She started selling about 10 years ago. In that time she has expanded her business to include five different sales locations in the market, giving her great exposure to potential customers and a good position for further growth. Lubov’s business is following a trend in the small market economy in Ukraine, where consolidation is taking place and successful vendors are able to grow and replace other small business that were not sustainable. Lubov has benefited from the financial services provided by Nadiya Ukraine, using capital from 18 loans to expand and develop her business. She has requested an additional loan of $1,000 to help her purchase new inventory and increase her product assortment.

loans.use: Increase inventory of children's clothing.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla (age 37) is maried to Leonardo (age 38), and they have two children, Maria (age 15) and José (age 8) who study in the neighborhood schools. Thanks to both parents having their own microbusinesses, they can offer their children a life without worrying about basic necessities. They own a humble yet beautiful home, where Perla has her business, and her husband is a mototaxi driver. 5 years ago, Perla asked her husband to use a part of their home, that until then was used as the living room, to put in a small business and in this way help with the family income. In this store she sells basic, needed products such as sugar, noodles, and also candy, soda pop and fast food. Her customer service and administration of this new microbusiness made her business grow every day, to the point of having to expand her storefront. While she and her daughter are in chage of the business located in their home, Leonardo, with his motorbike, works as a mototaxi driver within the city and towards Posadas (Argentina). The couple asks for $1000 to invest in finishing the expansion of the store facility in order to be able to offer better service to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Perla (37), casada con el Sr. Leonardo (38), tienen dos hijos menores, Maria de 15 años y José de 8 años, quienes estudian en instituciones educativas nacionales del barrio. Gracias a que ambos esposos tienen sus propias microempresas, pueden ofrecerles a sus hijos una vida sin mayores necesidades económicas. Poseen una humilde, pero hermosa casa propia, en donde Perla tiene su autoservice, mientras que su marido se dedica al mototaxi. Hace 5 años, Perla le pidió a su marido utilizar una de las piezas de su domicilio particular, que hasta ese momento era utilizada como sala, para poner un pequeño negocio y así ayudar con el ingreso familiar. En la misma vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, fideos, asi como también golosinas, gaseosas y comidas rápidas. La buena atención y administración de la nueva microempresaria hizo que su negocio vaya creciendo cada día más, hasta el punto que está ampliando la infraestructura de su local. Mientras ella y su hija se encargan del negocio de la casa, don Leonardo, en su moto realiza servicios de taxi (mototaxi) dentro de la ciudad y hacia Posadas (Argentina). La pareja nos solicita la financiación de $ 1 000, para invertir en la terminación del local ampliado, para así poder ofrecer mejor atención a sus clientes

loans.use: Expansion of store facility and infrastructure

loans.name: Tasilua

texts.en: Tasilua is 48 years old and the mother of 3 children. She and her family live in the village of Vaimoso. Her husband used to help her with the family’s canteen business, but he passed away during the beginning of this year. She joined SPBD in 2006, and borrowed $300 initially to begin her business. This will be her second loan from SPBD, and she hopes to expand her current business with a mini market. She currently earns $140 after expenses per week from her canteen business, and the additional profit will be used to support her family and to pay back the loans she currently has.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her canteen

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 26 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria. He earns money selling and repairing refrigerators. John would be greatful for a loan of US$700 to buy a bike, which will allow him to reach out to more customers and serve as a general means of transportation.

loans.use: Purchase of a bike

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is 28 years old and has two children. She lives with her family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh. Abir sells accessories, and has applied for a loan to buy more inventory to sell to her customers. This is the first time Abir has sought a loan from Al Majmoua, and she is excited about the prospect of expanding her business and better providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en: Tuti is 27, married, and has two children. Tuti and her husband both collect and then sell waste materials, earning $40.00 a week. She will use this loan to add to her business capital.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.en:
L. Kutfi is 47 years old. She is married with two children. 

Kutfi is a farmer who grows and processes the grapes. She has been in the business for ten years. Kutfi managed to make the business stable and profitable generating a significant income for the family. 

Kutfi needs to purchase mineral fertilizer. She also hopes to hire seasonal workers to help her. Therefor, Kutfi is requesting $850.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Kutfi had been provided with several loans, that she managed to pay with accuracy and she promises to repay the current loan promptly. Kutfi wishes to thank all for the support.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire seasonal workers

loans.name: Anitha's Muungano Middle Group

texts.en:
Anitha is 24 years old and is married woman with a 6-year-old child. Anitha owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam and Mwanahamisi, who have small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is38 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is also a fish monger and both have been running their fish business for 18 years but on a very small scale.  With the previous loan from SMT, Fatmata increased her stock and income, and she was able to assist her husband in meeting the family income.  Fatmata would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase 6 baskets of fish.

loans.use: She needs to purchase more stock of fish and maximize profit.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells detergent and washing soaps. She is single, and her income is not sufficient to cover her living expenses.

Luckily, there is high demand for her goods, so she is now seeking to expand her business and to thereby increase her profits. As such, she is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Fialuma

texts.en:
Fialuma S., 51, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the Taro and banana business. She sells her produce to her friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during the harvest season she supplies the public market with produce 2 days per week.

Fialuma has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Fialuma’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, a bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Mercedes Esperanza

texts.es:
Mercedes is 21 years old and lives with her husband and her 5 children. She works selling prepared food at the entrances of the local schools and in the small storefront she owns. She works all morning long preparing the variety of dishes she will later sell. She offers products at prices that the local people can afford, and as a result has excellent sales and lots of traffic through her storefront and points of sale at the schools. Without doubt this work helps her not to neglect her role as mother. The difficult part of the business is carrying her food to the various points of sale only to later carry them all to her tiny storefront, where she finishes the day selling all that she has left.

Mercedes' 5 children are the motor that drives her to continue working in order to offer them a quality education.

She wishes to invest the loan by renting a storefront close to the school in her area where she could sell her food comfortably, in one location. She plans to later convert the storefront into a cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 21 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza en las puertas de los colegios y el pequeño local que posee. Se ocupa toda la mañana en la preparación para luego vender sus diversos platillos, los cuales son de costos acorde a la posibilidad de las personas, lo que hace que su venta sea mayor y tenga más concurrencia. Sin duda este trabajo le ayuda a no descuidar su rol como madre dentro de su hogar, lo difícil es trasladar su comida a los diversos lugares para después llevarlos a su pequeño local donde termina de venderlos.

Mercedes tiene en sus cinco hijos, el motor que la impulsa a seguir trabajando, y así ofrecerles una educación de calidad.

Desea invertir el dinero que solicita en el alquiler de un local cercano al colegio de su localidad, donde pueda vender con tranquilidad sus platillos y convertirlo en un cafetín en el futuro.

loans.use: To rent a store close to the local school where she will be able to sell her prepared food more comfortably.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
La señora Grimanesa, socia del Banco Comunal “Doradinas en acción”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, el negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Tacna  Nº 121. Los clientes son las personas que viven por su barrio y turistas que visitan la localidad.
 
Con el préstamo de S/.500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará diversos productos para surtir el negocio como:  jabón de diferentes marcas (Marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.), papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar en sacos, lejía, detergentes, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, para ofertar a sus clientes.

Tiene 70 años, 4 hijos, quienes ya son profesionales e independientes. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas. Desea mantener bien surtido el negocio, porque así se distrae y no se siente sola.
texts.en:
Mrs. Grimanesa, member of the Doradinas en accion (Golden Girls in action) village bank, lives in El Dorado, San Jose de Sisa in San Martin, Peru. She sells groceries out of her own home on Tacna Street. Her customers are primarily her neighbors and tourists that visit the city. With this $175 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase various products to supply her business such as different brands of soap (Marsella, Bolivar, Jumbo, etc.), toilet paper in packages, fish preserves, vegetable oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent, and different brands and sizes of milk to sell to customers. She is 70 years old with 4 adult children who are professionals. She has always stood out for being a hard-working, responsible woman in all of her undertakings. She hopes to maintain a well-supplied store to keep her focused and from feeling lonely.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products like soap, toilet paper, fish preserves, oil, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur A. is a very enthusiastic 27 year old man. He runs a food store that he built next to his house. Here he sells jams, milk and meat, candies, sugar, salt and other things. This business has been the main source of income for Elnur's family for the last eight years, improving their living conditions. Now Elnur is requesting 1200 to expand his business and to increase the range of goods for sale. He thanks everyone who supports him.

loans.use: to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas S. is a friendly 31-year old married father of three girls and one boy aged 5 - 13, and he is also the caretaker of his deceased bother’s two young children. He supports his family working long days driving a boda boda (motorbike taxi) throughout Kampala. His days usually begin at dawn and stretch well into the evening. Thomas owns four motorbikes. He drives one of them and rents the other three for a fixed daily rate. In Kampala’s highly competitive market with thousands of boda bodas, Thomas enjoys a steady business and has regular clients. He attributes this to keeping his vehicles clean and well-maintained, using drivers who are licensed, safe, polite and trustworthy and his requirement that they wear helmets. Thomas has been a boda boda driver for ten years.

Thomas used his savings and a small loan from Pearl Microfinance to purchase his first motorbike four years ago. He has been using loans regularly since to expand his fleet and pay for routine maintenance and repair costs. Now, Thomas plans to sell his oldest bike, using the proceeds coupled with this loan to purchase a new one. He figures this will increase his daily revenue from 7,000 UXG to 10,000 UGX.

Thomas depends upon his business profits to pay for his children’s school fees and provide basic meals and clothing for his family. He hopes to keep expanding his boda boda business until he has enough money saved to purchase a pickup truck for commercial hauling. He says this market has much less competition and will enable him to earn more profit.

loans.use: Thomas would like to purchase a new motorbike for his small fleet of motorbike taxis.

loans.name: Norma Justina

texts.es:
La microempresaria Norma A. Montalván tiene 71 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, 6 de ellos viven en sus propias casas y 1 de ellos aun convive en la casa con 3 nietos los cuales estudian. Doña Norma tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años, donde vende gramos básicos, carbón en bolsas, pollo, gaseosas y otros productos de consumo diario en los hogares costeños.

En el sector donde habita la microempresaria A. es bastante conocida por el tiempo de tener este negocio y por la forma amable que trata a sus clientes, además los niños les gustan ir a comprar a este negocio ya que les ofrece caramelos a los mismos.

Al igual que otras pulperías doña Norma necesita un financiamiento sobre lo siguiente:

3 Cajillas de gaseosas a US$ 20.00 cada una, 80 libras de pollo a US$ 1.45 cada libra, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 56.00 cada quintal, 1 quintal de frijoles a US$ 55.00 cada quintal, 3 quintales de harina a US$ 48.00 cada quintal, 1 bidón de aceite a US$ 3.00 cada bidon, 10 sacos de carbón a US$ 3.00 cada saco, 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30.00 cada quintal y 3 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 30.00 cada caja.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Norma A. Montalván is 71 years old. She has seven older children, six of whom live in their own houses and one who still lives in her house with three grandchildren who are in school. Norma has owned a store for more than twenty years where she sells stamps, bags of coal, chicken, sodas and other products consumed daily in the homes of people who live on the coast. In the area where entrepreneur A. lives, she is quite well-known due to the time she's had this business and because of her amiable way of treating customers. In addition, children like to go to this business to buy since she offers them caramels. Similar to other stores, Norma needs financing to cover the following: 3 boxes of sodas at US$ 20 each, 80 pounds of chicken at US$ 1.45 per pound, 200 pounds of American rice at US$ 56 per hundred pound, 100 pounds of beans at US$ 50 per hundred pound, 300 pounds of flour at US$ 48 per hundred pound, 1 drum of oil at US$ 3 per drum, 10 bags of coal at US$ 3 per bag, 200 pounds of sugar at US$ 30 per hundred pound, and 3 boxes of 3-minute soup at US$ 30 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 boxes of soda, 80 pounds of chicken, 200 pounds of American rice, 100 pounds of beans, 300 pounds of flour, 1 drum of oil, 10 bags of coal, 200 pounds of sugar,  3 boxes of 3-minute soup.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. Ang T., 33, sells pork as well as selling soup in the market, while her husband buys pigs for slaughter. Her husband, Mr. Sun Bunkhon, buys pigs from raisers for slaughter and Mrs. T. is responsible for selling the meat in the market. The business is going well but is still small.

Now, Mrs. Ang T. wants to expand the business to make it bigger and she needs to pay for authorisation. Hence, she would like to request a loan to pay for the authority permit and use any remainder as capital to purchase more pigs to slaughter to sell their meat. T.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to pay for an authorisation and to purchase pigs for slaughter

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 41-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Abbas works as a house painter. He requests a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new painting tools and a car that will facilitate his work. This is the first time that Abbas has requested a loan.
Abbas is speciA. in his work because he has experience and he does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. He decided to start his business because he wanted to be independent in his work and also improve his family's situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Abbas will use the loan to purchase new painting tools and a car for his work.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Maruja tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, regalos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Maruja vende cosméticos por catálogos. 
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maruja son mejorar su negocio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the “Morenita” Communal Bank. Maruja is married, is 33 years old, and has 1 child. Maruja has a store in her home where every day she sells groceries, vegetables, gifts. In addition Maruja sells cosmetics via catalog. Maruja needs a loan for 1050 soles to invest in buying rice and sugar Maruja dreams of improving her business and have a stable economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Fazul Ahamd

texts.en: Fazul Ahamd is the son of A. R.. He lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has got a general store and all the family members benefit from his income. He wants to expand his business and to attract more customers, so he has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He is happy that he has got the chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: buying inventory for his general store

loans.name: Suwbatu

texts.en: Suwbatu is 50 years old and married with 4 children. Suwabatu sells firewood and charcoal and she has been in this business for the past 10 years. Suwabatu has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Lợi năm nay 44 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 2.000.000đ để đầu tư buôn bán hàng tạp hoá . Đến nay sau 5 vòng vốn sử dụng hiệu quả gia đình chị đã có thêm điều kiện để đầu tư làm thêm nghề say sát gạo. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  từ kinh doanh, làm nghề say sát gạo gia đình chị Lợi đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 17.000.000đ để đầu tư  vốn cho công việc buôn bán  và đầu tư mua thêm một số dụng cụ phục vụ cho công việc say sát gạo của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Le Thi L. is 44 years old. She has joined TYM Fund since 2003. She used her first loan of 2,000,000 VND (115 USD) to buy inventories for her sundry goods store. After efficient uses of five loans, Mrs. L. and her family have been able to start another job: to husk rice. With the monthly income of 3,000,000 VND (or 172 USD) from these two jobs combined, Mrs. L.'s family's life has been much improved. This time she would like to borrow 17,000,000 VND (or 975 USD) to have more funds investing in her store and buy a few more tools to husk rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bussiness

loans.name: Madeo Mawussi

texts.fr: E. est une femme mariée  et a trois enfants. Pour aider  son époux dans les charges du foyer elle a entamé la vente des articles de friperie en 2007, elle a aussi ouvert une cabine téléphonique dans sa boutique. ce commerce marche bien et elle a une manière très impressionnante d’attirer la clientèle. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de ses clients. elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 05 balles de chemises, 05 balles de jupes, 03 balles de veste.
texts.en:
Mrs. E. is a married woman with 3 children. In order to help her spouse cover household expenses, she began selling used clothing in 2007. She also opened a phone booth in her little shop. This business is doing well and she has a very impressive manner of attracting clientele. Her present stock of merchandise does not allow her to respond to the demand of her customers, so she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 5 bales of shirts, 5 bales of skirts, and 3 bales of sweaters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Pajaten Nº 1046 – La Merced, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años, 02 hijos estudientes.

Mónica, es una mujer joven, se dedica al servicio de Internet, implementaron su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, atiende diariamente con muy buena demanda de clientes,  por lo que se siente muy contenta ya que es el único Internet en el barrio.
Nos cuenta también que para iniciarse, tuvo que haber pasado por muchos retos, empezaron solo con dos cabinas, viendo que rendía el negocio ampliaron el local y hoy se encuentran trabajando 6 PC`s.
En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que son sus amigos, vecinos y clientes fijos, cuenta con un personal que la apoya y brinda servicios de tipeos y otros trabajos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando equipos para pc`s, ya que algunas maquinas están lentas, y necesitan cambios. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá para implementar su propia red inalámbrica, para así no tener dificultad con la línea y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Mónica, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy capaz, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que le ayudo a iniciarse como una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Monica belongs to the El Abiseo community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is married, 28 years old and has two school-aged children.

Monica operates an Internet services business. They--she?--set up her business in her house and she tends her customers there every day. The demand for her services, the only Internet services business in the neighborhood, is high, something that gives Monica great pleasure. She tells us, too, that she had to overcome many challenges to start the business. She started with just two cabins but, seeing the potential for the business, they--she?--expanded the shop which now has 6 PCs. Now that she's a fixture among her customers--her friends, neighbors and regulars--she's hired staff to help with typing services and other work.

With this S/.3,000 [3,000 Peruvian soles] loan, she wants to purchase PC-related equipment because some machines are slow and need to be changed out. Another part of the money will be used to set up a wireless network to avoid problems with the fixed-line system and to provide a better service to her customers.

Monica now believes that she can do anything and she's anxious to get ahead and make her dreams come true. She's very grateful to the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos which has helped establish her as a woman entrepeneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy computer equipment for Internet services business.

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme activité  secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz, d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 group is made up of married women from the village of Fonfona, town of Koutiala, region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law etc. They have an average age of 40 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four loans, they are on their 5th rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of rice seedlings, of peanuts, minor agricultural material, and intrants for their crops at the market of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. After the rainy season, the harvests will be stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain increased value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and in the surrounding markets, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele coming generally from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 group expects to make, after their yield is sold, a profit of 60,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and cover current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Esiata

texts.en: Esiata is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and the mother of four who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Esiata has been in business for the last thirteen years. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of the children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. She is a member of the community group called ‘Success’. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi tiene 27 años, es una madre muy alegre y comprensiva, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde que se unió con su pareja, un hombre dedicado a las labores agrícolas, empezaron a sembrar papas, arvejas y maíz en chacras alquiladas, donde pagan al año entre 200 a 700 soles, dependiendo la accesibilidad de transporte a la chacra. Estos precios se cotizan en chacras  temporales (regadas por la lluvia), de ser en chacras de regadío el precio es mucho mayor. Ovi se levanta muy temprano para cocinar los alimentos, atender a su bebe y después darle el alcance a su esposo que trabaja en sus cultivos. Ovi ama su actividad, no siente cansancio ni pesadez al cultivar sus tierras, ya que de ello dependerá su buena cosecha que comercializará en el mercado de  la cuidad de Tarma. Esta dinámica de trabajo le resulta muy rentable y piensa continuar de esa manera para lograr comprar sus propias chacras y su casa propia en aras de brindarles mayores comodidades a sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, también le gusta asistir a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal programadas por su asesor de crédito e intervenir con opiniones acertadas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 10 sacos de fertilizantes químicos y una bolsa de semilla de arvejas para seguir renovando sus siembras.
texts.en:
Ovi is 27 years old, is a very happy and attentive mother, and lives with the father of her 3 children in a rented house. Since she married her husband, a man who does agricultural work, they began to sow potatoes, peas, and corn on rented farms, for which they pay between 200 and 700 soles per year, depending on how accessible the farms by transportation. These prices are also determined by how the farms are irrigated; if the farms have irrigated land, then the price is higher than if the farms are irrigated by rain. Ovi wakes up very early in the morning to cook food, to take care of her baby, and then to give the rest to her husband, who works with the crops. Ovi loves her work. She doesn’t feel tired or bored in cultivating her land, since a good harvest depends on this activity. She will sell her harvest in the market in the city of Tarma. This work is very profitable, and she plans to continue this so that she will be able to buy her own farms and her own house so she can offer her children a more comfortable life. This is her eighth loan with MFP, which demonstrates her honesty and responsibility in her repayments. She also likes to attend all of the community bank meetings, which are planned by her loan counselor, and to participate with good opinions. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy 10 sacks of chemical fertilizers and a bag of pea seeds to continue planting.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: María Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina A. D. S. resiD. en Ciudad Arce departamento La Libertad, 52 años D. edad, vive solamente con su  esposo, La Sra. María se dedica a la venta D. tortillas desD. su casa donD. tiene ya hace 7 años experiencia en dicha actividad, las tortillas D. María tiene una buena demanda ya que muchos D. sus clientes manifiestan que son las mejores del lugar por ser hechas con comal y no con cocina tradicional, el  crédito que solicita María es para compra D. maíz, lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción D. tortillas y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
María Delfina A. D. Saavedra lives in Arce city in the La Libertad department. She is 52, and she lives with her husband. María sells tortillas from her house. She has seven years of experience doing this. There is a good demand for Maria’s tortillas. Lots of her customers say that her tortillas are the best around because they are maD. with a “comal” (a clay or metal dish used for making tortillas) instead of the traditional way. The loan that María is asking for is to buy corn, which will allow her to increase her tortilla production and generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn to increase tortilla production

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children aged 22-5 years as she takes care of 4 relatives. She has a bakery business that she has had for 4 years and at the same time is involved in wood selling. She sells firewood that is used for cooking in schools, homes and hospitals. She ensures that she has enough raw materials for her bakery and firewood and she would like to be the largest supplier of bread in Wakitaka and Jinja town. She also wants to engage in farming and have a piggery business so that she could be able to clear her children’s school fees with much ease due to the increased income. Sarah needs a loan to be able to increase capital of firewood so that she could increase sales. She is indeed a hard working lady with many dreams.

loans.use: Buying more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. Theary K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Borun Uk, 45, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They married in 1988 and have four children. Of their three sons, one of them has full-time employment, and another one studies in the local school. One daughter is a garment factory worker.

Theary has been a silk weaver for 23 years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been growing rice for 27 years.

Theary is asking for a first loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es: Dinora S. Y. ella tiene la edad de 26 años, a pesar de ser alguien tan joven ha logrado aprender mucho en este negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo, hace más de 10 años que sabe de este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven ya que su familia tenía esta misma actividad, y a ella le gustaba ayudar a su familia para que así salieran adelante. Al ver que esta actividad era rentable decide establecer su propio negocio y es así como este negocio le queda a ella para sufragar los gastos de su familia y proporcionarles a sus 2 hijos lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de masa, maíz, hojas y utensilios necesarios para el destace. Su deseo es tener su propio puesto en el mercado.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
“Always be kind to everyone", says Eduardo Jr. of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He 39 years old and still single.  He is living with his parents and helps them in sending some of his siblings to school through his business.

Farming is their main source of living.  He helps his parents to plow their farm by planting rice and some vegetables. But aside from this, he is also engaged in tricycle transport business for another source of income.  He is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP7,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle and purchased the needed agricultural supplies for their farm.  He uses his income to meet their daily needs and to support the tuition fees and allowances of his younger brother and sisters.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of his tricycle and farming needs

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Clarita C. is married to Wilfredo C., a factory worker in Saudi Arabia. They have four children, namely: Denver, Christian, Welbor and Maribel. Three children are currently enrolled in college. Clarita says that having a husband abroad is difficult, but they need to sacrifice to support the educational needs of their children.

Mrs. C. wants to help her husband send their children to school, because she knows that meeting the needs of their children in school is costly. She learned that through this program she could help her husband, so she wants to borrow 40,000 pesos to buy pig feed.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

location.town: Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Roxas, Isabela

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Sol y Luna está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a L. Zona D. Pampahasi,  las socias se dedican a L. venta D. Viveres, pan, Cerveza, Abarrotes, refresco, venta D. comida, venta D. papa, venta D. medicamentos, Cosméticos Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 5 ciclos se reestructuro en un 30% D. las socias
Angelica  es L. representante, líder fundadora del banco D. emprendimiento y presidenta del banco desD. hace 3 ciclos teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 5 ciclos, L. socia tiene una  tienda D. abarrotes. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona dinámica, alegre muy determinada al momento D. manejar a su grupo es una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a L. hora D. pago, el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en L. tienda y generar mayores ingresos económicos familiares.
Patricia, es L. tesorera del banco es una D. las socias dinámicas ya trabaja con L. institución 2 ciclos actualmente tiene una tienda D. barrio, durante su permanencia L. señora no presento problemas, el préstamo lo invertirá en el aumento D. capital para L. tienda, y generar mayor ingreso para L. tienda.
Yuly,  Socia bastante dinámica, alegre, es L. secretaria del Banco, durante su permanencia en el banco siempre se encuentra animando a sus compañeras, a seguir adelante, actualmente se dedica a L. venta D. Cosméticos el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para el aumento D. capital.
Durante su permanencia no presento problemas, en el pago D. sus cuotas mas lo contrario responsabilidad durante L. permanencia D. su crédito.
texts.en:
The Sol y Luna Communal Bank is comprised of ten members from the Pampahasi area. The members sell supplies, bread, beer, groceries, soft drinks, food, potatoes, medicine, and cosmetics. During the five cycles that they have been with Emprender, they have restructured 30% of their membership. Angelica is the representative. She is the founding leader of their entrepreneurial bank. She has been the president of the bank for three of their five cycles. She has a grocery store. She has stood out in her communal bank as a dynamic person. She is happy and is now very determined to manage her group. She is a leader who is responsible with her colleagues and fastidious about her colleagues’ payments when they are due. With the loan she was able to increase capital in her store and generate greater family income. Patricia is the treasurer of the bank. She is one of the dynamic members. She has worked with the institution for two cycles. She currently has a neighborhood store. She has presented no problems during her membership. With the loan she will increase the capital in her store and generate more income for the store. Yuly is a dynamic and happy member. She is the secretary of the bank. During her membership in the bank she has always been encouraging her colleagues to get ahead. She currently sells cosmetics. She needs the loan they are asking for to increase her capital.
