She has not presented problems with her payments during her membership. To the contrary, throughout her membership she has shown responsibility with her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Dolgormaa is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. Her daughter attends a local secondary school, while her husband runs a transportation business and Dolgormaa owns a used clothing retail business. She began her business in 2003 and her dream is to one day buy an apartment in the city so that her family can be more comfortable. There is a large market for used clothing in Mongolia, as many people do not have the resources to purchase new clothing. Dolgormaa is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan in order to purchase more used clothing to sell during the winter months.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell during the winter months.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. L., 60, is an entrepreneur who lives in Lumil, Silang, Cavite with her only child, who is in college, and her husband Guillermo, 54.
 
Virginia manages her own food canteen located at the heart of the village.  It has been around for four years now.   She also runs a general store along with the canteen. She earns a net income of more than $560 a month.  She uses her profits for the continuous operation of her canteen.  Most of her family’s basic daily needs are from the proceeds of her business, including the college expenses of her child.  

Virginia currently needs a loan of 20,000 PHP for the continuous operation of her business.  She has been dreaming of establishing a branch in another part of the province.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a la garde et la charge de 03 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents et proches. Son crédit lui permet de mieux développer son activité de vente de balais, des balais fabriqués à partir des feuilles de palmiers. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 43-year-old woman who is married and without children.  She is the guardian of three children, who were entrusted to her by parents, friends, and relatives.  Her loan enables her to develop further her business selling brooms made of palm fronds.  She takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her commercial business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. Her husband is a trader, and the family lives in the Cape Coast region of Ghana. She sells items such as jeans, trousers, blouses, ladies slippers and cosmetics. Eva says that the sale of cosmetics is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory and, along with it, her income so she can do a better job of meeting her family’s needs. She will use this loan to travel to Accra to buy these goods in bulk, and would very much appreciate your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad C., 47 years old, is a busy vendor of cucumber and seaweed. She has four children. The eldest, 28 years old, helps her run the business. She says that her business is doing well now but sometimes, especially if there is bad weather, she cannot be certain she will have good profit from her business. She has applied for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy fish to resell and seaweed seedlings.

loans.use: To obtain more fish to resell and seaweeds seedlings

loans.name: Martha M

texts.es:
La señora Martha S. es una dama muy trabajadora que a diario atiende su venta de ropa y carteras ubicada en el mercado la Terminal de León donde a diario busca la manera de vender sus productos a todos los clientes que visitan el mercado. Ella es una persona muy persistente en el trabajo y con gran deseo de superarse y convertirse en una gran comerciante.
Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de la ropa y carteras para continuar comercializándolas en su localidad y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, de ella y de su negocio que hoy más que nunca requiere inversión.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha S. is a hardworking woman who sells clothing and handbags every day at the terminal market in León. She always looks for ways to sell her products to everyone who passes through the market. Martha is persistent in her work and has a great desire to overcome obstacles and become an excellent merchant.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase clothing and handbags so that she can keep her business in operation and continue generating income to preserve her family’s welfare. Therefore, her business is in current need of additional investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & handbags

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly S. is 46 years old, married, and resides with her four children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has a business selling furniture made from wood and earns approximately $7 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially her children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000 and her husband is a teacher for a public primary school, earning an income of  $2.50 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. started her business so she wants to have a loan to expand it. 

S. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more wood to make more furniture to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. 

S.'s sons are pictured here.

loans.use: To buy wood to make more furniture to sell.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a tres de sus seis hijos en el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito cuya población se encuentra situada en su mayoría en áreas rurales , pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender carne de pollos de ganja y aves de corral desde hace más de ocho años. Sebastiana nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en esta actividad debido a que su espso trabaja como obrero aventual y los ingresos que percibe no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

Sebastiana compra pollos de granja vivos en el mercado Moshoqueque y los lleva hasta su casa donde los cría y, de acuerdo a la demanda, los va sacrificando y vendiendo por kilos. Eventualmente también ofrece en venta la carne de aves de corral que ella misma cría. El negocio es de mucha utilidad no sólo para ella, sino que también lo es para sus vecinos, ya que la zona queda muy alejada del distrito de Morrope y no tienen acceso a productos frescos.

Sebastiana desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas pollos para venderlos no sólo en su caserío, también en los caseríos cercanos, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momendo de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 50-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and three of her six children in the Lagunas community in the district of Mórrope, a district whose population mainly lives in rural areas. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than eight years, Sebastiana has worked selling domestic birds and the meat of farm-raised chickens. She tells us that she had to begin working in this field since her husband works as a seasonal laborer, and the income he receives was not sufficient to cover the family's expenses. Sebastiana buys live farm-raised chickens at the Moshoqueque market and takes them home where she raises them. She butchers them when there is customer demand and sells them by the kilo. At times, she also offers meat from pen-raised birds which she raises herself. The business provides great benefits not only for Sebastiana herself, but also for her neighbors, since their area is very isolated within the Morrope district, and they do not have access to fresh products. Sebastiana wants to expand her business, buying more chickens to sell not only in her community, but in nearby areas. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she is planning to use in support of her goal. She is an extremely hard-working woman who is very dedicated to her family. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying farm-raised chickens in order to sell the meat

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Mr. Bernardino C. is a resident of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 74 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. He has managed his own sari-sari store (small general store) for almost three years. He is able to earn a monthly net income of 5,400 PHP from this business.
In 2008, Mr. Bernardino joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services from the co-op. He is now on his third loan and has repaid his previous loans on time. Mr. Bernardino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP. The proceeds from this loan will be used as additional capital for his current business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for his business

loans.name: Marie Cris

texts.en: Marie Cris G. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Wayang Phase 2, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living from her general store business. Marie’s husband, Delfin, has his own job but sometimes helps her manage the store. They have five children who are between 10 and 21 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Marie Cris joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Marie Cris is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 10,000 as her 5th loan which she intends to use in her general store business. Marie Cris is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with a two-year-old son and a five-year-old daughter who attends school. Her husband is a driver. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.
Faith runs a salon. With her 40,000 KES loan, she wants to pay rent for her stall and purchase weaves and cosmetics. She has been in this business for eight years and previously was in school. Her customers are mainly women. The greatest challenge to her business is competition from other salons. Faith aspires to expand her business into a large salon with many customers. She also hopes that she will be able to support her children through university. She decided to work with Kiva partner, Yehu, because it can boost her business. Faith describes herself as an active woman.

loans.use: To purchase weaves and cosmetics, and pay rent for her stall

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mr. Thol M. is 60 years old, and he is a villager who lives in Ta Pech village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ya Phan, are farmers who own 1.40 hectares of land to cultivate rice for their family's living. In order to support this farm, Mr. Thol M. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine (for irrigation) to water plants. This couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the last one is a student in the local school. His wife is the picture with him.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine for irrigation

loans.name: Bernarda Lucia

texts.es: Bernarda tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues los financiamientos le han sido de mucha ayuda. Tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo, La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa nueva, hace más de 5 años, por eso vende prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, como blusas de licras, algodón, vestidos, jeans y otros. Actualmente llega la temporada fría por lo desea adquirir gran cantidad de ropas como camperas, suéter, pantalones y otros. Ya que ella desde muy joven se inicio a la venta de ropas y día a día va creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo. Es el destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Bernarda has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time and the loans have been a great help. She has a young son. Bernarda has been selling new clothing for more than five years, which includes garments for women, men, and children such as spandex and cotton shirts, dresses, jeans, and other items. Now that the cold season has arrived, she wants to buy a greater amount of clothes such as jackets, sweaters, trousers, and other types of articles. Ever since she started selling clothes as a young woman, Bernarda has been able to grow every day thanks to her efforts.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy products that her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more clothing

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya sells shawls in order to increase her family's financial comfort. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to expand her business selling shawls (a fabric square worn by women over the shoulders or head).

She lives in the city of Multan, which is famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats and holy places. She owns a small house of two rooms, and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years.

Surriya is a very talented lady and is an expert in her work. She sells embroided and colored shawls to her customers. Her selection of shawls attracts her customers to her business. Multan is famous for its "saint places". To maintain the legacy, women wear shawls to cover their heads as a sign of respect and men also wear scarves on their heads.

With the loan, Surriya will buy the shawls in bulk. She is hopeful that she can greatly increase her income which will help her family have a better financial life.

loans.use: To purchase shawls in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 23 años, es una madre de familia joven y muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y su hijo Julio de 2 meses en una casa alquilada. El negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de juguetes y artículos del hogar. Su puesto es alquilado, situado en el  mercado más concurrido de su distrito, a solo 10 cuadras de su casa. Tiene clientes muy solventes que le dan dinamismo económico a su negocio, es por ello que su trabajo se basa con mucha cordialidad y la mejor atención. Lleva 2 años trabajando en esta actividad y considera que le gusta su trabajo, ya que le permite cuidar de su hijo y dar la rentabilidad que necesita, sin embargo el no contar con suficiente presupuesto, le impide abastecer su puesto. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse su terreno, para construir su casa y ampliar su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, ya que sabe que éste aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar su negocio, y de ese modo su puesto luzca renovado y abastecido de variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Raquel is 23 years old and is a young and very hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and 2 month old son, Julio, in a rented house. She sells toys and household items for a living. She rents a stand in the busiest market in her district, only 10 blocks from her house. Her business is vigorous because she has customers that are able to pay their debts. For this reason she is able to focus on customer service and give her customers the best attention. She has been working in this business for 2 years and she likes it. It allows her to care for her son and is profitable, however she does not have enough money to stock her stand. Her greatest desire is to buy some land so that she can build a house and expand her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to repaying it on time because she knows that this loan will be very useful for the growth of her business. With this loan she plans to increase her business by giving her stand a new look and stocking a variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her market stand

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a market entrepreneur from Kamenka. She sells groceries, tea, coffee and fruits in one of the local markets. Liana owns a small vending kiosk equipped with electricity and located in a good part of the marketplace. Liana started her business 10 years ago. Presently, she has 32,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Liana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. She tries to offer only fresh produce for sale which has helped her gain good reputation among customers. One of Liana’s long-term plans is to glaze her vending kiosk which will give her a chance to work even in bad weather conditions. Liana’s venture has been developing steadily. There has been consistent progress in her professional growth, too. Liana has a serious approach to lending assistance and is responsible about her liabilities.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 27 años, es una mujer ejemplar y luchadora que vive con su pareja Marcelino, de 29 años y sus dos pequeños en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a sembrar habas, papa, arveja maíz gladiolo, para venderlos en los días festivos, su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa eléctrica colocando postes de luz, la ayuda en la comercialización. En tanto cuando es temporada de siembra y cosecha, Carmen contrata operarios para que pueda agilizar su labor. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar y cosechar la arveja porque le resulta rentable por la demanda que tiene en los mercados de su ciudad, donde el saco lo vende a S/. 50.00 soles al  por mayor. Para Carmen, la agricultura es rentable porque le permite cubrir los gastos de su familia y las primeras necesidades de toda su familia, por eso en el futuro, desea continuar en la agricultura pero sembrando en mayor cantidad, además piensa arreglar su vivienda para instalar una tienda de comestibles. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal porque se siente en familia, ya que así aprende a ser más responsable. Con el crédito que recibirá, pretende comprar semilla de arveja y varios pies tablares de madera para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen, 27, an exemplary, hard-working woman, lives with her husband, Marcelo, 29, and their two young children in a house that they own. She has operated a farming business for 10 years, growing broad beans, potatoes, peas, maize and gladiolus, that she then sells on market days. Her husband, who works erecting power lines for an electric utility, helps her on the farm. Carmen also hires laborers during the planting and harvesting season to speed up the work. What she most likes about the business is planting and harvesting peas because the return on the crop in the city's wholesale market comes to S/.50 (50 new soles) a bag. Farming is a good business for Carmen because the profits from the business cover the family's expenses. She wants to continue farming and plant bigger crops. She would also like to set up a shop to sell basic food items. This is Carmen's fourth MFP loan. She likes working with her community bank because she considers them family and because they have taught her how to be more responsible. She will use this loan to buy seed for the farm and supplies to set up a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed for farming business.  Materials for setting up a corner shop.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Samorn M. is a villager in Si Sla village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Vong, is a soldier who gets a low salary to help support his family. 

Her problem is that her field is far away from an irrigation system, and she does not have enough money to solve that problem. So to improve her production, Mrs. Samorn M. is seeking a loan to buy a pump machine, and with the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire a plow machine to plow her field. 

She is the mother of a child who is now married. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligado a las tareas agrícolas y hoy junto a su esposa desempeñan esta labor diariamente ya que desde las horas de la madrugada salen a ver sus terrenos de cultivo y verificar que todo marche bien, en ocasiones extrae la mala hierba que crecen dentro de sus campos, lo cual perjudican mucho en el crecimiento de sus frutos. Los productos que siembra es la papa, el maíz y la calabaza, que luego de un tiempo cosechan y son llevados a los mercados mayorista de su ciudad, generándole así ganancias. En adelante Víctor esta pensando incrementar su producción y emprender un nuevo negocio en la ciudad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Víctor is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a home of their own. He's been bound to agriculture all of his life and he and his wife work the fields daily. Beginning at dawn, they go out to check their land and crops to be sure that everything is progressing well. Sometimes they have to pull the weeds which often invade their crops. They raise potatoes, corn, and squash, which they later harvest and take to the city's main market. This is how they generate an income. In the future, Víctor wants to increase his production and begin a new business in the city. This will be his second loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial backing and that he has always proven himself to be responsible with his payments. He is also happy to be a part of a communal bank because all of its members are very responsible and united people. He appreciates those who will manage the loan he is requesting. It will be very useful toward his business' progress. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a resident of Vehari, a small city located in Punjab Province, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. A very caring woman, Zainab spends her time at home carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother. Her husband M. has an animal-selling business, purchasing, raising, and then selling them to animal markets and to his individual customers. Zainab also helps him by feeding and watering the animals and keeping their living area clean so they don't contract any disease.

Zainaib has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy goats and sheep with the goal of doubling his income.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Nelly is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Nelly owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers and also running a mini store. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Baby S..  She is married and has two children aged eight and 12 years.  In 2006, Baby established her palm oil and rice selling business.  She began her business to generate enough income in order to educate children.  Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Baby requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and rice.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Baby plans to establish a savings account, educate her children to university level and construct a house.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plam oil and rice.

loans.name: Parissi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Parissi est composé sept  femmes  toutes mariées de la ville de Tènè, préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième région administrative de la république du MALI). Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et sont mères d’au moins 6 enfants.  Elles font de la restauration, la vente de condiments alimentaires, de pagnes wax, de tissus, de bijoux etc. 
Pour satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans. 
Hawa T. compte utiliser son prêt pour aller s’approvisionner à Bamako, en achetant, 15 pièces de wax, une douzaine de tissus pour enfants et deux douzaines de bijoux.   
Elle espère réaliser un  bénéfice de 22.500FCFA par mois. En plus du remboursement du prêt, elle utilisera une partie de son  revenu  pour l’entretien des enfants et les autres dépenses de la famille. En ce qui concerne les autres femmes du groupe, elles comptent sur un bénéfice de 18 000 francs FCFA par mois.
texts.en:
The Parissi group consists of seven married women who live in Tènè, in the San prefecture, within the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They average 38 years of age and have at least six children each. Their activities revolve around the restaurant business and the sale of condiments, wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fabrics, jewelry, etc.

In order to satisfy a steadily increasing customer base, the members of the group turned to the  Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution two years ago.

Hawa T. plans to use her loan to get supplies in Bamako. She will buy fifteen pieces of wax cloth, a dozen children’s fabrics, and two dozen jewelry pieces.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 22,500FCFA. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her income for the children’s needs and other family expenses. As for the other group members, they expect a monthly profit of 18,000FCFA.

loans.use: Purchase of miscellaneous items

loans.name: Nepatao Ole

texts.en:
Nepatao Ole K., 34, is married to Koitoi K. and is a father of two school going children. Nepatao is a farmer and he does wheat farming on his own piece of land. He has been involved in farming for the last six years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he plans to spend on his twenty acres of land by preparing the land for the next planting season and buying farm inputs. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Nepatao hopes to become a large scale farmer in wheat and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to prepare his land for the next planting season and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 1994, she has been selling chickens in the local market and is able to make about US $4 profit a day; while her husband sells coconuts, typically making US $5 profit every day. She has three children living at home to support. Long S. would like to take out a loan of US $800 to purchase a sugarcane squeezer cart. This would allow her family to earn more money.

loans.use: To purchase a sugarcane squeezer cart

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en: Otgonsuren D. is 51 years old and lives with her husband in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Otgonsuren operates a meat retail business in her town. She began her business in 2005 with working capital of 150,000 MNT. After several years of hard work to build a loyal customer base, her working capital now exceeds 700,000 MNT. Otgonsuren purchases meat from herders and sells it at the local market as a retailer. Her earnings have enabled her to buy her own livestock for her family. Otgonsuren is a hardworking and honest woman. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Augusto Moises

texts.es:
Augusto Moises R. B. tiene 74 años de edad, Vive en unión Libre junto a su compañera y junto a sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Augusto Moises se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en: Augusto Moises R. B. is 74. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. He has 8 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Augusto Moises works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. He purchases his products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to improve his family's quality of life. He enjoys watching television.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His oldest daughter works for the local vocational training center as an English teacher and earns a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT, while his younger two children both attend a local secondary school. 

Lhagvasuren works for the steam heating factory as a machinist with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT, and he and his wife also operate a dairy retail business together. He and his wife started their business in 1998, selling only beverages outside the market. He quickly found success with his new business and managed to expand his business by selling a variety of dairy products and meats. He hopes to continue to grow his business so that he can have his own grocery shop. He is requesting a 650,000-MNT loan to purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and meats

loans.name: Victor Anibal

texts.es:
Víctor, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, de 14, 12 y 10 años edad, Víctor se dedica a la venta de agua, jugos, refrescos al mayoreo, este trabajo lo encontró gracias a su hermano, quien le ayudo para que comenzara en esta área, hoy día tiene 13 años de estar trabajando independiente.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería como agua en bolsa, refrescos por cajas, jugos, con esta compra espera aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y generar más ingresos que le ayude a cubrir los gastos familiares.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente y liberarse de las deudas, para tener más libre las ganancias y ahorrar para comprar un camión grande donde pueda ofrecer más producto.
texts.en:
Victor is 38 years old and he lives in San Miguel with his wife and three children, aged 14, 12, and 10 years old. Victor sells water, juices, and soft drinks in wholesale. He started this business thanks to his brother who helped him get started in the field. He has 13 years in the business and he works independently.

He requests a loan to purchase merchandise, including water in sacks, boxes of soft drinks and juices. With this purchase he will increase the volume of his sales and generate a greater income. It will help him cover the family's expenses. 

His goal is to work hard and rid himself of any debts, in order to have greater earnings and to save to purchase a large truck from where to sell more products.

loans.use: To purchase drinks (water, juices, soft drinks)

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Lucena is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling stuffed toys in the local community member. Lucena is just starting this business.

In 2008, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Atome  Nimbéla

texts.fr: Dame  Atome  a 33  ans.  Elle  est  née   à   Blitta  et   habite   à  Adewui.  Elle fait  la  coiffure  et  tresse.   Mais  elle  a associé  la vente des  mèches  et  produits de beauté.  Elle  a   un apprenti qui l’aide. Actuellement  elle n’a pas  de stoks. Elle  a commencé  son  activité  en  2005  et s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de Lomé. Elle  revend dans  son atelier  à Adewui  derrière  le  marché.  Elle   demande  un  crédit  pour  se  réapprovisionner. La dame en question est celle qui est debout  entrait de tresser.
texts.en: Atome is 33 years, was born in Blitta  but now lives in Adewui.  She is a hairdresser by profession, and sells hair weaves and beauty products, but recently ran out of stock. She entered this field in 2005 and now has one apprentice to help her. She sources her goods from the Lomé market and re-sells from her studio behind the market at Adewui.  She is seeking a loan in order to replenish her stock.  In the picture, she is the lady standing up, weaving her customer's hair.

loans.use: purchasing hair weaves and beauty products

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcial S. es de la ciudad de Carapegua – compañia Tajy Loma, tiene 32 años, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 3 hijos. Su cónyuge es tejedora de frazadas en su domicilio teniendo un ingreso de forma particular.
El Sr. Marcial se dedica al comercio ambulante (macatero) hace más de 10 años; se dedica a este trabajo desde muy joven viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y así manejarse por cuenta propia en la vida.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar y hoy día cuenta con más de 60 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías (colchas, sábanas, hamacas, ropas), para posterior venta y un mayor ingreso económico.
Desde ya agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de solicitar un crédito que lo ayude a progresar.
texts.en:
Marcial S. lives in Tajy Loma residential development, in the city of Carapegua.  He is 32 years old, owns his own home, and has 3 children.  His wife knits blankets at home, making her own income.

Marcial has been a traveling salesman for more than 10 years.  He has been in this business since he was very young as he needed to make his own income and his own way in life.

This is how he started working and today he has more than 60 active customers which makes him a considerable weekly income.

Marcial is requesting this loan to buy merchandise (bedspreads, sheets, hammocks and clothes) to sell so that he can make more income.  He is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity they have given him to request a loan that will help him to make progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bedspreads, sheets, hammocks and clothes)

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald was born in 1974, and he is married and blessed with five children. For a living, he runs a hardware shop and rents out houses to earn a living.  He also works as a mechanic. He has been running his business since 2009 and has witnessed a lot of growth in the business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his hardware shop in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy paints, nails, brushes and add more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy paints, nails, brushes and add more rental houses.

loans.name: Excel

texts.en:
Excel A. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. He is 38 years old. Excel is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Excel buys and sells prepaid cell phone credits. He also sells firewood and coconut husks for love bird nests. Excel has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Excel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Excel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Excel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cell phone credits and firewood. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Excel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone credits and firewood to resell

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Asma A., is in her late twenties and is single with a 6-month-old daughter.  She has been a food vendor for two years and works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily.  She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asma's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the food stock by buying her supplies by the sack instead of by the kilo.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to further increase the food stock. Her dream is to one day own a beauty salon.

Asma will share this loan with her loan group "Singida" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asma is in the middle at the back row wearing a black-and-white blouse.

loans.use: To increase her food stock and buy it in larger quantities.

loans.name: Patrick Murithi

texts.en: For the last two years, Patrick has made a living by selling fruit in the town of Naivasha.  He is 32 years old, married to Agnes Kwamboka and has one child. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is applying for his third loan.  He paid both of his previous loans on time and plans to use the new one to buy more fruit to sell. Patrick's goals are to grow his business and eventually buy a pickup truck to help him transport his goods.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Patricia faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and operating as a wholesale in the future. With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and tissue paper. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and tissue paper.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn is a bread seller in the marketplace in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She and her husband work in the same business but they sell in different places.

They can make an average of $6 each day from their bread selling. This couple has three children, and all of them are single and employed as garment factory workers. 

Mrs. Lorn is a meticulous woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. She wants to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle taxi with a passenger trailer or sidecar) for her husband to start a different career, but she doesn't have the cash to make this possible. Therefore, Mrs. Lorn is seeking a loan from Kiva to purchase a new tuk tuk for her husband to start a taxi service.

loans.use: to purchase a new tuk tuk (motorcycle taxi) for her husband.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been in dairy farming for five years in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is single and his milk produce is sold to the local market. He gets additional income from his employment as a teacher.

Geoffrey has requested for a loan of 20,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from the dairy farming will improve his family's living standards. He is focusing on timely repayment of the loan to be able to acquire more.

Geoffrey mentions fluctuation in produce prices as the major challenge in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and married. He has two children who go to school.  

He sells fish to earn a living. He has been operating the business for nine years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more aggressive in his business because he has to deal with the high competition in his business location. Faulu Kenya has trained him in good customer care. 

He hopes to move to a bigger business premise and employ people. He has requested 10,000 KES to buy fish and a stand for displaying fish.

loans.use: To buy fish and a stand for displaying fish.

loans.name: Gulusum

texts.en:
Gulusum is a 47-year-old woman who cultivates wheat, and she has four years of experience in this field.  She sells it to the local residents and also in her store.  She is a single woman, but her father actively helps her in cultivating cereals.  

She has applied for a loan of 1200 AZN to purchase organic fertilizers to improve quality of her crop.  This is Gulusum's second loan from AqroInvest CU.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo de 67 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Cirilo desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias con la finalidad de solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales como aves de corral y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenga pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Cirilo es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su esposa tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Cirilo, 67, lives with his wife.  The family house, in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque, has electricity and running water.  Lambayeque is a rural area and the people there work at farming, livestock-rearing and making and selling handicrafts.

Cirilo has made a living raising and selling sheep for many years.  He keeps them in a pen outside his house.  The pen is large and well-ordered.  He feeds the animals a balanced diet that includes pasture grass.  The diet is important for optimizing growth and for ensuring that he gets the best price for the sheep at local markets.  The more he earns, the easier he can pay his household expenses.

He is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new soles loan that he will use to buy more animals--poultry--and the feed that he needs to care for them.  He will use the extra income to repay the loan and improve his standard of living.  Cirilio is a hard-working and responsible man who only wants his wife to have a few nice things.

loans.use: to buy poultry and supplies to care for them.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 28 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children. 

Mary Jane has a sari-sari (general) store business and earns approximately 4000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. 

Mary Jane has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene la edad de18 de años, está soltera y vive actualmente con sus padres y sus hermanos. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar una computadora de tipo portátil para facilitar sus estudios. Ella actualmente se encuentra realizando sus estudios para fortalecer su nivel académico. Ella quiere con esta compra de esta computadora facilitar sus estudios y así poder tener un mejor rendimiento académico. Ella quiere llegar a ser una profesional y cumplir varios proyectos de vida para su futuro. Al igual piensa darles una ayuda extra a sus padres cuando se desempeñe con su profesión en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosario is 18 years old, single and currently lives with her parents and siblings.  With the loan she intends to buy a portable computer to facilitate her studies.  She is currently studying to strengthen her academic level.  With the purchase of this computer she wants to facilitate her studies and be able improve her academic performance.  She wants to become a professional and fulfill various life plans she has for her future.  She also plans to help her parents when she is employed in her future profession.  

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't had any previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with an easy payment plan and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Aybett

texts.es: Aybett tiene 36 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Su deseos de superación la animan a seguir trabajando y no dejarse abatir por la carencia económica. Es por ello que desde hace 4 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes instalada en su casa; pues las ganancias que percibe su esposo, muchas veces son insuficientes para sostener su hogar, ya que sus hijos estudian para superarse y tener un buen futuro, por tamto lo apoya a su esposo mediante los ingresos de su tienda. Espera crecer su negocio y confía en que así será porque ofrece a su clientela una atención, además los precios y la calidad de sus productos son cada detalle que cuida para asegurar las ventas. Por ahora lo que requiere es aumentar la cantidad de prodcutos que tiene en su tienda. Es la octava vez que  esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para establecer su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos tanto no pereceibles, gaseosas y productos enlatados.
texts.en:
Aybett, age 36, lives with her husband and their four children in her own house.  Her desire to succeed motivates her to keep working and to not be dismayed by the scarcity of finances.  That is why she has had her grocery store installed in her house for four years.  

Many times her husband’s earnings are not enough to support her household.  Their children go to school in order to excel and have a good future.  Therefore she supports her husband through the income from her store.  She hopes to grow her business, and she is confident it will grow because she offer her customers service.  Also, the prices and the quality of her products are each details that she takes care of in order to assure sales.

What she needs now is to increase the quantity of products that she has in her store.  This is the eighth time that she has requested a loan with MFP.  She hopes for support from each one of you in order to establish her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy non-perishable products, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable products, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David es un hombre muy trabajador y padre de familia que desea ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio. Desde ya hace 25 años comenzó a construir su vivienda en el que ahora vive el y su familia. La casa cuenta con dos recamaras, sala y comedor, en uno de los cuartos duerme el hijo mas grande que estudia y en otra su esposa, el y una hija que tiene 9 años. Con ahorros que han juntado estuvieron construyendo un cuarto mas para que la hija más pequeña tenga su propio espacio. Para David es muy importante el bienestar de la familia por ello quiere terminar de construir el cuarto para esto necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra. Para poder soportar los gasto del hogar el y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora.
texts.en:
Sr. David is a hardworking gentleman and a father who wants to provide a good inheritance for his children. When he was 25 years old, he started the construction of his house and now he and his family live there. The house has two bedrooms, a living room, and a dining room. One of the bedrooms is occupied by his oldest son who is in school. David, his wife, and their nine-year-old daughter share the other room. With the saving he accumulated, David started the construction of another room so that his daughter can have her own space.

The welfare of his family is very important to David, so he wants to finish the construction of the room. For this reason, he needs to buy cement, sand, and to pay for labor. In order to cover the household expenses, David and his wife work at a factory.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and to pay for labor in order to build a bedroom for his daughter.

loans.name: Hermenegildo German

texts.es:
Don Hermenelgildo sigue con sus ventas ambulantes de golosinas y venta de rosquillas, pues siempres ha tenido su pequeño negocio, el cual ha apoyado  a su familia.
Hoy en dia ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda,  es por tal razon, desea aumentar y compra productos variados para seguir obteniendo sus ganancias y poder seguir con la construccion.
Lo que hara con este nuevo financiamiento es la construccion de un muro en la parte de atrás del terreno, ya que el agua le ha hecho una gran sanja y tiene miedo que siga abanzando, es por tal razon reforzara con la construccion del muro.
texts.en:
Mr. Hermenelgildo continues with his mobile sales of doughnuts and other typical Nicaraguan sweets.  He has always had a small business, which has supported his family. 

Currently he has made improvements to his home. It is for this reason that he wants to grow the business and buy a variety of products to continue making money in order to proceed with the construction. 

With this new loan he will construct a wall behind the soil, since water has made a large ditch and he is fearful it will continue.  It is for this reason that he will reinforce it with the construction of the wall.

loans.use: to construct a wall.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 37 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is single and has three children between  6  and 12 years old. All of them are currently in school and live at home. For the past ten years Mama has been selling charcoal in her community. One problem she faces is goods shortage. Mama is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old and lives in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past ten years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale, and will help Samuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Samuel hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is willing to work hard every single day, to give his family a good quality of life. He devotes himself full-time to his corn farm business. He has 10 years' experience in this field. He is 49 years old, married and has four children. His wife helped him to cultivate their farmland to make sure that they would be able to receive and earn a higher income.
 
For this reason, Salvador wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides. He hopes that he can receive the amount that he has requested to further develop his farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra Elena es viuda, tiene 58 años, ella se considera una mujer muy  trabajadora y muy dedicada, tiene tres hijos, todos ellos ya profesionales gracias a su esfuerzo.
Ella es artesana hace más D. 15 años, fabrica y venD. todo tipo D. ropas artesanales en un local alquilado que queda en la ciudad D.  Coronel Oviedo. Comenta  que le encanta el trabajo que realiza porque heredo D. su mama y además  su mayor sueño es tener su propio salón D. ventas, en busca D. ese sueño es que ella diariamente lucha.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas piqué, lo cual es elemental para las artesanías que realiza, sabe que la ayuda D. Kiva y D. fundación es muy importante por lo que les agradece
texts.en:
Elena is a widow and is 58 years old. She considers herself a very hard working and dedicated woman. She has 3 children, all of them already professionals thanks to her efforts.
She has been an artisan for more than 15 years, she makes and sells all types of handmaD. clothes en a rented location that is in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She says that she loves the work that she does because she inherited it from her mother and also her biggest dream is to have her own show room. It is in search of this dream that she struggles daily.
She is requesting the loan in order to buy quilted fabric, which is fundamental for the crafts that she makes. She knows that the support from Kiva and the foundation is very important, and for that she is very thankful.

loans.use: To buy quilted fabric to make handmade clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She sells vegetables and fruits at the new market in Malindi, which she has been doing for three years. She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. 

Mary is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy stock such has bananas, mangoes, and pineapples. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. 

Mary will save the anticipated profit to help take care of her baby. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, mangoes, and pineapples.

loans.name: Alexandrine

texts.fr: Alexandrine vit en location avec son mari et à trois enfants. Elle a pour activité  principale la vente de charbons en sac et détail. Elle fait sa commande vers le Nord et est ravitaillée à Cotonou à son domicile. Soucieuse d'augmenter son stock, elle sollicite un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Elle utilisera le revenu complémentaire pour renforcer son fonds et le reste pour ses propres besoins ainsi que les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Alexandrine lives in a rental home with her ​​husband and three children. Her main activity is the retail selling of coal, in bags or retail.

She places her orders in the North and supplies are delivered at her home in Cotonou. Wanting to increase her stock, she is requesting a micro-credit loan from Finadev.

She will use the additional income to bolster her working capital, and use the rest for her own needs and those of her family.

loans.use: buy 96 bags of coal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 54 years old.  She has two children aged between 14 and 16 years and they go to school.  She has been selling clothes for 11 years.  She is willing to request this loan in order to buy more clothes.  With the profits she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Brima from Aberdeen western area in Freetown.  He is married with three children between the ages of three and ten years.  Two of his children attend school. 

Brima runs a carpentry and furniture store.  He sells wooden furniture like decorated beds, tables, chairs and dinner tables.  He has been running this business for eleven years.  He works at the business for eight hours per day and six days per week and has three employees working for him.  His other source of income comes from commercial taxis.  Brima says that the main challenge to his business is the difficulty in transporting material from the provinces to the city.

Brima has requested a loan in order to buy more timber and a plainer machine. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to export decorated beds. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more timber and a plainer machine.

loans.name: Salla's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier le 26/12/2011 du banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes habitants du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.Madame Salla  âgée de 42 ans est la responsable, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont une fille de 13 ans et un garçon de 8 ans tous les deux scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience.Elle est assise gauche de la photo. Avec son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs CFA elle va acheter 5 balles de tissus et 40 ensemble habits pour enfants qu'elle  revendre au détail au niveau du petit marché de sa localité.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created from the banc villageois's first loan cycle on 11/26/2011. The group is comprised of women living in the same village who are united by good social and professional relationships.

Madame Salla, is 42 years old and is in charge of the group. She is married and is the mother of two children, a 13-year-old girl and an 8-year-old boy. Both children go to school. 

She has been in the fabric business for a long time and has good experience in this area. She is seated at left in the photo. With her new 300,000 FCFA loan, she will buy five bales of fabric and 40 children's outfits that she will resell at retail prices in the small local market. 

The profits from her business allow her to take care of the food, schooling, and health needs of her children and family.

loans.use: buy bales of fabric to resell for retail.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a forty five years old lady, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from Enterprise development and Financial Management.
She does maize and beans farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds in order to increase her production hence more income.This will enable her pay school fees for her children and provide clothing for her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified seeds hence increased production and income that will help meet family needs.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar has been a fisherman for over 20 years. He learned the family trade from his father as his assistant since he was 10 years old. After working in a factory for a couple of years, he realized that he wanted to have his own business. He partnered up with his brother to buy a canoe and set up a stand to sell the catches from the day. He wants to buy better fishing tools (a net, fishing rod etc.) because his current tools are worn and outdated.

Cesar is married and has two children. His wife helps him in the business by selling seafood from her home. They are a very close family and they all work together to make the business successful.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He wants to buy better fishing tools (a net, fishing rod etc.)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has a small grocery shop in her home. She started her business with the help of her sister, who has a supplier in the market and helped her get started in the business. She started out selling vegetables and groceries. Now, in addition to those products, she also sells office supplies.

Sonia will use this loan to invest in wholesale merchandise, and in that way increase her income. She is confident that with those new products her business will grow.

Sonia is separated from her husband and is the mother of three children. She is 43 years old. Sonia hopes that with this loan she will improve the quality of life for her family and that it will help her continue to grow her business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Sonia tiene una tienda en su domicilio. Sonia empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana que tiene un puesto de abastos en el mercado facilitándole la mercadería para que empiece su negocio. Se inicio vendiendo legumbres y víveres. Ahora ella continúa vendiendo estos productos junto con artículos varios de oficina.

Sonia usara el préstamo para invertir en mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la confianza que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá.

Sonia es separada y madre de tres hijos, tiene 43 años. Sonia tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Sonia will use this loan to invest in wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Ramon Ernesto

texts.en:
My name is Ramón Ernesto. I mainly work in the transport of people in my town. I have worked in this business for several years now, and it generates income for my family's expenses and other obligations. At the moment, I need to change the tires of my bus and I don't have enough money for this. Therefore, I am requesting your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ramón Ernesto, mi actividad principal es el transporte de pasajero en mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos, actualmente necesito cambiar las llantas del autobus y no cuento con el capital suficiente, razon por la cual solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy tires for my bus

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru:
Munavar F. sells women’s lingerie and purses. She is married and has three grown children who are off raising families of their own. Her husband is retired.

Munavar, who has a secondary-school education, has been a client of MFI MicroInvest since 2003, when her business was worth $700. After receiving a revolving loan, she expanded her product selection by selling purses as well as lingerie. This loan helped her increase the value of her business to $1,000. Munavar would like to continue this expansion with a new loan of $350, which she will use to buy new products to sell to her customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Фаёзова Мунаввар занимается продажей женскими нижними белями и женскими сумочками. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж пенсионер, дети - каждый имеет свою отдельную семью Образование среднее. С 2003 года является клиентом «Микроинвест», тогда её активы составляли 700$, она продавала женское нижнее белье. После получения неоднократного займа она расширилась и добавила в свой ассортимент женские сумочки. Сейчас её активы возросли на 1000$. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: Increase selection of products available for sale

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Mrs. Perpetual K. is 49 years old, married with six (6) children, and lives in semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her trade in the year 1987 after undergoing training from her mother. She is soliciting a loan of US $550 for business expansion. She has been in Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) for seven years and she is proud of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & VCD plates for sales

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a blacksmith who lives in south Lebanon in the region of Nabatieh. Mohamad is 45 years old and has two children. This is the second time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs to generate enough revenue to be able to buy fuE. oil to heat his house during the winter. Mohamad does not want his family to suffer the cold winter and is determined to do the best he can to insure their well-being.

loans.use: To buy fuel oil to heat his house during the winter

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rufina lives in her own home with her husband and children in a small town of La Paz city. She makes skirts with her husband's help; this activity has supported her for more than ten years and its her only form of income. It is also the only way for them to support their family. The credit she wishes for is to purchase materials necessary to make these beautiful skirts. She will then sell them and increase her income. She's a former client of Kiva and based on her credit history she was able to get another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rufina vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle junta vecinal de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella se dedica a la confección de polleras con la ayuda de su esposo; esta actividad la mantienen por mas de diez años y es su único medio para percibir ingresos y cubrir la mantención de su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder realizar diferentes modelos de polleras (polleras son faldas – skirts in english – que usan las cholas y campesinas en Bolivia) para vender a mejor precio y aumentar sus ganancias. Es cliente antiguo y por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and materials to make local skirts

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Mrs. Endurance O. sells baby things. She is a member of LAPO.She needs the loan amount of $275 to buy more baby things for sale. She is 35 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Butimba B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane Basajabalaba. She is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Jane is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children ranging from age 5 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start constructing a house. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to increase her stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Tetu N., Hajara B. and Miramba M.. Tetu N. has a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Hajara B. is currently operating a business selling bananas and wants a loan to start a new business. Miramba M. operates a poultry business and wants to increase her business.

loans.use: To increase stock and boost fish business

loans.name: Budumuli East A C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Suzan is 24 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 1 son aged 4 who goes to school. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Suzan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to stock more clothes and the loan was paid back on time.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Agnes P., Harriet N., Hawa C., and Justine M.. Agnes P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase in bulk. Harriet N. is currently operating a business selling second hand clothes and wants a loan to stock more clothes. Hawa C. operates a business in maize produce sales and wants to purchase a lorry of produce. Justine M. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more stock and furniture.

loans.use: To boost clothing business

loans.name: Refija

texts.en:
Refija was born in 1951, and she lives in Gračanica. She is married and has 3 daughters, ages 33, 34 and 36. Her husband has a full time job at the Eurodom construction firm and his monthly salary is KM 900,00. 

Refija wants to use this loan for 1000, 00 KM to buy a calf. Her wish is to expand her business and sign a contract with a dairy.

loans.use: For buying a calf.

loans.name: Elsy Fabiola

texts.es:
Elsy is a married mother of 3 daughters ages 4, 15, and 20. She has worked in the hammock business since she was young. After much hard work and with her husband’s help, she managed to save up some money that she used in making and selling hammocks, which allows her to earn a living and help her husband with the household expenses.

She is currently requesting a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the materials needed to make hammocks. With your help, you can contribute to the development of Elsy’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsy esta casada y es madre de 3 mujeres de 4, 15 y 20 años; desde muy temprana edad se dedica al comercio, y a base de mucho esfuerzo, y con ayuda de su esposo, logro juntar un pequeño capital el cual puso a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $ 250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y elaborar mas hamacas. Con tu apoyo podrás contribuir al desarrollo del negocio de Elsy.

loans.use: Purchase hammock materials

loans.name: Estrellas Brillante (Brilliant Stars) Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the mother of three children, ages 5, 14 and 16. She has a business where she sells clothes and shoes. She wants to be able to send her children to school and proviD. them with a better life. By investing the money she will receive from the loan in her business, she hopes to grow her clothing sales and pursue her dreams for her family.

The loan will also help the other group members fund their business enterprises. The photo shows all ten women at a group meeting with their loan officer.

Note: This is a group loan. The women in the group help support and guarantee the loan for one another.

loans.use: To help grow her clothing business and support her three children.

loans.name: Tereise Punipuao

texts.en:
Tereise Punipuao M., 64, is married with 8 children. She has 10 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells fish to the village and to the general public 5 days per week. She has never had a loan through SPBD.

Tereise expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Tereise Punipuao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.
