loans.use: To purchase a fishing canoe, fishing rods, spears and fishing slippers.

loans.name: Tuk

texts.en:
Tuk Y., 58, is a widow with two children and makes around US$ 2.50 in profit from selling a variety of vegetables in the market. One of her children has a business running a motor-taxi and makes approximately $3 in profit a day.

Tuk has requested a loan from Kiva via "Credit", Kiva's local partner, to replace their old and unreliable motorbike so her son can be more effective in running his business. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas and has been fixed many times.

In the future, if she has enough money, she will build a cage and raise animal such as pigs. (Tuk is pictured with her son when she was about to bring her vegetables to sell at the market.)

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike used as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Lauristela

texts.es:
La señora Lauristela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra señora D. la paz”, vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica  con la confección D. Gigantografía, calendarios, complementa el negocio con la venta D. comida, sobre todo pensión, jugo D. frutas, llamadas celulares, desarrolla el negocio en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Ulises Reategui Nº 302,  donD. diariamente acuden los clientes, que en su mayoría son vecinos D. su barrio y particulares que requieren D. sus trabajos.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la producción D. calendarios para el 2009 D. diferentes modelos y tamaños, también en la gigantografía, que es un negocio que le está dando buenos resultados, además quiere comprar productos como arroz en saco, azúcar, aceite, menestras, fideos para la preparación D. sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes D. su pensión. 

Lauristela, es una mujer atenta, decidida y trabajadora. Gracias a este negocio aprendió a tratar con todo tipo D. personas. Cuenta con 56 años y tiene 1 hijo quien la apoya en el negocio con la mano D. obra. Desea más adelante tener un taller D. gigantografía y seguir trabajando junto a su familia para formar una microempresa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lauristela belongs to the "Nuestra señora D. la paz" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin, in the Tarapoto district. Lauristela makes blow-ups of photos and calendars, which compliments her sales business, in which she sells fruit juices, and cell phone calls. She operates her business from home, and her clients are mainly neighbors. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase materials to make calendars for 2009 of various styles and sizes. She will also purchase materials to make blow-up photos, which has been particularly successful. She also would like to purchase rice, sugar, oil, pulses (legumes) and noodles. Lauristela is a helpful, determined and hard-working woman. Thanks to this business, she has learned how to work with all types of people. She is 56 years old and has a son who helps her in the business venture. She would like to have a photography workshop and continue working with her family to form a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make calendars for 2009, and to purchase rice, sugar, oil, pulses (legumes) and noodles

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid was born in 1989. He is single. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and settled in Khirdalan town. Two years ago he started this business selling foodstuffs. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy goods and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.en: Muminjon rents a small barber shop in the center of the town. He just got married and doesn’t have any kids yet. He spends a lot of time serving his regular clients. Being very polite by nature and being professional at his job, he gathered a lot of clients. But serving many many clients has caused his equipment to wear out. So he needs to buy equipment of newer technology, like in developed countries. With the loan he plans to buy equipment for washing and drying client’s hair thus offer a better service.

loans.use: Purchasing inventory, equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 47 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con quienes vive. Es un hombre muy trabajador dedicado al cultivo de naranjales,  lo cual es una actividad que  practica por  30 años,  desde que se casó, labor que le agrada realizar por el contacto con la naturaleza, además las naranjas son frutas muy vendidas  en los mercados  e infaltables dentro de su comunidad. Lo difícil es poder  ocuparse de su  producción,  ya que durante el florecimiento tiene que  cuidar  los frutos de todo árbol y para ello necesita abonos. Lorenzo va en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y hasta hoy no ha tenido problemas en  realizar sus pagos correspondientes. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá  trampas para insectos  que  amenazan con  destruir los frutos que con tanto esfuerzo logra obtener.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 47 years old, is married and lives with his four children. He is a very hard-worker, and works cultivating an orange grove, an activity which he has practiced for 30 years ever since he married. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature, and also because oranges sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. The challenge is to manage their cultivation, as during the flowering he has to care for the fruit of all the trees and for this he needs fertilizer. Lorenzo is in his fourth loan cycle from MFP, and has not had any problems in making his repayments to date. With the loan he is seeking he will acquire traps for the insects that threaten to destroy the fruit that he has worked so hard to cultivate. These traps will cost S/. 1000.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase traps for the insects which threaten his crop

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea R., 24, is rice farmer as well as raising pigs, while her husband is lathe operator in Pursat town. She has one child who is a young teenager. Her pig raising business is going well and it is the one main source of family income. She can sell pigs for slaughter in three or four months. To increase her income, R. would like to request a loan to purchase more piglets to raise. R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Ghetivu

texts.en:
Mr. C. is a veterinary doctor. He has also been raising pigs for more than 15 years. Currently he has 20 pigs. In the near future he will increase this number to at least 50. His business is located in the village of Vadul-lui-Isac in the Cahul district, and his markets are Cahul and Vulcanesti. The price of meat in this region is quite high, so the profitability of the business is around 60%.

This loan is Mr. C.'s first with Microinvest. The purpose of the loan is to purchase fodder for the pigs. His main objective is to grow his production of meat.

loans.use: To purchase fodder

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Aniceta es casada, tiene 53 años y 7 hijos, Aniceta tiene un puesto en el mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende frutas variadas que adquiere en la costa y selva ayacuchana.
Aniceta necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano, naranja.
Aniceta sueña con comprar un terreno y construir más pisos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aniceta is a member of the Communcal Bank of Juanito. She is married, 53 years old, and has 7 children. Aniceta has a stand in the largest fruit market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells a variety of fruit from the Ayacuchan coast and jungle. She requires a loan of 2500 soles ($775) which she will invest in the purchase of bananas and oranges. Aniceta's dream is to buy a plot of land and build more floors of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de plátano, naranja.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Amina has her own small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice, oil, and other commodities for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is married, and has four children: ages 24, 15, 12 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Salama and Mwanahamis. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and other commodities for her shop

loans.name: Tawiah

texts.en:
Tawiah A. is twenty-six years old. She is a divorced mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Currently, all her three children are in school. She works very hard to cater for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Tawiah is a trader. She trades in groceries such as rice, vegetable cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, and other food items in a small kiosk in front of her house. She buys her goods from the wholesalers in the nearby cities at cost-effective prices. She says most of her customers are food vendors and her neighbors. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more varieties of goods. She hopes to save enough to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure more varieties of goods for sale

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
Khairullo M. is 40 years old. He is married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper. For more than three years, he has been running a small café in which he cooks national dishes. The business generates a stable income to support his family and improve their living conditions.

Today, Khairullo is requesting $800 for a term of twelve months. He is planning to purchase inventory like dishes, tables, and chairs in order to expand his business and improve the conditions of his small café for his clients. Khairullo would like to thank everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new dishes, chairs, and tables to expand his café.

loans.name: Adriana Berenice

texts.es:
Casada, tiene 1 hijo de 9 meses.

Tiene 4 años con su negocio, ella empezo , cuando su tia se enfermo y la dejo a cargo de el y de sacarlo adelante. 

Tiene mucha varidad de productos, como aqui le llamamos se es tienda de abarrotes.

Ella quiere comprar un refrigerador, para la verdura ya que con las altas temperaturas que se sienten por su cuidad, provoca que la verdura se eche a perder.

Todo para ofrecer un mejor servicio.

Apoyemos, sus ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Casada has a 9-month-old son. She has been in business for 4 years. She began when her aunt got sick and left her in charge of the store and its progress. She has a wide variety of products. In these parts, we call this type of store a grocery store. She wants to buy a refrigerator for the vegetables because the temperatures are very high in this city and cause the vegetables to go bad. We do all we can do to provide the best service. We support her desire to get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Aval

texts.en:
K. Aval is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. After getting married, he arduously dedicated himself to the livestock business. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Aval decided to construct a place to start an animal breeding business. He started only with one cow, but now he has two cows and three sheep.

Now, Aval wants to expand his business and to buy two cows. Trustingly, he has sought a loan from IMON, believing that his loan request will be granted, and he will be able to move forward in his work. Your support will really help to Aval and his family to get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pipes and a pump to carry water to his new farm.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis D. is 32 years old. He is married with three children. Two of the children are schooling and the last-born is still breastfeeding. Francis is a dealer in hardware like assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, painting, brushes, head pan etc. at Sefwi, a town where he lives with his family. He buys his supplies from importers in Kumasi, the regional capital of Ashanti region, at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of paints, nails, hammers, head pans, brushes etc to accelerate his business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase savings to expand his shop. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’ which literary means Except God.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two small children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two children both go to a local kindergarten. Dolgorsuren runs a small fast food store. In 2007, she bought a big train wagon and obtained permission to locate the wagon at the center of the town. She opened a small fast food store in the wagon and serves various Mongolian dishes for locals. Since the fast food wagon is located very close to the local black market, they usually have many customers during open hours. She has been in the food business for the last two years and hopes to expand her food business as she retains her profit in her business. She requests a loan to repair and fix the wagon and make it more comfortable for her customers. She believes that doing so will attract even more customers in the town.

loans.use: To repair and fix the wagon/cafe

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Miledy Cruz V. is 50 years old and is the coordinator for 'Jesus nuestra Esperanza', a micro-finance loan group of Esperanza International. She lives with her husband, four sons, and two grandchildren in Las Avispas, an impoverished but beautiful village outside of Puerta Plata. There is not nearly enough space for her whole family in her tiny home, which only has two beds.

Miledy tells me that although she is grateful for what she has, her health, a loving family, and her faith, she wishes she could help to provide a better life for her children and grandchildren. She wants to send Rican and Ronnie, who are 27 and 17 respectively, to university. She wants to expand her house so that her children don’t have to argue over who gets to sleep in the beds.

With these dreams in mind, Miledy came to Esperanza to take a micro-loan and create her business. Actually, she has started two. During the day, she sells used clothes along her street and in her neighborhood. She buys these clothes from Santiago, which is about 2-3 hours away. At night, she runs a food stand from which she sells hot-dogs and sandwiches.

Miledy has taken four loans from Esperanza since starting her business. Her first loan was for 6,000 RDP. Now her business has expanded to the point where she needs a 10,000 RDP loan to buy enough inventory for resale.

Miledy has big dreams for her clothing business. Ultimately, she hopes to purchase clothes internationally, where she could find cheaper prices than in the Dominican Republic. She then hopes to sell them in areas that are busier than her own neighborhood. Miledy’s vision for a better life and a better business is coming true, but she needs access to micro-credit to make it happen. Thanks for taking the time to read her story and for considering her for a loan.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing and ingredients for food stand

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina A. is a Tanzanian and a woman entrepreneur. She runs a food shop at Yombo Kilakala in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her business goods direct from the producers in wholesale, and some are purchased from the city food market at Kariakoo City Shopping Center.

Amina sells retail to her customers. Her business income is used to meet her daily family needs and to pay her children’s school fees. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to capitalize her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is 29 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He works as a home painter and is successful in his work because he does a nice, clean job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others, and he also works on projects with interior designers. When BilA. first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He set up the business because he learned it when he was young and he wanted to work as an interior designer.

BilA. has requested a loan of $2,000 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase a second-hand car for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, BilA. plans on expanding his business by making himself know in other regions.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand car for his work

loans.name: Eliecer Antonio

texts.es:
Eliecer Antonio O. S. es un señor de 39 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una  comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Desde hace cuatro años que Don Eliécer se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, el vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. El dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

 Actualmente don Eliecer está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢680.000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto el espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

Don Eliecer es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Eliecer Antonio O. S. is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the community of Canalete, which is located in Upala in the province of Alajuela. This region is a semi-mountainous area known for being a center of agriculture and livestock farming. It is a community that has great potential for development and establishment of microenterprises, in both agribusiness and trade.

For four years, Don Eliecer has been raising chickens for fattening, as well as hens, for producing meat and eggs. He sells his products to the residents of the community who are very satisfied. He says having the support and help of his wife makes him continue with this endeavor. Don Eliecer also says that his work is very interesting because he has seen his business grow slowly and demand getting stronger.

At the moment, Don Eliecer is requesting a microloan of 680,000 colones to buy more chickens and hens, concentrated feed, and medicines to help combat disease. He also would like to enlarge and reinforce the structures that house his animals. With these changes, he hopes to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Although the business is doing well, the lack of capital has prevented any plans for expansion. With the loan he requested, Don Eliecer expects to increase his sales and improve the financial condition of his family.

Don Eliecer is a member of the Canalete Community Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and economically. He is an active participant in his community’s credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens for fattening, egg-laying hens, and supplies for their upkeep

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Houn Hok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group that consists of 11 people is located in Angk village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sok Houn H. is the village bank president wH. has been selected by the members. She owns a two-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. On the plantation, she has a problem because her field has infertile soil so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nguon Sbai, is a farmer. Mrs. Sok Houn H. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one just four years old. 

One member in this village bank loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena S. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Nena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector "kamoting kahoy," or raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes  from planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and meet their daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. Rania has owned a grocery store since 2001. She has been selling candies, canned food, home cleaning products and lots more. Rania is special in her work because she has a big variety of merchandise. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Rania decided on doing her business because she wanted to have independent work and she also wanted to supplement her husband's income. In the future, she plans on expanding the store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Snooky

texts.en:
Maria Snooky S. believes that poverty is not the hindrance to fulfilling one’s dreams if you have the courage to pursue those hopes and dreams. Dreams in life give you the right direction to slowly changing your standard of living. Every step she made she planned with awareness, not blaming herself for the consequence of it. That’s what Maria Snooky S. values in life. 

Maria Snooky is married to Guillardo S., 35 years old and a fisherman. Five children are the fruits of their love. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest is ten months old. Three of their children are in school.

In 2005, Maria Snooky motivated herself and her husband to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a Kiva field partner. She carefully utilized her loans from ASHI for the growth of her business. Now, she is proposing Php 15,000 to pay for two sewing machines.

Maria Snooky is also engaged in a small business retailing different goods. She hopes to see her business in demand in their town. She dreams of having her own tailoring shop or being a sub-contractor with a lot of sewing machines someday and to extend to orders in bulk. She also has a desire to renovate their house and enable all her children to finish studies through college.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.es:
La señora Adolfina P. Rojas Tiene 44 años de edad es viuda tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en su casa propia.

Doña Adolfina es dueña de un pequeño negocio de ventas de bebidas que formo después de quedarse viuda, desde entonces su negocio es el sostén de la familia, es una persona muy sacrificada por que ella misma va en busca de sus mercaderías las que las compra del mercado de abasto, también es levantadora de quinielas, cuando ella no esta en su casa el negocio es atendido por sus hijos quienes le ayuda.

Desde el año 2006 la Sra Adolfina esta trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y comenta ella que gracias a los créditos recibidos pudo construir su salón de ventas para mejor atención a sus clientes.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra de mas cervezas, gaseosas, cañas, vinos y cigarrillos ya que se están  aproximando las fiestas de fin de año.

Su mayor sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y asi tener mas clientelas.
texts.en:
Adolfina P. Rojas is 44 years old. She's a widow and has three children who live with her in the house that she owns. Adolfina owns a small shop where she sells drinks, that she opened after her husband passed away. Since then, the business has been the only income of her family. She is a hard worker. She has to purchase all her items at the wholesale food market without any help. She is also a quiniela bookie. When she's not at home, her children are in charge of her business. Since 2006, Adolfina has been working with Fundación Paraguaya and she tells us that thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to build her sales shop and provide a better service for her customers. The loan she’s requesting now will be used to purchase beer, soft drinks, wine, spirits and cigarettes to take advantage of the holiday season. Her greastest dream is to expand her business and attrack more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks, wine, spirits and cigarettes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell construction supplies

loans.name: Cherry's Group

texts.en:
Cherry A. is from the village of Brgy. Pieza, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is thirty-three years old. Cherry is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cherry is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising and fattening pigs for sale. Cherry has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for this work.

In 2009, Cherry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to make her more capable of engaging in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise for future sale. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be her second loan from ASKI; she will use this loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas of the Philippines. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Olga Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega especialmente en el mercado el Bisne, la señora Olga U. se desempeña arduamente laborando con el fin de obtener sus ingresos para el sustento de su hogar ya que es madre soltera y con cuatro hijos. Ella siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar y mantenimiento de su vivienda porque es una persona muy responsable. 
El crédito lo está solicitando para suplir las necesidades básicas de su hogar ya que siempre se requiere la compra de los productos de uso domestico y pago de ciertas obligaciones de servicios básicos. Por este motivo ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así  dar lugar al apoyo para su familia que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
In the "departamento" of Chinandega, specifically in the Bisne market there, Sra. Olga U. works hard every day to pull together enough money to support her family, an especially difficult task because she is a single mother with four children. She has always worried about the well-being and needs of her family because she is a very responsible person. She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy basic necessities for the household. There is always something that they have to buy or some basic service that they have to pay for, so Sra. Olga hopes that she can get the loan and provide her family with what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic household necessities.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred K. owns a small store at the central market in Bo where he sells used clothing. He is married and his wife is also engaged in business. He has been in the clothing business for the past ten years.

He has five dependents, two of whom are his kids. He has spent most of his time in this business since he dropped out of school.

By way of expansion Alfred wants to buy more stock that will increase his profit margin and which will enable him to start his building project on a piece of land he recently bought.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Luis (44), y de sus dos hijas menores de edad.

Hace dos años compró una pequeña “combi” (camioneta para 12 personas) para que su esposo pudiera trabajar haciendo transporte local de pasajeros. Mientras ella administra los gastos de reparaciones, él trabaja en horas puntas, es decir donde hay mayor demanda. Le gusta el negocio porque obtiene buenas ganancias económicas y su esposo puede trabajar con tranquilidad, además ya han comprado la segunda camioneta y la han brindado en alquiler, de esta manera están saliendo adelante a base de trabajo y mucho esfuerzo. 
Para más adelante tiene planeado comprar una tercera combi para seguir trabajando e instalar una pequeña flota de transporte.

Este es el 14avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Tania tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el mantenimiento de sus dos camionetas, ya que necesitan algunas reparaciones para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Tania is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Luis (age 44) and their two dependent children.

Two years ago, she bought a small “combi” (a van that holds 12 people) for her husband so that he could have work providing local transportation to passengers. While Tania manages the repair expenses, her husband works during peak hours when demand is at its highest. She likes this business because it generates good revenues and her husband is able to work in peace. They have already secured a second van that they will rent out in order to move forward in their work and help them increase their efforts. Later on, they hope to purchase a third van so that they can continue working and build up a small fleet of transport vehicles.

This is her fourteenth loan with MFP. Tania is extremely grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan so that she could continue working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the maintenance of her two vans. These repairs are needed so that she can offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her two vans

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of So. Macapso, Vallehermoso, Neg. Oriental. She is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has just started operating this business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1998, Marilyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from NWTF. Marilyn is now requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 17th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF. Marilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the call of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy additional working capital.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 45 years old. He is married with two children. Vasil sells women's clothing and tights. He has been in this business for seven years. Vasil used to work as an accountant, until he saw this business opportunity and decided to try. Today Vasil attracts his customers with good client service and affordable prices. He's got many repeat clients who buy from him.

Vasil would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase his assortment. His business goal is to start a second location to make more money for his family. This business is his only source of income.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Vicente Raul

texts.es: Don Vicente Velásquez el labora para una Radio Nacional como locutor lleva 11 años de de realizar dicha función en la cual nos solicita su préstamo para pagos de Colegiatura y darles mejor educación  a su Hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente Velásquez has worked as a broadcaster for national radio station for 11 years. He is asking for a loan to pay school fees for his children in order to give them a better education and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 29 years now.
In 2008, Josephine joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Daniel Rodrigo

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel Q. tiene 27 años, es soltero y vive solo. Se encuentra trabajando como empleado en una empresa de seguros durante dos años. Es de profesion Ingeniero Comercial.

Esta empezando un Diplomado por lo que requiere el prestamo para comprar una computadora para poder estudiar y realizar sus trabajos.

Es segundo credito que solicita a nuestra institucion, cancelo sin retrasos. Es un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Q. is 27 years old, single and lives alone. He has been working as an employee in an insurance company for two years. He is a commercial engineer. He is starting a certification for which he needs the loan, to buy a computer to be able to study and perform his work. This is the second credit that he has requested and is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Saleem's Group

texts.en:
Saleem lives in a historic city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Multan. Her husband works in a gas station and she helps him financially by selling bangles. She sells a variety of bangles, such as beaded bangles, steel bangles, glass bangles, etc. She has been doing this work for the last five years.  She makes a good income, particularly on EID (a Muslim occasion that comes after Ramadan). 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute and Kiva partner in Pakistan) to purchase bangles for her bangles-selling business. She is hopeful that her income can be increased by offering variety to her clients.

loans.use: Purchase bangles for reselling

loans.name: Lira

texts.es: Lira tiene 40 años, vive con  su hijo en casa de su madre. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica en la venta de  insumos e ingredientes para la industria panadera, de esa manera ha constituido una distribuidora autorizada de una marca prestigiosa, para repartir sus productos a los diferentes puntos panaderos de su localidad. Cada 15 días procura abastecerse de mercadería, es por ello que viaja a la ciudad de Lima, a conseguir estos productos. La buena atención ha hecho que gane muchos clientes, puesto que han visto la calidad y rendimiento de sus productos. Es por eso que Lira desea mejorar sus ventas vendiendo sus productos en otras ciudades. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta muy contenta de ser integrante de su grupo comunal que le ha traído beneficios para su negocio, será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería en insumos como levadura, polvo de hornear y otros insumos mas que permitirán tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Lira is 40 years old. She lives with her child in her mother’s house. For over two years she has been selling supplies and ingredients for the baking industry. She has become an authorized distributor for a prestigious brand. She delivers the products to the different baking spots in her area. She stocks up on merchandise every 15 days. She travels to the city of Lima to get these products. Her good service has won her many customers. They have seen the quality and performance of her products. That is why Lira wishes to improve her sales by selling her products in other cities. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very pleased to be a member of her communal bank; it has brought many benefits to her business. She will be very responsible with her payments, and she is grateful to the lenders. She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise and supplies like yeast, baking powder, and other supplies that will allow her to have more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yeast, baking powder, and other supplies to sell to bakeries

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 57 años vive con su esposo en su casa propia casa. Tiene 40 años D. experiencia vendiendo, ya que en un inicio empezó desD. que se casó, en su misma casa acondiciono una apequeña tienda, para vender algunos productos D. primera necesidad, mientras que su esposo se dedicaba a la agricultura y afirma con orgullo que esta tienda que hoy sigue manteniéndose ha logrado mantener a sus 6 hijos. Actualmente sus hijos son personas adultas e independientes y solo ella en compañía D. su esposo se encargan D. la tienda, ya que les permite el sustento diario, por tanto procuran abastecerla D. varios productos. Su deseo es continuar dedicándose en la atención D. su negocio. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mercadería en gaseosas y productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She started selling products 40 years ago after she got married. Margarita established a small store in her house where she sells basic necessities while her husband works as a farmer. She says she is proud that she has been able to maintain her store to this very day and support her six children. Her children are now independent adults, so she lives alone with her husband and continues to manage her store in order to pay for their daily expenses. For this reason, she wants to acquire different products to restock her business and keep it in operation.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Margarita is happy to know that she has financial support, so she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive of one another. She expresses her appreciation to those individuals in charge of approving her loan request, which will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as sodas and basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jaime Raul

texts.es:
Jaime Raul B. V. tiene 39 anos. Vive en union libre con su esposa y su hija en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Su hija tiene cuatro anos. 

Jaime es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Jaime es comerciante. Realiza sus compras y ventas en el canton de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar madera, que con el apoyo del crédito seguirá adelante con su familia y su trabajo. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deportes de indor futbol y boli.
texts.en:
Jaime Raul B. V. is thirty-nine years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. His daughter is four years old. Jaime is a member of the rural bank "Lucha Para Triunfar." There is a total of thirteen members, most of whom work in farming. Jaime is a merchant. He does his purchasing and selling in the canton of Ventanas. He is taking out a loan to buy wood. He will be able to get his family and his business ahead with the support from this loan. He likes to play in-door sports like soccer and volleyball in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for his business.

loans.name: Fernalin

texts.en:
Fernalin M. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Fernalin is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Fernalin owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services, "motor repair," to local community members. Fernalin has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fernalin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernalin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Fernalin is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Fernalin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: El señor Raúl vive en alquiler en la zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz, actualmente esta separado de su esposa y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. La actividad que realiza es la venta de películas, música, etc., en  CDs., con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia y es su única fuente de ingresos. Es cliente de Impro y es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito, el esta satisfecho con la tasa de interés, y es la primera vez que forma parte de kiva
texts.en:
Raúl rents in downtown La Paz. He is currently separated from his wife and he has two school age children. He sells movies and music, etc., on CDs. This is how he supports his family and it’s his only source of income. He is an Impro client and this is his fourth loan request. He is satisfied with the interest rate and it’s the first time he’s been art of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su primer ciclo se han iniciado como comité hace muy poco tiempo y luego de las sucesivas reuniones decidieron concretar el grupo y recibir los créditos y capacitaciones de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Se puede decir que el grupo es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades todas están muy deseosas de recibir los crédito y poder invertir en la mejoras sus actividades. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana A. se dedica a la venta de ropas y también elabora productos de limpieza que le da a sus hijos mayores a vender. 
Con estas actividades ella está muy satisfecha y espera mejorar ya que le vendrá muy bien si consigue aumentar las ventas de su negocio. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas para la temporada que entra en el país y así ofrecerle mercaderías novedosas a sus clientes como remeras, blusas, vestidos, zapatillas y otros.
texts.en:
The current committee is in its first loan cycle. It began only a short time ago and after consecutive meetings they decided to solidify the group and receive loans and training from Fundación Paraguaya. The group is very responsible. All of the members have jobs and they all really want to receive loans and to be able to invest in the improvement of their businesses. One of the members is Liliana A.. She sells clothing and also makes cleaning products which she gives to her older children to sell. She is very satisfied with these activities and she hopes to improve, since it would be very useful to continue increasing her business' sales. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing for the season that the country is entering, and to offer innovative clothing to her customers such as t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shoes and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly M. is a hard-working married woman who operates a tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) business and a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. Her supportive husband, Vilmado, is a farmer and manages their transport business. Nelly and Vilmado offer a good transport service for people in their village. Nelly belongs to a group of entrepreneurs where she saves her money and has secured access to capital from ASHI. She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her businesses and therefore her quality of living.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for maintenance of their tricycle with some of the loan funds to be used to purchase necessary supplies for her store. She hopes to buy more tricycles in future for better output and so that her children can make their own living. She sees herself venturing into “Talyer” which means auto repair and a vulcanizing shop business in the next five years. Nelly is hoping that her envisioned businesses will help her to support the financial needs of her family so that they can move away from the nightmares of poverty. By then, Nelly thinks positively that their lives would be changed and she will have achieved her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of their tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) and to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while the other is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent. 

She has operated her business of selling sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and clothes from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Rose faces the major challenge of competition in her business as many people sell similar products. She hopes to purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) for transport in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. Rose decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Arlene is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods & canned goods in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun P. is 48 years old and lives in the city of Vanadzor. He is married with three children — two daughters and a son. One of his daughters is already married and lives separately; the second daughter is a student studying in Yerevan. His son is in school and recently became the Armenian champion of freestyle wrestling. Harutyun is very proud of his son's achievements. 

For about 15 years Harutyun has been engaged in trading men and women clothing and sleepwear at the Vanadzor clothes fair. His wife stays at home and keeps the house.
 
Harutyun needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy men's jackets for his business.  This is Harutyun’s second loan from Kiva and 14th loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy jackets for resale

loans.name: Bundhorol

texts.en: Bundhorol S. is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in their own house and fence. Since 2004, Bundhorol and her husband have been operating a small cafe located 11 km from the province. After six years of operating this business, they not only have built a stable operation but also have gained a lot of experience. She hopes to expand her business and build a hotel next to her cafe. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase food supplies such as a variety of vegetables and meats for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as vegetables and meats for her cafe

loans.name: Leverma

texts.en:
Leverma S. is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leverma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and other foods in the local community. Leverma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leverma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leverma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which  was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Leverma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Leverma's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Milagros tiene 40 años de edad, es secretaria de la Alcancía Comunal “Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta,” tiene 5 hijos  dos de los cuales son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos de su hogar, como también con los estudios de sus hermanos menores.  Ella lleva trabajando 8 meses con EDAPROSPO es personal de limpieza de una institución educativa particular,  pero como  empezaron la época de vacaciones Milagros se dedica a realizar trabajos como: venta de quesos, carne y tejidos para pedidos, también los ofrece (chompas, gorros, chalinas, tapetes), ya que con los ingresos de todas estas actividades ayuda a cubrir los gatos de su hogar a sus hijos mayores. Ella solicito el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar carne, lechones y venderlos aprovechando las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.
texts.en:
Milagros is 40 years old.  She is the secretary of the "Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta" (Entrepreneurs of Casa Huerta) community bank.  She has five children.  Two of her children are grown up and help her with the household expenses as well as with their younger siblings' studies.

Milagros has been working with EDAPROSPO for 8 months.  She works as a cleaner in a private school but since the holiday season began, Milagros has been carrying out other activities such as: selling cheese, meat and knitted items to order.  She also sells these items (sweaters, caps, scarves and tablecloths).  The profits she makes from all these activities helps her to cover the household expenses with her older children.  

Milagros is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to buy meat and suckling pigs to sell, taking advantage of the Christmas and New Year holidays.

loans.use: To buy meat and suckling pig

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem N. is 33 and married with two children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Hem weaves Cambodian traditional silk and earns a daily income of 3 USD. Her husband is a construction worker and earns 2 USD a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 53 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Hem is requesting a loan of 900 USD to purchase raw silk to produce woven silk products. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. In the future, Hem would like to use aN. additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy raw silk

loans.name: Marlene Del Transito

texts.es:
Marlene, tiene 33 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, tiene un chalet, vive en casa propia con su hija de 6 años de edad, él chalet está ubicado al interior del centro escolar, lo inicio por sus propios medios, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 6:00 am a 5:00pm, de este negocio ella recibe los ingreso diarios para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra embutidos, gaseosas, jugos, agua, pan, galletas, dulces entre otros que son necesarios para ofrecer a los estudiantes.
Este préstamo le ayudara ya que no dispone de ahorros para realizar la inversión e iniciar con el negocio en este año escolar que va a iniciar. Su propósito es velar por que el negocio este en las mejores condiciones para no perder a la clientela que son los jóvenes estudiantes y los profesores, también su deseo de superar con su familia es lo que cada día tiene presente.
texts.en:
Marlene is 33 years old and lives in her own home in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her 6 year-old daughter.  Marlene has a snack bar which is located inside a school.  She started the business with her own money.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 6.00am to 5.00pm and through her business she makes the daily income she needs to cover the needs of her household.

Marlene is currently requesting a loan to buy sausages, soda, juice, water, bread, cookies, candy and other products that she needs to be able to offer the students.

This loan will help Marlene since she doesn't have the necessary savings to make this investment and therefore would not be able to re-start her business during the coming school year.  Her goal is to make sure that her business is in the best condition possible so that she doesn't lose customers.  Her customers are the young students and the school teachers.  She also wishes, every day, to get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy a range of products such as soda, juice, water, bread, cookies and candy

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Myrna is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling souvenirs and necklaces, anklets, belts & ready-to-wear printed shirts in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as T-shirts & souvenirs. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as T-shirts & souvenirs

loans.name: Gonzalo Jacobo

texts.es:
GONZALO JACOBO S., ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO HIGIENISTA EN EL MERCADO DE MANAGUA, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS, Y SOLO UNO ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON GONZALO ACUDE NUEVAMENTE  A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA, PIEDRIN Y HIERRO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN PORCHE EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
GONZALO DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Jacobo S. is from the city of Managua. He works every day as a dental hygienist in the Managua market. He is a father to three children, one of whom is school-aged and depends on him financially. 

Gonzalo retuned to the Ceprodel office to request a new loan, this time to improve his home by purchasing building materials including sand, cement, stone, gravel and iron to add a porch to his house. 

Gonzalo would like to say thank you to all the lenders with Ceprodel who have contributed to his home improvements.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Hammer

texts.es: Hammer, de 18 años es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Ninfa, su padre Roly y su hermano menor Renzo, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Las aspiraciones de este ambicioso hombre son grandes, su seriedad y coraje le ayudan a trabajar 3 veces a la semana en sus terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra toda variedad de papa. Asimismo su proyecto es prepararse para postular a una universidad del estado peruano, con lo que podrá brindar a sus cultivos el nivel de calidad que se propone. Ya tiene 2 años de experiencia sembrando en un terreno pequeño que heredó en “Hatunago”; donde le proporciona 20 sacos de papa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es limpiar la maleza que crece entre sus plantaciones. La principal dificultad de Hammer, son los gastos que requiere apoyar a su familia y hermano menor. Pero confía que con la ayuda de sus padres y su trabajo duro podrá obtener muchos logros. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre juntos”, y este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le ofrecen. Hammer, cosechará dentro de un mes papa de la variedad “única”, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Hammer, aged 18, is a hard-working single man.  He lives with his mother Ninfa, his father Roly, and his minor brother Renzo, in his own house, located in the settlement of Cayan.

Hammer's aspirations are great.  His seriousness and courage motivate him to work 3 times a week in his agricultural terrain, where he sows all varieties of potatoes.  In addition, one of his projects is to prepare himself to apply for entry into a Peruvian state university, which could help him to give his crops the level of quality that he intends.  Hammer has 2 years experience sowing the small plot he inherited in Hatunago that produces 20 sacks of potatoes.  

What he likes most about his work is to clear the weeds that grow among his plantings.  Hammer's principle difficulty is the costs required to help his family and minor brother.  But he is confident that with his parent's help, and his hard work. he will achieve much.

Hammer belongs to the “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together) Communal Bank, and this is his first loan with MFP, where he appreciates the opportunity for progress they offer.  Within a month, Hammer will harvest potatoes of the “unique” variety.  For this, he intends to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: TO BUY SACKS OF ORGANIC FERTILIZER

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carrots and black pepper.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza S. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Esperanza is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages & detergents. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages & canned goods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en: Livingstone, a retail shop owner, is a Ugandan male aged 27 who comes from Kyenjojo District. He is married to a housewife and they have three children. He wants his business to grow to the level of a wholesale shop to enable him to realise his dreams of educating his children. Livingstone wants a loan to buy flour, sugar, salt and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, salt and other general merchandise.

loans.name: Bwashwa Tukore Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Eldah is the leader of the Bwashwa Tukore group B in Kihihi. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She has operated a retail shop in Bwashwa selling posho (a dish made from cornmeal), beans, sodas, soap, jelly, water, salt and many other items for 5 years. Her major customers are her neighbors and community members. She is able to generate 200,000 UGX monthly.

T. Eldah is also involved in the sale of tea leaves since she has a tea plantation. This contributes to her income and was the source of capital to start her retail shop. She is very hardworking and her dream is to have a wholesale shop and education for her children. The loans have over the years helped her to increase her sales, since she was able to stock more items. T. Eldah needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more goods.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).  

Madina has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days out of every week. Madina sells her products by means of retail.    

Madina has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow bigger, to own her own delivery van, and to start selling wholesale only.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents.  She does not have access to electricity nor to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: buy more soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran, 51 years old, is a rice seller. She is a single mother with four children. Three of her children are studying and one is a motor taxi driver. 

Ran has sold rice since 1999. Her career has been able to support all her children's studies, but now that they are moving to the higher levels, she needs more income to support them. 

Before, she was the only one earning money to support the family, but now her first son is helping. Every day she can get $7 in income and her son can get $3. Each month she has to spend $45 on food, $13 on electricity, $15 on rent, $150 on school fees and $5 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a stock of rice to sell. With that loan, she hopes to get enough profit to have her own shop and support the rest of her children as they finish their studying and get good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 48 years old and is a married man with 5 children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 13. 

Noel is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.  He has been growing rice for 16 years. Noel earns about 13,000 PHP per month doing this farming. He works hard to support his family and send his children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  In the future, Noel hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is 47 years old and married with 1 adult-aged child. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products that she can offer in the community. She has had this business for 6 years and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP (~$100) monthly.

Ana May is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional groceries and soft drinks to sell. She really wants to increase her income but she has insufficient capital. That's why she is asking for financial assistance from the Kiva lenders, and she is hoping that her request will be granted. 

In the future, she hopes that her business will expand so she can save some funds for future use and to raise their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
En un barrio de la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reúne un grupo de mujeres con el fin de interiorizarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, de esta forma se dieron cuenta de la excelente oportunidad que les proporcionaría ser parte de la misma, es así que deciden realizar la reunión para la conformación del comité, el cual lleva el nombre de Virgen del Carmen, todas ellas asumen la gran responsabilidad de permanecerse unidas y en constante comunicación ya que es la clave para mantener la unidad de las integrantes, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente, actualmente está conformada por 18 mujeres.
La Sra. Dominga es peluquera, por medio de este trabajo ella logra mantenerse y mantener su negocio. Ella se considera una mujer luchadora, que le gusta lo que hace. Está muy orgullosa de su trabajo, ya que por medio de este puede tener la esperanza de un futuro mejor por medio de los ingresos que este le genera.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, juegos de tijeras, spray y demás, lo cual le servirá para el ejercicio de su profesión.
texts.en:
In a neighborhood in the city of Paraguarí, a group of women came together with the aim of finding out about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya.  They came to realize what an excellent opportunity they would be receiving if they joined the program.  They decided to have a meeting and form a committee called 'Virgen del Carmen'.  All of the women accept the great responsibility of remaining united and in constant communication as this is the key to maintaining the unity of the committee's members.  They are currently on their fourth loan cycle with an excellent rating.  The group currently has 18 members.

Dominga is a hair dresser.  Through her work she manages to support herself and keep her business going.  She considers herself to be a tenacious woman who enjoys what she does.  She is very proud of her work since it enables her to have hope for a better future through the income that she makes from her business.

Dominga is requesting a loan to buy dyes, sets of scissors, sprays and other items which will help her to carry out her profession.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, sprays and other utensils

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 42 años convive desde hace 16 años con Eusebio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que quieren y cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Hace 2 años que su economía mejoró notablemente.
