Todo esto gracias a los ingresos económicos de casa; según cuenta mientras que su esposo trabaja como obrero en la construcción de una hidroeléctrica; ella se dedica a la agricultura. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y maíz; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde viaja después de cada cosecha. Gracias a la agricultura pudo obtener los 5 terrenos cultivables que ahora posee, como también 2 toros de buena raza, con los cuales ara la tierra. “Nunca dejaré de sembrar, siempre mantendré la costumbre familiar”, comenta muy orgullosa Celia. Pues para el futuro desea mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de prometer ser puntual con sus cuotas.  Celia de recibir su apoyo; invertirán el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Celia, 42, has lived with her husband, Eusebio, for 16 years.  They have three children, who they love very much, and all live together in their own house in the Cumutay rural community.  Two years ago her economy improved considerably, all thanks to earned household income.  According to her husband, who works as a bricklayer, Celia is involved in agriculture.  She has been a crop farmer for 20 years, mainly of peas, potatoes and corn.  She sells her produce for a good price at the wholesale market in the city where she travels after each harvest.  

Through her farm activity she was able to acquire five patches of cropland and two good oxen for ploughing the fields.  "I will never stop growing crops.  I'll always maintain the family tradition.", says Celia proudly.  In the future she would like to improve the quality of her produce.  She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this is her ninth loan through MFP, where she hopes all of you will collaborate so she can continue meeting her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She plans to use the loan to buy two bags of pea seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizer to make the next planting season successful.

loans.use: To buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and married, with 11 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

Leonila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Leonila has been farming rice for 38 years and also earns additional income from a fish pond business.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Liliana Gricelda

texts.es:
Liliana de 26 años en enero del 2011 se quedó sin trabajo,  se cansó de buscar empleo y no conseguía, hasta que decidió poner un pequeño negocio con su liquidación y unos pocos ahorros que había logrado reunir. En su tienda ella vende víveres como arroz, azúcar, enlatados, dulces, etc.
Debido a que el negocio recién empieza ella quiere un préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lápices y tener otra variedad que ofrecer a los clientes. No está casada y no tiene hijos pero cuenta que tiene que ayudar a sus padres en sus necesidades.
Su sueño es construir su casa, incrementar su negocio y ser feliz cuando se case.
texts.en:
Liliana is 26 years old. She lost her job in January 2011. Liliana grew tired of looking unsuccessfully for work, so she decided to start a small business with her severance pay and a little bit of savings that she had accumulated. She now has a store where she sells food products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, sweets, and other items.

Since her business is just beginning, Liliana needs a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, and a variety of other products to offer to her customers. She is not married and has no children, but she has the help of her parents with covering necessities. Her dreams include building a house, increasing her business, and being happy when she gets married.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, salt, sugar, rice, legumes, and canned goods.

loans.name: Mercedes Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a Mercedes, tiene años 34 de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, tiene dos sobrinos de 15 y 11 años que son  como sus hijos ya que sus padres fallecieron y desde esa fecha están a su cargo, ellos estudian en colegio y escuela. 

Nuestra amiga para poder sobrellevar los gastos que conlleva sacar adelante a sus sobrinos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior tanto de hombres como de mujeres, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas  ya que a estas horas es mucho más fresco el día y puede hacer sus ventas más cómodamente, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y empezó su negocio con su primer crédito.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más ropa interior para hombres, mujeres y niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son ver que sus sobrinos terminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio communal bank meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. The place is known as a commercial area and also for its traditional celebrations in honor of San Pedro and San Pablo as well as for the happiness of its people.

We meet Mercedes here, a single woman who is 34 years old and lives with her parents. She has two nephews, 15 and 11, who are just like sons to her because their parents died and since that time, she has raised them. They attend high school and primary school. 

Our friend is able to meet the expenses involved in helping her nephews to get ahead through selling underwear for men as well as women. She sells door to door and also from her home. She works four days a week, mainly in the mornings for at these hours the day is much cooler and she can make sales more comfortably. She provides goods on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been doing this work for 8 years and began her business with her first loan.

She will use this loan to buy more underwear for men, women and children. She has been a member of the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it because of the help one gets to succeed. 

Her dreams are to see her nephews finish their studies and that they become good persons.

loans.use: to buy underwear for men, women and children.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is married with 4 children. He is 52 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Ricardo is enjoying his banana farm. This is the primary source of income for his family. His wife sells snacks as an additional source of revenue. Every cropping he sells bananas to his contract buyer. He has been in this business for 3 years. Ricardo earns net PHP 4000 doing this kind of work. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 7000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer for banana production. Ricardo has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. He wants to purchase land to produce more bananas.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Тохиржон женат имеет на воспитании двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Чтобы содержать семью он предоставляет услуги такси. Недавно купил новую машину. ГСМ в стране подорожало и такси не выгодно. Для этого он хочет получить займ и установить газовое оборудование. Доходы полученные от услуг идут на содержание семьи. Он надеется получить кредит и заранее благодарить вас за ваше понимание.
texts.en: Tohirjon is married and has two children to raise. His wife is a homemaker. He provides taxi services to support his family. He recently bought a new car. POL prices went up in the country and taxi is not profitable anymore. This is why he wants to get a loan to install gas equipment. The profit from the business will go towards supporting his family. He hopes to get the loan and is thanking everyone in advance for your understanding.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle and install gas equipment for the heating system.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 39 year old, married man, from Gaza.  He would like to have his own store which rents chairs and tents for special occasions.  He has experience is this field and believes that it is needed in his area, so he will do well with the business.   He hopes to start his business and the loan will help him buy the chairs and tents.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tents to rent for special occasions.

loans.name: Zosa

texts.en: Zosa is 34 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married with 3 children. Zosa has a transportation business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase parts for motorcycle repair and the renewal of her motorcycle  registration. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase parts for motorcycle repair and for renewal of her motorcycle registration.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. animales como pollos,la socia tambien venD. artesania y lo envia a lugares como Brasil,la socia los animales lo venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito D. Anta,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. animales y negocio D. artesania.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesania como chompas,polos,camisas y pantalones y tambien para comprar animales como gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues working at her business selling animals, such as chickens.  She also sells crafts and sends them to places like Brazil.  She sells the animals in various markets in the Anta district.  With this business she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand and improve her animal and crafts businesses.

Margarita is requesting the loan to buy crafts such as sweaters, polos, shirts, and pants, and also to buy animals like chickens.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts (sweaters, polos, shirts, and pants) and animals (chickens).

loans.name: Patricia's Group

texts.en:
Patricia's group is comprised of two hard working women. Patricia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero Region of Uganda. For the past year, Patricia has worked hard to manage her small market where she sells food. 

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for resale and will help Patricia to generate greater profits.  She will use the profits to pay for her own school fees.  Patricia hopes to become a teacher in the future. 

Patricia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum on life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Patricia's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food for resale at a small market

loans.name: Alam

texts.en:
Alam is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Alam is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Florence Nyachama

texts.en: Florence, 46, is married to a businessman and has four children, ranging from 14 to 30 years. Previously, she was employed at a wholesale shop. For the last 7 years, Florence has been running a retail shop. She is facing a challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy flour, bread, sugar, etc.. Florence hopes and dreams to diversify her business within the next 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase flour, bread, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 34-year-old shoemaker in Kilifi. He has been in this business for the last six years. His business is doing great. 

He is married and has one child. 

Jackson was introduced to KADET and this marks his third loan, with which he plans to purchase more shoe soles and shoe leather for his business. 

With the proceeds from the loan, he will gradually expand his business by renting a bigger shoe shop. 

He hopes to have a successful business and family.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles and shoe leather.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras”  es de la ciudad de Asunción,  se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 16 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y mutuo respeto. Su deseo es poder salir adelante, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias.
Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo de marcas que trae de todos lados. Comenzó solo con unas cuantas clientas, pero gracias a su buena onda y a los buenos precios que tiene, hoy en día ya tiene una clientela bien formada, por lo que ya tiene mayores ganancias.
Su meta es poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo y es por ello que se esfuerza mucho. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, y de esa forma poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadoras” committee are from the city of Asunción.  The group is in its fourth loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya's "Entrepreneurial Women" program.  It has 16 members who all work together within an atmosphere of cooperation and mutual respect.  Their wish is to get ahead in life so that they can help their families.

Mercedes is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman and she tells us that she sells different brands of cosmetics which she gets from different places.  She started out working alone and had just a few customers.  However, thanks to the fact that she sells the latest products and offers good prices, she now has a well-established customer base and so makes more profits.

Mercedes' goal is to continue helping her family through her work and so she works very hard.  She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics so that she can fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en: Abigael is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Katia

texts.en:
Katya N. is 43 years old, married, two children. She has high school education. For 15 years she and her husband cultivate field mushrooms.  The base, where they cultivate the mushrooms, is located in the village of Bogorovo, 19 km from Silistra town. 
The area of the base is 40 square meters, on three levels. The fruit-bearing processes occur as impulses that are called “waves” and one wave is completed for 7-8 days. The production period is 60 days, but 80 % of the yield is obtained during the first 45 days. A part of the mushrooms they are wholesaling and the rest they are retailing on rented stand at the cooperative market in Silistra town.

loans.use: Purchase of 1500 bags of mushrooms material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta Wanjiru Njoroge intends to buy high quality seeds and fertilizers in preparation for the coming rainy season.

loans.name: Isabel Cristovão

texts.en:
Isabel Cristovão is 36 years old, born and raised by her parents in the Jangamo Province in Inhambane. She studied until 9th grade. In 1991 she worked in a textile factory, she sewed from her parents’ home and was not able to continue her studying because of the work shifts. Isabel has a son. In 1998 she built a house where she lives with her son and brother. In 2002, the textile factory closed and Isabel had her second son.

When the textile factory closed, Isabel was laid off and received benefits with which she bought a chicken coup and 1000 chicks. Isabel’s cousin referred her to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA where she learned about the possibility of acquiring credit. With her business Isabel supports her family and pys for the education of her sons.

With the loan of 10.000,00MT Isabel plans on expanding her business. Her business has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Isabel and her son, as well as providing chicken meat to her clients especially in the neighborhood of Campoane.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Campoene - Boane Cliente: Isabel Cristovão P. Sector de actividade: Avicultura Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT (400.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de Pintos e Ração Inicio: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Isabel Cristovão de 36 anos de idade, natural de Jangamo Provincia de Inhambane, cresceu sub a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. Estudou apenas até 9ª classe. Em 1991 começou a trabalhar na fábrica de processamento têxtil e fazia trabalhos de costura em casa dos seus Pais e não podia continuar com os seus estudos porque trabalhava por turnos. Teve um parceiro com o qual tem um filho. Em 1998 construiu sua própria casa onde passou a viver com o filho e seu irmão. No ano de 2002 deu-se a falência da texlom e por coincidência teve o seu segundo filho. Com a falência da Empresa onde ela trabalhava teve a sua indemnização que serviu para concluir com a sua obra e construiu um aviário com capacidade de 1.000 pintos.

A partir do ano em curso por indicação da sua prima que é cliente teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo aproximado e solicitado empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Com o rendimento do seu negocio suporta os encargos familiares e as despezas escolares dos seus filhos. Com o emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio, visto que a sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela e o seu filho, coloca frangos perto dos clientes e em particular destaque para todos residentes do bairro de campoane.

loans.use: To produce chickens

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.en:
Cynthia Elizabeth E., 32, is married to Raul Osorio. They have an 8-year old daughter who is studying in third grade. Raul works in a supermarket and Cinthya started a despensa, a small convenience store, to increase family income. She sell mostly basic products such as flour, rice, eggs, and bread.

Before Cynthia had her daughter, she used to work as a sales person and as a maid. However, after the birth of her daughter, she started her despensa at her house in order to stay at home and care for her child at the same time. Together with her husband, they took their first loan with Fundación Paraguaya to buy a freezer and increase their stock of merchandise. During the past year, their business has grown and opened up many more opportunities. Cynthia and her husband are seeking a loan to reinvest in their despensa and buy more merchandise in order to offer a greater selection of products. They hope to increase their income and improve their standard of living. With their loan, they plan to purchase a variety of sugar, tomato sauce, and bread.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, tomato sauce, and bread.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester I. is 45 years, married, and has three children. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. He plants and harvest crops for sale and consumption. He needs the loan US $625 to improve his farm land.

loans.use: To expand my farm land

loans.name: Mehbara

texts.en: Mehbara (her husband is pictured) is 32 years old, lives in Khachmaz town. Her husband  has seven years of experience in this business. This young man builds the houses. Now they need  a loan of $600 to buy necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.use: to  buy necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.name: Lourdes 7 Group

texts.es:
Eloina is 52 years old, married with 6 children, her husband works as a plumber and she has a bakery in her home. Eliona, Along with three members of her group, Dolores, Silvia, and Minerva, work together and share the expenses. In addition some of the members sell the bread house to house to the neighbors in their community. Juana sells gasoline for stoves and vehicles, Guadalupe has a small hardware store in her home and Emilia has a candy store in the area school. Because of the diverse activities of the group each member will use the loan to support their respective businesses in order to increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ELOINA TIENE 52 AÑOS , CASADA CON 6 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO FONTANERO Y ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA PANADERIA EN SOCIEDAD CON TRES INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO DOÑA DOLORES , DOÑA SILVIA Y DOÑA MINERVA ELLAS TRABAJAN EN CONJUNTO Y SE DISTRIBUYEN LOS GASTOS , ADEMAS QUE ALGUNAS DE ELLAS SALEN A VENDER EL PAN DE CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS VECINAS DE SU COMUNIDAD . JUANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GASOLINA PARA ESTUFAS Y VEHICULOS , GUADALUPE TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA FERRETERIA EN SU HOGAR Y EMILIA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE DULCES EN LA ESCUELA DEL SECTOR. POR LA DIVERSIDAD DE LAS ACTIVIDADES DEL GRUPO CADA CUAL HARÁ USO DE SU PRESTAMO APORTANDO A SUS NEGOCIOS RESPECTIVOS PARA INCREMENTAR LAS GANANCIAS

loans.use: Invest in kitchen utensils and merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Limber

texts.es:
Don Limber owns a stall where he sells garments and requires a loan to make his business bloom as he has been short of working capital for the past months and therefore he needs financial support as the income from his business covers his university studies. It is the fourth time he is requesting a loan. He is marked by this institution as a number 1 client as he has always repaid regularly his previous loans. The amount requested will be used to buy merchandise (overalls, t-shirts, turtle necks, etc.). His credit and work record makes it possible for him to request this loan as he has experience in his line of business and thus will earn enough to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: El señor Limber tiene un puesto donde vende ropa y requiere el crédito para reactivar su negocio ya que los últimos meses le falto capital de trabajo por lo que será de gran ayuda este financiamiento pues que con los ingresos de su negocio cubre sus estudios universitarios. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (Buzos, Poleras y otros) Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of overalls, t-shirts, turtle necks and other garments to increase clothing sales.

loans.name: Tzvetan

texts.en: Tzvetan G., his wife and their two kids live in their own house in the village of Rogozen near Vratza. His wife is unemployed and gets social service payments. For two years, Tzvetan has bred six cows on a small farm in the village. Tzvetan produces fodder on his own land. He now needs to buy one more cow.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Budumuli East C B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Cissy M..  She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to open up another bar in a different location.  Cissy is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher for work.  She has 5 children ranging from age 6 to 18 and her children go to school.  Each week, Cissy makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use.  Cissy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add more stock to her bar and the loan was paid back on time.  Cissy is joined in her small group by Jamawa N., Aminah N. and Rose L. .  Jamawa N. has a business selling produce and wants to purchase more sacks of produce.  Aminah N. is currently operating a business selling millet  and wants a loan to start a video recording business. Rose L. sells millet and wants to boost business with the loan.

loans.use: To expand bar business

loans.name: Kossi Lolo

texts.fr:
Mr D. Kossi Lolo was born on June 30, 1972 in Lomé. He is married and is a father of two (2) children. In 2003, he started a copying/office supplies business in the district of Agoè, where he also sells stationery for schools. In 2007, due to the success of his business, he created a second shop in the district of Adidoadé in Lomé. He is asking for his first credit in the amount of $725, which will make it possible for him to buy a new photocopier, a box of toner and paper supplies. With this new purchase, he will be able to better answer the needs of his customers.

Translated by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Monsieur D. Kossi Lolo est né le 30 juin 1972 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a crée en 2003 un centre de traitement de texte, de photocopie et de vente des fournitures scolaires dans le quartier d’Agoè. En 2007 compte tenue de l’évolution de son activité, il a crée un second centre dans le quartier Adidoadé toujours Lomé. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une nouvelle photocopieuse, une boîte d’encre et un paquet de rame. Ainsi avec cette nouvelle acquisition, il pourra bien répondre à la demande de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of photocopiers and toners for copying/office supplies business

loans.name: Muhammad Arif

texts.en: Muhammad Arif, son of A. J., is a 50-year-old man. Muhammad Arif returned to his home country, Afghanistan, several months ago, and he is currently living in the district of Sorkhrood in the Ningarhar province. There are 6 people in his family, yet he is the family member who must support the entire family. Therefore, he opened a retail food shop in the Sorkhrood bazaar. Nevertheless, he wants to improve this business by buying more materials for his shop. Accordingly, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghanis ($625) through AFSG to achieve his goals with respect to his shop.

loans.use: To improve and expand his shop's operations by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Kafe Semiria Group

texts.en: Amidu C. is the Kafe Semiria group leader and is married with 7 children. Fifty years old, Amidu sells second-hand clothes in Magburaka town. With his previous loan, he increased his stock by 3 bails of clothes and generated more income. His business is the major source of income for the family, and he was able to meet his children's educational expenses. He would like to increase his inventory and use the income/profit to invest in agricultural production. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2,800,00 (Le. 700,000 each) to expand their various businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of used clothes and generate more income
